loans.name: Magunga Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Francis is a father of two children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a tea a farmer and works hard to maintain the welfare of his children with proceeds from tea sales.  He has school fee challenges as he can never meet the payments on time without financial support. That’s why, as a parent, Francis found it necessary to seek credit to enable him to ease the burden. He is a member of a village bank where members guarantee one another to repay a loan. He intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a repeat client, 32 years old and divorced from her husband. She is applying for a loan of 600,000 UGX to add stock in her retail shop. Sarah has been getting loans from UGAFODE for three years. She started with capital from the bank but she says her shop has increased and income for the family has doubled. She has managed to support her children and look after her extended family. It has not been easy doing all this as a single mother so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to expand her business. She is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy retail stock

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, a 48-year-old mother of four sons and three daughters, lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a general store selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and many of his relatives patronize it as well. Due to his honesty and impressive voice, he has built up very good relations with his customers. 

Because of that relationship with his customers, his store has become very well-known in town, and he is now having difficulty meeting demand. Therefore, Razia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Razia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventories for the general store.

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en:
Elnara is 36 years old, married, and she has three sons, who study at primary and secondary schools in different grades. She works hard every day for their better well-being, future and education. Elnara began working as a merchant. She sells different things: dishes, clothes, makeup and fancy goods. She would like to increase revenue from the business and improve the living conditions of her children. After all, this business is for the sake of their future.

Elnara's monthly profit from the business is 500 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). Elnara needs to make some investments. A loan of 1,500 AZN will be huge support for this hardworking woman and her family and will enable her to purchase more industrial and household goods wholesale to resell in her store.

loans.use: to purchase more industrial and household goods

loans.name: Fevelyn

texts.en: Fevelyn engages in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables to generate income to support her family. She is 40 years old and has four children in school. Due to high school fees, she needs to increase her income to help her husband support the education of their children. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase more fruit, vegetables and rice to resell. Through this loan, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit, vegetables and rice to resell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 61-year-old widow with five children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF  to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 41 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Myrna aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nat Ywar Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Myothit township, this community currently has 68 village customers, including three CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. The area is mainly covered with sand soil.  Thus, farmers have to rely on expensive fertilizers and compost in order to get high quality crops. Fortunately, the weather is also fine for this year and thus farmers only have to provide enough nutrients and manure for crop production. As most of them are Buddhists, the village must save for regular cultural ceremonies, such as offering provisions to monks. 

The new loan will help borrowers purchase fertilizer and compost to improve the farms' soil conditions.  As livestock is their secondary income source, villagers raise cows, goats, pigs and chickens at their homes. For next season, the new loan would be invested to buy farming inputs and high-quality seeds such as groundnuts and mung beans. 

Pictured above are the committee members from the Nat Ywar Village CBO: U Hla, U Kyaw, and Daw Aye. Included in the photo (farthest to the right) is U Hla, a 38-year-old father of two daughters. His children are studying at the primary school in the village. He will use his new loan to buy groundnut and green gram seeds and fertilizer for next season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost to improve sandy soil conditions

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell lumber business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional wood to sell for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. Teresita earns additional income from a general store.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood to sell

loans.name: Byabasiita Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Edith is a hard-working married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in farming as her main source of income though she has other side businesses like pineapple selling to earn extra income. She started this business to support her family and improve the family's standard of living. She faces a challenge of seasonal changes that affect her agriculture. She has a vision of constructing a big permanent house. 

She is requesting a loan to buy manure, mulches and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy manure, mulches and seedlings.

loans.name: Terina

texts.en:
Terina is 44 years old and married.

She has a buy-and-sell lumber business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables and running a general store. Terina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional wood to sell for her lumber business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Terina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional lumber to sell

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad,  es un señor padre de 4 hijos de las edades de 20, 17, 14 y 15 años de edad, de los cuales 3 estudian y el mayor trabaja junto a él. José comenta  que él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que cuando él era pequeño las escuelas estaban lejos de su casa y debía de viajar en autobús y su familia no tenía recursos económicos para darle el estudio, entonces su padre se lo llevaba a trabajar. 

Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  en su casa habitan seis personas, sus cuatro hijos, su esposa y él.
	
José se dedica a trabajar de jornalero en una finca de café, él siempre trabajaba de jornalero debido a que su padre lo mandaba a trabajarle a otras personas,  entonces fue así como él fue obteniendo experiencia, él ya tiene 15 años de trabajar en las fincas de café; es ahí donde él puede obtener ingresos económicos para darle manutención a su hogar, él trabaja ocho horas de  siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde pero cuando hay abundante cosecha trabaja más tiempo, pero dice que le pagan más por las horas extras. Además,  hace sus propias siembras de maíz y frijol comenta que recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y el apoyo de su esposa.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar semilla, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas, preparar la tierra. Debido a que en las siembras anteriores no obtuvo cosecha y tuvo perdida debido a la sequía y nuevamente volverá a hacer siembras.
José planea para un futuro poder mejorar sus cultivos, poder expandir más sus siembras, poder arreglar su casa ampliarla más para poder tener más espacio y su familia pueda estar más cómodamente, también desea poder tener un mejor empleo para  ganar más dinero y así poder cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old and the father of four children, ages 20, 17 14, and 15.  Three of them attend school and the oldest one works with him.  Jose says that he didn’t have the opportunity to go to school becasue the schools were far from home when he was a boy and he would have had to take the bus and his parents didn’t have the financial resources to provide him with an education.  His father would instead take him to work.

His wife cares for the home.  Six people live there; his four children, his wife, and he.

Jose works as a laborer at a coffee farm and has always done this becasue his father would send him to work for other people.  This is how he gained experience and he has been working on coffee farms for 15 years.  This is how he earns an income with which to support his household.  He works eight hours a day, from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm but works longer when there is a bigger harverst.  He is paid for the extra hours.  He also raises his own corn and bean crops and says that his children help him and his wife supports him.

He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, and to prepare the land.  Given that the previous crops did not harvest and he had a loss given the droubt.  He will begin again.  Jose plans to improve his crops in the future so he can expand them and be able to fix up his house, making it bigger with more room so his family can be more comfortable.  He also wants to have a better job so he can earn more money and be able to cover all his household needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Kyanaisoke Tweheyo  Group

texts.en: Rose is a 55-year-old divorced mother of eight children who has been farming since 2008 in Kagadi Uganda. She grows food and has a surplus through increased productivity which she sells through wide marketing. Despite her honesty, she is challenged by competition from other food suppliers. She is requesting credit to buy ground nuts for planting. She is a member of Kyanaisoke Tweheyo Group where each member guarantees the other to get and repay a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts for planting

loans.name: Buseesa Farmers Group

texts.en: Deo, who has been selling produce since 2002 to earn money for school fees for his 5 children, is a hardworking married Ugandan aged 37. He plans to improve his business to earn more money for school fees, despite too much sunshine leading to wilting of crops and scarcity of stock. Deo intends to use the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds for planting. He is a member of Buseesa Farmers Group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds for planting

loans.name: Jenny Maribel

texts.es: Jenny de 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con sus hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora y responsable, desde hace varios años posee una sala de belleza ubicada en su lugar de habitación, posee mucha clientela por su buen  trabajo,  con lo que gana de su negocio logra solventar  las necesidades de su hogar, Jenny solicita un crédito para la compra de mechas para el cabello, sombras, gelatina, maquillaje, tintes para el cabello, shampoo, decolorantes, etc.  y así poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jenny, 36 years old, is a single mother who lives in a rented house with her children. She is a hard-working and responsible person. For the past several years she has had a beauty salon located in her house. She has many customers due to her good work. With what she earns from her business, she manages to cover the household necessities. Jenny asks for a loan to purchase hair highlights, eye shadows, gel, make-up, hair dyes, shampoo, bleaching agents, etc. and, in this way, be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase hair highlights, eye shadows, gel, make-up, hair dyes, shampoo, bleaching agents, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Conchita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Conchita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Philisila

texts.en: Philisila is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as future oriented. Philisila operates a farm where she grows crops. She identifies her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have enough food production. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running a rickshaw transportation business for the last few years. However, for the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. This has resulted in his inability to generate a significant income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help her husband continue his business. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is age 27, and married with two children, ages 4 and 3. He owns a shop of phones, and makes extra income through his salary and farming. He started business to generate extra income for his household. His major challenge is competition. 

He is hardworking, and will use the loan to pay the school fees for his sister at the university.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his sister at the university.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 38-year-old man, married with two children, and he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He specifically deals in the buying and selling of tea, with the tea factory as his client in his area. His other source of income is a motorcycle (‘boda boda’) transport. He started the business in order to generate income for his family. He is hardworking, and hopes to improve his financial stability in the future, but mainly faces a challenge of price fluctuation.  

With this loan, he intends to buy tea for selling.

loans.use: to buy tea for selling.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a 49-year-old single mother with five children who lives in Kyenjojo. She owns a boutique, a business she started to meet her family's needs. Filomena also earns an additional income from tailoring. 

Filomena is a hardworking businesswoman. She hopes to build a house and operate her business from a central point. She is faced with business challenges such as a small capital base and the high costs of transportation. Filomena intends to use the loan to buy women’s wear clothing for sale.

loans.use: to buy women’s wear clothing for sale.

loans.name: G.s El Porvenir#2 Group

texts.es:
El señor Santos Heremildo vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación, su actividad principal es la es pastor de la iglesia evangélica y también se dedica a la caficultura y a sacar oro ya que cuenta con su propia draga es una persona muy reconocida por su por su honradez, cuenta con más de varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad económica.
Don Santos Heremildo esta solicitado el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar para su vivienda porque en comunidad no hay servicio de luz eléctrica, espera que esta inversión le contribuya a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia y a su vez le vendrá a cumplir sus sueños de tener luz en su hogar.
Don Santos Heremildo su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su familia y con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.
Don Moisés es pastor de una iglesia evangélica.
Don Luis se dedica a la caficltura.

 Trojes, Honduras - Julio 2014
texts.en:
Señor Santos Heremildo lives with his wife, in his house. His main occupation is being pastor of the evangelical church, and he also devotes himself to coffee growing and to gold mining, as he has his own dredge. He is a person who is renowned for his honesty, and he has been devoting himself to this type of economic activity for many years. 

Don Santos Heremildo is requesting the loan for the purchase of a solar system for his home, because there is no electric service in the community. He hopes that this investment will help to somewhat improve his quality of life and that of his family. For his part, he will achieve his dream of having electricity in his house. 

Don Santos Heremildo's dreams are to provide his children with a good professional education and to improve the living conditions for himself and for his family. With the support that he is receiving from the loan, he will be able to achieve his dreams.

Don Moises is pastor of an evangelical church. Don Luis grows coffee.

Trojes, Honduras—July, 2014

loans.use: to purchase a solar system for his home.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Cecilio tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijo de 17 años, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona rural de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, a comunidad esta en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cecilio se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de borregos, desde hace más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio. Él solicita préstamo para alimento de engorde para sus animales y también para la compra de accesorios para su baño; ya que esta construyendo su casa para darle a su familia mayor comodidad y por ende una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecillo is 53 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 17-year-old son in a home of his own.  They live in a large community in the Cayalti province and he has good personal and professional references from his neighbors.  The community is located in the Chiclayo province, within the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Cecillo raises and sells sheep and has been in this business for more than ten years.  He is asking for a loan to buy feed for his animals.  He also wants to buy accessories for his bathroom, since he is building a house so he can provide greater comfort and a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Daisy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Daisy has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 43 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. Riza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a manicure and pedicure service in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Riza has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Riza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Amuram

texts.en:
Amuram is a married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in buying and selling hides and skins as his main source of income; he is based in a rural areas in Kyenjojo. He also has operated a butchery, slaughtering cows in the market stall for many years for additional income. Amuram began the business in order to improve his standards of living and educate his children. He mainly faces a challenge of price fluctuations and competition for clients. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy more hides and skins to sell.

loans.use: to buy more hides and skins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chest of drawers and a 21¨ TV set.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, and sand

loans.name: Houriya

texts.en:
Houriya is a 69-year-old single lady, who has worked in agriculture and a baking business since childhood. Houriya is a hardworking woman who puts so much effort to improve her businesses in order to make a living and cover her expenses. Houriya lives in her bakery because she lost her small house during the July 2006 war in South Lebanon, and unfortunately she couldn't afford to rebuild it.

Houriya has an excellent reputation in her region, especially with her special baked Saj bread and Manakish, in addition to her agriculture business. She works hard to develop her business, but her income isn't enough to let her pay for big amounts of raw material to get special offers. For this reason, Houriya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise through buying extra raw materials necessary for her business development through increasing her production and developing her living. Houriya is working hard for stability, and she will make sure to achieve it.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise by buying extra raw materials necessary for her business development and increase in production

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su esposo esta en estados unidos pero le ayuda económicamente, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y joyería, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con lo que gana de sus ventas y la ayuda que recibe de su esposo logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  Ana solicita un crédito para la compra de perfumería, lociones, cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores, desodorantes,  etc. y así poder continuar con sus ventas  y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, age 48, lives in her own house with her children.  Her husband is in the United States but he helps her financially.  For the past five years she has worked in personal product and jewelry sales.  Thanks to the quality of her products and her good prices, she has a large clientele.  With what she earns from her sales, as well as the help she receives from her husband, she manages to pay for the household needs and expenses.  

Ana is asking for a loan to buy fragrances, lotions, creams, shampoos, conditioners, deodorants, etc.  In this way she can continue with her sales and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fragrances, lotions, creams, shampoos, conditioners, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: Patricia es separada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Este es el grupo “Paz  y Bien” conformada por 07 socios responsables y unidos.  A sus 40 años Patricia  ha llegado a cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y mantener su negocio. Actualmente Ella se dedica a la venta de cebiche en un lugar muy concurrente. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de pescado, camote, limón y cancha. Su mayor deseo es contar con un local propio ya que le permite dar un mejor servicio a sus comensales. El grupo “Paz y Bien”  está agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Patricia es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste chompa negro.
texts.en: Patricia is separated and has two children.  This is the “Paz y Bien” group, made up of seven responsible and united members.  At age 40, Patricia has managed to achieve some of her dreams, such as supporting her children with their educations and keeping her business.  Currently she sells ceviche at a nearby location.  She is asking for this loan to buy fish, sweet potatoes, lemon, and other things.  Her greatest desire is to have her own shop so she can provide better service to her customers.  The “Paz y Bien” group is grateful to the Kiva lenders and is committed to continuing to work well.  Patricia is the second from the left, wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in the town of Kapan in the Syunik region. She has been involved in beekeeping for many years. Her husband is an army officer and also supports his wife with beekeeping.

They gather good quality and tasty honey which they sell in local markets. Susanna has applied for this loan of USD 2,500 to be able to purchase 10 beehives and 15 colonies of bees. She asks lenders to support her with the loan and help her to make her agribusiness more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for 10 beehives and 15 colonies of bees

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 30 and is married with five children aged between one and 12. Three of these children attend school. He deals in second-hand clothes and gets additional income from a retail shop. He began his businesses to meet daily income needs. His main challenge is limited capital. He is a hardworking man and needs a loan to buy both clothes and merchandise for the retail shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes for his clothing business and merchandise for his retail shop.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a resident of Capiz, Philippines. She is 46 years old, and she is happily married to Manuel. God has blessed them with children – all of them are still studying. Life, indeed, is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well, and they are helping each other working for their family.

Vivian owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community. The store is connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, five pesos' worth of cooking oil, an egg, and other items. Vivian gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and sells it per piece for a higher price to make profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, Vivian is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Vivian wants her business to continue to grow, expand and prosper. She dreams of her children finishing their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is thirty-nine years old. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children, and all attend school.

Juliet is a hardworking woman who desires to educate her children to university level. She grows maize and cabbages for commercial purposes. However, seasonal changes affect her business. She is acquiring a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is 62 years old and widowed with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

Ida has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending. Ida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen has a produce store primarily for maize in Hoima, Uganda. He is 61 years old, married with ten children. He earns more income from his salary. His dream is educating his children, however weather changes are a hindrance to his agriculture business. Stephen will use the loan to harvest maize to sell.

loans.use: to  harvest maize to sell.

loans.name: Jose Evidier

texts.es:
José es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo café; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Liborina, Antioquia.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y la compra de semillas de café.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a country man, humble and hardworking with the drive and tenacity that sets men and women from the country apart.

He is a man with an entrepreneurial mindset and since he was very young, learnt all the jobs of the country like farming and animal husbandry, so much so that now he has his own coffee plantation; and he sells his products in the municipal market square of Liborina, Antioquia.

This person aims to increase his crops and improve his current crop and that's why he needs the aid of a loan - for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and purchasing coffee seeds.

This loan will give him the opportunity to progress as an entrepreneur and as a person, also to increase his income and continue providing for his family.

All he wants is to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Con la enseñanzas de su madre y un espíritu emprendedor hace 30 años el señor Albeiro inicio una empresa de confección a terceros, ayudado por su madre y su hija de 17 años de edad, consolidando una empresa familiar en la cual los tres velan por el hogar y por los interés de su familia. 

Con el ánimo de iniciar una línea propia de ropa el señor Albeiro desea realizar un crédito para la compra de maquina fileteadora con la que podrá tener agilidad en la producción sin descuidar sus clientes.

El crédito será de gran ayuda pues podrán contar con maquinaria y posiblemente podrán ofrecer un nuevo empleo y seguir progresando como familia, creando un lazo fuerte para progresar y tener una empresa firme y sostenible en el tiempo.
texts.en:
With his mother's teaching and his enterprising spirit, some 30 years ago Albeiro began an enterprise that makes tailored-made clothes, assisted by his mother and his 17-year-old daughter. They are consolidating a family enterprise in which the three of them take care of their home and family interests. 

With the spirit of initiating his own line of clothing, Albeiro wishes to take out a loan to purchase a serging machine to provide greater agility in production and better care for his customers.

The loan will be a great help; he will have proper machinery and it will be possible to hire a new employee and continue the family's advance, progressing through stronger links and, in time, having a strong and sustainable enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a serging machine that overcasts seams on garments and to employ another worker.

loans.name: Eliander David

texts.es:
Toda persona tiene sueños y metas en la vida y siempre trabaja apuntando a realizar sus sueños, el señor Eliander es una persona muy trabajadora del campo, luchadora y emprendedor que inicio su negocio de venta de bebidas y un espacio de esparcimiento en una vereda donde los campesinos tiene la oportunidad de reunirse con vecinos y compartir un buena cerveza y dispersarse.

Eliander ha tenido buenos resultados y quiere seguir trabajando en su negocio por eso quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar una mesa de billar y ofrecerles a sus vecinos un entretenimiento sano y divertido. 

Eliander es un hombre de 30 años separado, que trabaja 12 horas al día, separado con un hijo que sueña con legalizar los papeles de su casa.
texts.en:
Everyone has dreams and goals in their life and is always working to realize his or her dreams. Eliander is a very hard-working person and a fighter from the country. He is an entrepreneur. He started a business selling beverages and opening a recreational space where farmers have the opportunity to get together with neighbors and share good beer and relax.

Eliander has had very good results and he wants to continue working on his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase a billiard table to offer his neighbors some healthy and fun entertainment. 

Eliander is a separated, 30 year old man. He works 12 hours a day. He is separated with a son and dreams of making his house's documents legal.

loans.use: purchase a billiard table to offer his neighbors healthy entertainment and a place to socialize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers, watering tools, seeds, and some pesticides to end some plagues on his crops. He also needs to maintain his harvest and prepare the land for a new season.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia una aguerrida, luchadora y una verdadera mujer de admirar que a sus 68 años de edad trabaja y lucha por sus tierras, no se las deja quitar y batallara a muerte por los terrenos que la vieron nacer y han tenido sus mejores años de vida en ellos. 

Es madre viuda con 6 hijos los cuales levanto y crio gracias  a su actividad agricultora, sueña con poder legalizar sus tierras pues quiere tener una vejez tranquila y gozar de sus años de vida en sus campos. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como abonos, riegos, fertilizantes, y esterilizadores, para mantener sus cultivos.

Por favor ayuden a la señora Sonia es una mujer de una avanzada edad que no se quiere dejar quitar sus terrenos pues está en trámite de legalizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Sonia is a courageous, determined woman to admire. At 68 years old, she works and fights for her lands. She will not give up and she will fight until death for the land where she was born and has had the best years of her life.

She is a widow with six children. She was able to raise them thanks to her farming. She dreams about being able to authenticate her land since she wants to have a tranquil old age and enjoy her life on her land. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies like fertilizers and irrigation equipment in order to maintain her crops. 

Please help Sonia, she is a woman of advanced age who does not want to leave her land since she is in the process of authenticating her land.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Walberto Antonio

texts.es:
Hace 12 años el señor Walberto junto con su pareja inicio una actividad agrícola con la ilusión de poder vivir juntos y tener un medio de sustento para construir una familia y tenerla en condiciones dignas sin que pasen hambre, estudiando y con buen alimentación, hoy en día tiene 3 hijos de 10, 9, 3 años de edad a los cuales quiere mejorar la calidad de vida y que mejor manera que invertir en el terreno que les ayudo a construir la familia.  

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como abonos, riegos para mantener la tierra y buscando un mejor progreso para sus hijos y lo más importante darle solución al tema de legalizar su parcela. 

Con el crédito podrá tener una mejor producción con mayor cantidad y no perderá insumos que por lo general son acabados pro el clima o por alguna plaga restándole ganancias al productor.
texts.en:
Twelve years ago, Walberto and his partner started a farming business. They were looking forward to living together and starting a family, and they wanted to create a source of income that would allow them to raise children in decent conditions: that they wouldn't go hungry, but go to school and be well fed. Today he has three children, who are ages ten, nine, and three. He wants to improve their quality of life and believes the best way to achieve this is to invest in the land that enabled him to start his family.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies like fertilizer and irrigation in order to upkeep the land. He wants his children to have a better future, and his main concern is resolving the issue of legalizing his plot of land. This loan will allow him to increase production volume and to avoid the losses that are generally caused by weather or pests and that cut profits for farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and irrigation supplies.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
15, 14, 12, 9, 4, 3 son las edades de los hijos del señor Juan quien junto con su esposa inicio hace 10 años las actividades del campo, aprendidas empíricamente practicando y con ayuda de amigos y familiares que le orientaban en la labor. 

Junto con su esposa trabaja diariamente entre 8 y 10 horas y los dos apuntan a un mismo objetivo y es algo común entre los agricultores el Cuales s poder legalizar sus cultivos, y mejorar la calidad de vida pues su numerosa familia es difícil de mantener y más sabiendo que quiere brindarles la oportunidad de estudio a todos por lo que necesita más ingresos.

Necesita comprar insumos, como abonos, riegos, fertilizantes y esterilizadores para sus cultivos por tal razón solicita un crédito pues no posee el capital neto para comprar estos costosos insumos.
texts.en:
Juan's children are ages fifteen, fourteen, twelve, nine, four, and three. He and his wife started farming ten years ago and learned through practice and experience with help from friends and relatives who would give their guidance.

He works alongside his wife between eight and ten hours each day. They both share the same goal, which is common among farmers: to be able to legalize their crops and improve their quality of life, since it is difficult to support a large family, especially when you want all your children to be able to go to school. That is the reason why he needs more income.

He needs to buy supplies like fertilizer, irrigation items, and sterilizers for his crops. He is requesting this loan to do this because he doesn't have enough net capital to purchase these costly supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation supplies, and sterilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products such as make-up, perfume, and hand cream, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy creams, make-up, hand lotion, etc.

loans.name: Ana Esperanza

texts.es: Ana de 33 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña como  supervisora y vendedora de productos por catalogo actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella es madre soltera. Ana desea mejorar su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía es de lámina, la cual a su vez está deteriorada, algo que no da mucha seguridad, por lo que Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: Polines, hierro y lámina galvanizada, para hacer un poco más segura su vivienda y proteger a si la integridad de sus pertenencias y de su hijo.
texts.en: Ana is 33 years old and lives in a home of her own with her 8-year-old son.  She is a very hardworking woman who works as a supervisor and salesperson of products via catalog, which allows her to support her son because she is a single mother.  Ana wants to make improvements to her home, which we can see in the image that it’s made of metal and its deteriorated and doesn’t provide much security.  Ana is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, to buy beams, iron and galvanized metal in order to make her house safer and protect her and her son’s possessions.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 55 years old and blessed with nine children. Due to financial hardship, Evangeline is aiming to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income to meet her family's necessities. She wants to acquire more stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy more stocks of bananas, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, beans, eggplants, cabbages, onions, and squash to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, beans, eggplants, cabbages, onions, and squash to resell

loans.name: Ma. Agnes

texts.en:
Ma. Agnes is 42 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.,

She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Ma. Agnes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Sandra works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Sandra would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Forty-year-old Alfred is acquiring a loan to construct himself a permanent structure of rentals. He lives in Hoima, Uganda and is married with four children aged between 17 and 8; all attend school. He is in the carpentry business and says competition is a major setback. As a shrewd businessman, Alfred desires to grow his workshop.

loans.use: to construct himself a permanent structure of rentals.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cresencia has been in this business for 2 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for the maintenance of her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel works hard to support her family. Maricel is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle. Maricel has been in this business for one year. In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Shaban is an old client, age 33. He is a married man with three children and is a resident of Rwemiyaga, Ruhaama, Ntungamo district. He is applying for a loan of 500,000 shillings to clear his land for planting tomatoes and to clear his banana plantation. He will also buy a spraying machine for tomatoes. He thinks if he can engage in agriculture extensively, he can increase his income for the family and possibly educate his children in better schools. He did not go to school, and yet most people are surviving majorly because they are educated.

loans.use: To hire labourers and buy a spraying machine

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem, age 30, is a married woman. 

She is a hardworking and brave mother, who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother she wants to provide better facilities to her children. This is the reason she is doing extraordinarily hard work to keep her children smiling.

She has been sewing clothes since the birth of her two children when she observed that her husband was failing to provide all necessities to her children. She decided to start tailoring work at home and now she is sewing the clothes of her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching so she wants to buy a juki machine. Professional persons use this machine for tailoring because its speed is very good.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community persons. 

Tasleem has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been operating an auto rickshaw business for many years. For many days now his rickshaw has not been working properly even with regular usage. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Mehvara

texts.ru:
Мехвара жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведена со своим мужем  и имеет на иждевении двоих детей. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сама Мехвара живёт со свими детьми в сельской местности, в небольшом домике. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы её выдали замуж. Она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Мехвара занимается своим бизнесом. Она занимается продажей женской одежды на дому. В своём доме она сделала из одной комнаты небольшой магазин, где и продаёт свой товар. От данного бизнеса она получает хороший доход. Также её дочь помогает ей, она шьёт своими руками разные женские принадлежности и потом продаёт эти изделия. Сейчас Мехвара собирается выдать замуж свою дочь. Она готовиться к свадебному мероприятию. Для этого нужно купить очень много вещей для приданного своей дочери. Но у Мехвары не хватает денежных средств, которые она накопил для свадьбы. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для свадьбы своей дочери. Мехвара очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mehvara is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She is divorced from her husband and has two dependent children. She appealed to Arvand when she first found out it was possible to get a loan. She and her children live in a small house in the country. She does not have a college degree because her family had financial difficulties and could not send her to university. Immediately after graduating from high school she got married. She does the housework and raises her children.  

In order to have enough money to buy food, Mehvara runs a business. She sells women's clothes at home. She has made one room in her home into a shop where she sells her goods. She makes a good income from this. Also, her daughter helps her. She herself sews different accessories for women and then sells these products. Now Mehvara going to marry off her daughter. She is preparing for the wedding. To do this, she must buy many things for the dowry. However, Mehvara has not saved enough money for a wedding. So, she turned to Arvand for a loan and wants to get a loan to pay for a dowry for her daughter's wedding. Mehvara is hoping for a positive result, and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: pay her daughter's dowry.

loans.name: Kijiwe Samli Group

texts.en: Anna, who is in her late 30s, is single and has two children, who are still at school. She has been running a grocery store for ten years. She works from 8 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly income. This will be Anna’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to open another grocery store, and she bought drinks for both stores. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva’s support. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to pay back the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy whisky and canned beer. She dreams of owning a wholesale drinks shop. Anna will share this loan with her loan group, "KIJIWE SAMLI," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy whisky and canned beer for her grocery store.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en:
Akmal was born in 1993. He is a very hardworking and industrious young man. He comes from a rural area.

Akmal is a student in the fourth year at Medical University of Samara Russia Federation. He studies well and dreams of being a highly qualified doctor. Akmal lives in a hostel at his university. He comes to Tajikistan for summer holidays. 

Akmal must pay for his school year but his parents do not have enough money for it. Akmal is asking for a loan of 2100 USD to pay the tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Vicky Ann

texts.en: Vicky Ann is 27 years old, married, and blessed with only one child. Having no other source of income, she is engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables to help her husband in gaining income. She aims to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy their daily necessities and finance the education of her child, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell. She is hoping that she will obtain her loan request to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran is 52 years old and a married man who has only one dependent child. He lives in a community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is a plant seller and his wife is a farmer. Ran uses a motorbike, which is attached with a cart, to carry all types of his plants and goes everywhere to sell them. So far, he has been involved in this business for six years with the average income is USD 5.00 a day. 

Ran wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its fixtures. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Anabel Liliana

texts.es:
Anabel Liliana tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa propia con esposo y sus cuatros hijos, los cuales tienen 15, 13, 06 y 03 años de edad respectivamente, ella cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Anabel Liliana se dedica a la venta de ropa, en la zonas de la aviación y en Oyotún, desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, además su esposo se dedica a los labores agricolas. Ella solicita préstamo es para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercaderia, para poder diversificar su stock y también desea destinar parte del préstamo en el techado de su casa, lo que va a apoyar a la seguridad de su vivienda, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anabel Liliana is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her spouse and four children, ages 3, 6, 13, and 15.  Her neighbors all have good things to say about Liliana.  She lives in a community working in business, farming and raising cattle, located in Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Anal Liliana has earned a living selling clothing in the area around the airport and in Oyotun for about the last 10 years.  Besides this, her husband works at farming.  She is asking for a loan to invest in buying a larger amount of merchandise, to be able to diversify her stock.  She always wants to use part of the loan money for the roof of their house, to make their dwelling more secure, improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of merchandise and diversify her stock

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Estela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en: Paquita is a woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Paquita is 65 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a upholstery shop in the Philippines. Paquita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more equipment and material for the business. Paquita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Paquita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment and material for her business.

loans.name: Nikki Rose

texts.en: Nikki Rose is 34 years old and has four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Nikki Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nikki Rose would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Belma

texts.en:
Belma is 45 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.  Belma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Belma has been in this business for one year. 

In the future Belma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Meet Pauline, a mother of three lovely children from a very remote village in Tambalal, Litein area of Kenya. For the past six years, she has been engaged in mixed farming: selling milk and growing tea and a variety of food crops. Although this humble mother has been making profit through selling crops, she has been having poor harvests because of lack of proper farm implements. She is seeking a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy good farm implements. Through the loan, she will double her production because she will buy good quality fertilizer and good seeds. Modern farming practices entail using good fertilizer and good seeds to reap more harvest, and Pauline is on the right track. Profits from an increased harvest will be used to repay the loan and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows to complete the renovation of his house.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 42 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Virgie has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Virgie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is 39 year-old-woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband makes shutters for buildings. Her husband needs raw materials, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing accessories to improve his shutter work and generate more income for the financial support of his family. Therefore, Shamim applied for a loan from this Kiva Field Partner for money to support her husband's shuttering work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shutter work.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 44-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. Her husband also assists his son by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, where he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health services. Her son has been learning the art of dealing with the customers, the products, and rats. She thinks that now her son can handle all his affairs alone, so she has decided to set up a separate general store for her son. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan for her son’s store from Kiva's Field Partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy an initial stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, soap and biscuits. She is an honest, regular, client of BRAC Pakistan. She in her fifth loan cycle, with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva’s Field Partner BRAC

loans.use: to buy inventory to set up a new general store for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mulch and organic manure.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 2 kids. Her husband is a schoolteacher but his earnings from this job aren’t enough. The main source of income for the family is farming. Dilara grows and sells seasonal vegetables such as pumpkin, cucumber, potatoes and so on. She has been growing vegetables and selling them at a local bazaar for 17 years and has good experience in this area. Her monthly income is about 500AZN.

Vegetables are in high demand in Azerbaijan because people like to use them for fresh salads and delicious national dishes. They attend local groceries and buy their fresh and tasty vegetables. They know that vegetables raised in private gardens are always fresh and without pesticides. Dilara needs money to cover the family’s necessities. She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to buy quality fertilizers to increase her harvest.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizers to increase her harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 19 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su grupo familiar, ella es muy trabajadora y responsable, buena persona, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 3 años, el negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia,  con lo que gana de sus ventas logra ayudar a su familia en lo que necesita, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijol, jugos, gaseosa, quesillo, chicharrón  y otros productos para el negocio, para darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The client is 19 years old and lives in a rented house with her family.  She is very hard-working, responsible, and a good person.  She started working in the sale of pupusas (a stuffed corn-tortilla dish) three years ago.  Her business is located close to her home, and with the profit from her sales she is able to help her family with what they need.  

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn, beans, juices, sodas, fresh cheese, pork rinds, and other goods for her business, in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, juices, sodas, fresh cheese, pork rinds, and other goods for her business

loans.name: Shohista

texts.en: Shohista is 23 years old; she is not married and she lives with her parents. She is an entrepreneur. Shohista has been busy with buying and selling women’s underwear in a local market. She has been selling women’s underwear for more than five years. She has a store in a local market. Shohista manages this business alone. She works hard and tries to develop the business. She dreams to be successful in business and earn enough money, because she wants to live in comfortable house and also to help  orphan children. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy women’s underwear for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear to sell and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a single, Palestinian refugee, born in 1991, who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She learned hairdressing in a specialized institute. Three years ago, Samah started her own hairdressing business inside her house, which helped her to prove herself as a professional in this domain. 

Today, she is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, to improve her work by buying more professional equipment that will help her develop her working skills and provide her customers with better services. This Loan is very important to Samah, because it will help her achieve her dream of opening her future beauty salon, and building a better future.

loans.use: to buy more professional equipment that will help her to develop her working skills and to provide better services.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Мутабар добросовестная женщина. Она пережила много трудностей в своей жизни. Ее муж умер рано, и она сама вырастила своих детей. Мутабар последние 4 года назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей женской обувью и носков. Она торгует на местном рынке. Мутабар с бизнесом справляется одна. Она покупает оптом и реализует в розницу. Мутабар нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки женской обуви и носков. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mutabar is a conscientious woman. She has experienced a lot of difficulties in her life. Her husband died early and she raised her children alone. Four years ago, Mutabar started a business buying and selling women's shoes and socks. She sells in the local market. Mutabar runs the business alone. She buys wholesale and sells retail. Mutabar needs financial support since she wants to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy women's shoes and socks. She's waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: buy women's shoes and socks.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely, age 27, is married to a construction worker and blessed with one child. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of 1,000 PHP daily. Her net income is usually spent on their food expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds she would like to secure a loan amounting to 13,000 PHP to purchase noodles, canned goods, sugar, salt, biscuits, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve, grow, and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods, sugar, salt, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sokkim

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Sokkim, 33, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, she is a lovely mother of two depended children who are enrolling in a local school. By operating a farming business on a small cassava plantation, she can earn around 5.00 USD a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, she has been involved in this career for fifteen years.

To keep her cassava growing well with more yield, Sokkim is going to use natural fertilizers in her farmland. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process this season. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can make her cassava grow better and provide more benefit to her. 

She thanks to all the lenders for their generous behaviour.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers for her cassava farm.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She is a farmer with her spouse as a partner in managing their business. Together, they plant and harvest rice to sell to traders.

Marilyn needs to improve her farming practices. So, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides used in rice farming. This will help improve crop growth. Marilyn will also use a part of her loan to pay laborers who help in the farming business. Someday, Marilyn hopes to keep improving her crop production so she can save funds for education and for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to use in rice farming

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
This is Rolinda, 50 years old and a resident of Capiz, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

She operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a normal family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Rolinda hopes to prosper through her business and she desires to expand soon. She hopes for good health and a better future for her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул, 49 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование - высшее, по специальности педагог по кыргызскому языку. С 2001 года стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес Анаркул начала с 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Анаркул достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 16,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Анаркул имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 4 лошади и 15 овец. Также арендуют землю, где выращивают эспарцет и картофель. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и постройку сарая. Доходы от кредита Анаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Anarkul is 49 years old, married, and has three children.She has a higher education as a Kyrgyz language teacher. Since 2001, she has worked in animal husbandry and farming. Anarkul started her business with 12,000 KGS. Thanks to her industrious and diligent work, Anarkul has made great strides in the development of her farm and makes a monthly profit of 16,000 KGS. Currently, Anarkul has three milk cows, four horses and fifteen sheep. Also, she leases land where she grows potatoes and sainfoin. Her spouse and children help on the farm. In order to further develop the farm, Anarkul approached the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 100,000 KGS) to buy livestock and build a shed. Anarkul plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing the number of livestock on her farm.

loans.use: purchase cattle and build a barn

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 47-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Evelyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 56 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. Vilma has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel es emprendedor y esmerado por realizar lo que se propone. 

Él desde muy pequeño realiza esta labor. Trabajo que aprendió de su padre quien muy esmerado le enseño a su hijo como era el trabajo de la agricultura. Miguel no pudo  seguir estudiando por sus escasos recursos económicos. Su hijo mayor es quien le apoya en la siembra de los granos.  Juntos emprenden cada mañana para el campo a iniciar su siembra que en esta temporada es cuando es el momento de aprovechar debido a las lluvias seguidas que hay en el municipio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono, gramoxone y otros elementos para destruir plagas.

Miguel quiere  a futuro ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales, que ellos puedan alcanzar la debida educación que él por su situación económica  no pudo obtener. Él sabe que para eso tiene que esforzarse cada día más Y seguir trabajando muy arduamente.
texts.en:
Miguel is enterprising and exacting about achieving everything he sets out to.

He has done this job since he was very young.  He learned it from his father, who very painstakingly taught his son agricultural work.  Miguel was unable to continue attending school because he lacked the economic resources.

Miguel's oldest son helps him plant the grain.  They set out together for the field every morning to start their planting, which in this season is the time to take advantage of the town's non-stop rain.

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy soil amendments, gramoxone, and other pesticides.

Miguel wants his children to become professionals in the future and to achieve the education he wasn't able to because of his economic situation.  He knows that, because of this, he has to work harder every day.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, gramoxone, and other pesticides

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 37, mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by trade, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for the last seven years. Her husband offers seasonal fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize his sales of the vegetables. So, Shabana requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for resale

loans.name: Johar

texts.en:
Johar is a 49-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of her children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
For a long time he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body because he is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle, and therefore unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy the new body as soon as possible. Due to the lack of money, however, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body.

Therefore, Johar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her son to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. She is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her son's business.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en: Farah is a housewife and lives in Rawalpindi with her family. She is 32 years old and is the mother of four children. She has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her husband pay for the maintenance of a taxi. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. He has been driving a taxi for the last seven years. He is an honest and hardworking man. He works day and night to make sure that their daily needs are met. As the income they get from driving the taxi only covers their daily expenses, they are unable to save money. After receiving this loan, her husband will be able to repair his taxi. Farah and her husband want their children to get formal education and have a better future.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy weed-killers, manure, seeds, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Despite their hardships, Diana has the determination to uplift their poor status of living. She is 26 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She is engaged in a vegetable vending business to supplement her husband's income and would like a 7,000 PHP loan to buy more fruits, vegetables, and rice to resell in the local community. 

Being a diligent mother, she believes that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and rice to resell.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: To generate income, Maricris engages in a vegetable vending business within their community. She is 21 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She wants to improve her business and make it more profitable to generate sufficient income. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to access financial assistance of PHP 7,000 to buy more bananas, squash, tomatoes, bitter melons, okra, beans and eggplants to resell. She is hoping that someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, squash, tomatoes, bitter melons, okra, beans and eggplants to resell.

loans.name: Naysrorn

texts.en:
Naysrorn is 39 years old and a mother of four dependent children. She lives in a small village of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetable seller at the market in her community. So far, she has been involved in this career for two years with the net profit being around USD 6.50 per day.

Naysrorn wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
Lewelyn is 49 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Lewelyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Lewelyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lewelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.
