René is 26 years old and is a tenacious man. He lives with his wife and their three children ages 8, 7, and 2, in their own home. He has been working for a long time as a laborer on a farm close to his town, and his wife also works there. 

René wants to take advantage of the opportunity to install electricity in his home with a group of his neighbors since all of his town has installed it. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI, and is hoping to be able to use it as soon as possible to buy wire, switches, and a fuse box as well as pay for the manual labor necessary to install the electricity in his home.

loans.use: to buy wire, switches, and a fuse box as well as pay for the manual labor necessary to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es:
Adriana Mercedes es una señora de 45 años, casada, madre de tres hijos dos de ellos a su cargo uno estudiando en primaria y el otro en la universidad.
Habita en el poblado de El Sauce ubicado a 90 kilómetros del departamento de León al occidente de Nicaragua.
Se desempeña como profesora de primaria donde tiene más de veinte años de dedicarse a esta profesión la que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, las condiciones que hoy les brinda a sus hijos.
Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le ha brindado Kiva y Ceprodel con los diferentes financiamientos que le han otorgado los cuales le han servido para resolver problemas de salud y para mejorar su casa.
En este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para la compra de medicamentos, realización de exámenes, ultrasonidos, ya que se ha sentido mal de salud por lo que requiere chequearse para salir adelante y mejorar.
Espera y confía en Dios que le sigan apoyando.
texts.en:
Adriana Mercedes is a 45 year old lady, married, mother of three children, two of them in her care, one studying in primary and the other at university. She lives in the town of El Sauce located 90 kilometers from the department of León in western Nicaragua.`

She works as a primary school teacher and has more than twenty years experience in this profession that has allowed her to bring up her children and improve her home, the environment that she offers her children today.

She is very grateful for the support that has been provided by Kiva and Ceprodel through the various loans that have been granted which have served to solve health issues and to improve her home.

At this time she needs a loan in order to buy medication, have medical exams, ultrasound, as she has felt ill and requires a checkup in order to move forward and improve.

She hopes and has confidence in God for continued support.

loans.use: to buy medication, have medical exams, and an ultrasound

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 50-years-old and a dedicated housewife living in Rawalpindi with her family. She has four children. Her husband owns a general store in the nearby market. Their main source of income comes from this business. As they have five children it is difficult to meet all their needs. Also they want to save some money for their children's education. 

Her husband wants to invest more in his general store business to make it more profitable. Currently due to a lack of savings her husband is unable to purchase more items for his general store in order to increase sales that will lead to better earnings. Therefore, his wife has requested for a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to support her husband in his business. They are hopeful to get fruitful results from this investment with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts that he needs for electrical machine repair.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed is a 50-year-old married woman. Her husband is a car painter. Taghreed decided to help her husband to improve their standard of living by selling cosmetic products and clothes for one year. She is planning to expand her business in the future by opening an independent cosmetic products store. But now she needs to buy more cosmetic products in order to raise her profit and continue her journey. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 49 años de edad tiene 9 hijos por los cuales él tiene que hacer un enorme esfuerzo para poder darles una condición de vida adecuada, los primeros seis hijos tienen ya familias separadas y los últimos tres son buenos estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad él vive aun con su esposa la cual la ha apoyado mucho para sacar la familia adelante.
La actividad que el dignamente realiza con tanto esmero es la albañilería dicha actividad lo ha venido realizando durante 15 años a él lo ha ayudado dicha actividad en sus ingresos económicos  y para el sustento de su familia, él es muy emprendedor y creativo en su trabajo y es por ello que muchas personas le buscan para construir sus casas, la segunda actividad que el realiza es la venta de bananos en los alrededores de su comunidad.
El motivo de la realización de un préstamo es para la compra de herramientas de construcción par que él pueda realizar su trabajo con mucha más rapidez y eficacia  porque a él lo buscan la gente porque es un buen trabajador y construye casas muy seguras y es por ello que la gente de su comunidad quieren que él les construye sus casas.
Unos de los sueños de él es poner una oficina para atender a la gente con más tranquilidad y ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse en profesionales en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Juan is 49 years old. He has 9 children for which he has to put forth enormous effort in order to provide adequate living conditions. The first six children have their own families and the last three are good students in the community school. He still lives with his wife who has very much supported bringing up the family.

The activity that he does with much dignity and care is masonry and he has been doing this for 15 years and this activity offers financial earnings for supporting his family. He is very enterprising and creative in his work and this is why many people seek him out to build their houses. His second activity is selling bananas around his community.

He is asking for a loan to buy construction tools so he can do his work more rapidly and efficiently because people look for him as he is a good worker and builds very safe houses and this is why people in his community want him to build their homes.

One of his dreams is to open an office in order to assist people with more ease of mind and to see his children grow and become professionals in the not too far off future.

loans.use: to buy masonry tools for his business

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a young housewife of 20-years-old. She has one child. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. He has been driving a taxi for two years now. All the expenses are covered through the income generated from driving the taxi. However, his taxi stopped functioning properly so he is unable to make good earnings. Due to this he is facing problems covering his daily expenses. therefore he needs to fix his taxi as soon as possible in order to generate income.  Ayesha is also concerned and wants to help her husband in this difficult situation therefore she has requested for a loan to help her husband repair his taxi. She is thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva. 

Both this husband and wife want to save money to avoid any situation to happen and for a better future for their family.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 45-year-old married mother of two children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as pomegranates, queen-apples, pears, and cherries. In the summer she raises fruits and in the autumn and winter she raises vegetables such as potatoes, pumpkins, and carrots. Rana's monthly income is 180 AZN. She usually sells her crops to the local market vendors. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made with vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also used to make fresh punch.  Her husband  helps her a lot in raising her crops.  Rana  applied for a loan of 1500 AZN in order to buy more seeds and fertilizers. This will be her first loan .

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase many kinds of goods for his new cafeteria such as a juicer, lemons, fruits, sugar, cream foods, and other things to start his business strongly.

loans.name: Djebeleton  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  DJEBELETON 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TAMARO, un des villages de la commune de DAH cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’ arachide  avec  FANTA, 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à DAH, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Djebeleton 4 are married women averaging 36 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in Tamaro, a village in the township of Dan, the district of San, the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso finance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loan.

They grow peanuts, which is what Fanta does, for example. She is the first one standing from right to left in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [e.g. fertilizers], seeds and small tools as well as pay the costs of labor to work 0.5 ha [1.2 acres] of land. After harvesting, she will her produce in her the village and in Dah, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn an average revenue of 20,500 West African francs per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, fertilizers, small tools and seeds.

loans.name: Geraldine Magalli

texts.es:
Geraldine tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, ella vive con su conyugue y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará, en donde la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general, dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Geraldine se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con un terreno agrícola en el cual posee cultivo de arroz, ella presenta sembrado plantaciones de arroz línea ideal el cual tiene una semana de sembrado, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro, su conyugue se desempeña como chofer, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, solvencia moral y económica. Desea el préstamo para invirtirlo en su negocio para su producto que obtenga sea de mejor calidad y así poder ofrecerlo a un mayor precio, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores utilidades y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Geraldine is 46 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children.  She lives with her husband and their two children in the Pucara district.  Here, the residents work in agriculture, producing mainly rice.  There is also general commerce in the area.  This district is located in the Jaen province, in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Geraldine is a farmer who has agricultural land where she grows rice.  She has planted an ideal variety of rice a week ago.  She has more than 15 years of experience in this line of work, and her husband works as a driver.  She has very good personal references for her moral character and finances.  

Geraldine wants this loan to invest in her business so that her products will be the best quality, and therefore she can sell them for a higher price.  This will enable her to generate more income and better profits so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in her business growing rice

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
Bacilio tiene 39 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada, con su conyugue y sus 6 menores hijos de edades 17, 15, 11, 08, 05 y 04 años de edad. Él vive en la parte rural de este distrito de Pucará, contando con servicios de agua y luz, queda en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Bacilio es el tranporte de pasajeros en mototaxi, contando con unidad propia y con clientes de la zona y de caserios, además se dedica como obrero en construcción y como peón agricola, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el credito sin ningun problema. Él desea el crédito para ivertir en arreglos a su unidad móvil, con ello asegurará el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, y además le generará mayor productividad, mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 39 years old. He lives in a rented home with his partner and their six youngest children ages 17, 15, 11, 8, 5, and 4 years old. He lives in the rural part of the district of Pucará where there is running water and electricity. This is in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region, which is in the northern mountain range of Perú.

Bacilio works in the transport of passengers in motorcycle taxi, using his own vehicle. He transports customers in the area and the surrounding villages. He also works in construction and as a farm laborer, which bring additional incomes that allow him to pay back the loan without any problem. He is requesting the loan to invest in repairs for his motorcycle taxi. With them, he will assure the proper operation of his work instrument as well as generate greater productivity, greater incomes, and better profits and in this way he can improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to make repairs to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Meet Anna, a mother of five who resides in Eldoret, Kenya. For years, her main sources of income have been milk and eggs. She makes extra money on the side engaging in a couple of other small short-term businesses.

Anna joined Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans made accessible to smallholder farmers like herself. During a training session, she learnt about KIVA and the benefits of leveraging a business to maximize growth and profits. 

Anna is seeking a loan to purchase poultry.  The potential of a poultry business in Eldoret is very high. With your loan, Anna will immediately start realising the benefits of seizing this wonderful opportunity. With the additional income, she will comfortably repay the loan on time and meet other business related expenses.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera vive con sus dos menores hijos en el caserio de Pedregal, ella goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos aires, Provincia de Morropón, pertenciente a la región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Narcisa es a la crianza y venta de animales como es ganado caprino; y también se dedica adicionalmente a la producción de plátano, producto muy cotizado en la zona. Ella cria y vende sus animales desde hace más de 15 años. Ella tiene experiencia en la zona y en el negocio. Narcisa solicita el crédito para la compra de activos biológicos que usará en el siembro de plátano, para poder obtener un buena cosecha y asi poder ofrecer sus platanos a un mejor precio, aumentando sus ingresos, mejorando sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 41, is a single mother who lives with her two minor children in the Pedregal settlement.  She has good personal and work references from her neighbors.  People in her area work in farming, commerce, and animal husbandry.  This area is in the Buenos Aires district of Morropon province, which is part of the Piura region of the northern coast of Peru.

Narcisa raises and sells animals such as goats.  She also grows bananas, which are highly valued in the area.  Narcisa has been raising and selling animals for more than 15 years.  She has experience in the area, and in her businesses.  Narcisa is requesting a loan to buy biological assets that she will use with her banana crops in order to obtain a good harvest.  This way she can get a better price for her products, increasing her income and improving her profits so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her children.

loans.use: to buy biological assets for use with her banana crops

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en: Nurhayati lives in Bogor, a satellite city located in southern Jakarta. She is single and living with more than six family members in the family home. She runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits, and serving electronic bill payments. She joined Ruma because she wants to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Nurhayati is in her small stall.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends,

loans.name: Carlos Brayan

texts.es:
Carlos Brayan es soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de su hermana hace aproximadamente 5 años. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos; su comunidad se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; y está ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Carlos Brayan se dedica al servicio de transporte en mototaxi en la zona de Cayalti y sus alrededores, desde hace más de 02 años aproximadamente. Él solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de mototaxi y en la compra de su SOAT, y de esta manera poder asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo ya que es su sustento de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Brayan is single, and he is 26 years old. He has lived in his sisters home for approximately 5 years and he receives great references from his neighbors. His community is dedicated to trade, agriculture, and livestock, and is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú.

Carlos Brayan has earned a living in transportation services via motorcycle taxi in the town of Cayalti and surrounding areas for more than 2 years now. He is requesting a loan to perform maintenance work on his motorcycle taxi and to buy the proper insurance. In this manner he can assure the proper operation of his work instrument since it is his livelihood.

loans.use: to perform maintenance work on his motorcycle taxi and to buy the proper insurance.

loans.name: Guissela Noemi

texts.es:
Guisella tiene 20 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, vive en el caserio de Carrasquillo junto a sus padres, distrito de Buenos aires, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales, ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos; su caserio se ubica en la provincia de Morropon, departamento de Piura, Costa norte del Perú.

Guisella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y piqueos, actividad que desarrolla desde hace algunos años, su negocio presenta buenas perpectivas ya que son pocos los negocios de venta de cerveza en su zona. Ella, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de más cajas de cerveza, compra de mesas para poder atender a un número mayor de público, y de esta manera poder captar a más clientes, lo que va a generar un aumento en sus ingresos, mejoraras en sus ganancias y por ende la calidad de vida de ella y la de sus padres también mejorarán.
texts.en:
Guisella, 20, is single, and lives with her parents in the Carrasquillo settlement in the district of Buenos Aires. People in her area work in farming and animal husbandry.  She has good personal and work references from her neighbors.  Her settlement is located in Morropon province, in the department of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Guisella has a business selling beer and snacks, an activity that she has developed over several years.  Her business has good prospects, because there are few businesses selling beer in her area.  Guisella has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy more cases of beer, and to buy tables where she can serve a greater number of people.  In this way, she can attract more customers, which will increase her income, improve her profits, and enable her to improve the quality of life for herself and for her parents.

loans.use: to buy more cases of beer and to buy tables

loans.name: Narcisa Dalila

texts.es: Narcisa Dalila mayor de edad madre soltera de seis hijos, los cuales todos son independientes, de origen chinandegana,zona ubicada en el occidente del país, Narcisa se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, detergentes, productos congelados, golosinas, jugos, leña,  entre otros, sus compras son al contado en mercados, distribuidoras y camiones distribuidores, sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales a pesar de la competencia ha logrado mantener su clientela ofreciendo variedad y precios bajos para sus clientes, su jornada diaria inicia desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio y brindando un buen servicio, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer en su negocio y realizar ciertas mejoras en su vivienda hoy en día Narcisa ha logrado incrementar un poco sus ingresos gracias a los financiamientos que se le han otorgado, por lo que esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, aceite, golosinas, detergentes, productos congelados entre otros mas, y de esa forma ofrecerle productos nuevos a sus clientes al igual que mejorarían sus ingresos. Narcisa  está muy agradecida por la ayuda que los Inversionistas Kivas le brindan a personas de escaso recursos y países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de trabajo
texts.en: Narcisa Dalila is an adult woman, the single mother of six children, who are all independent. She is originally from Chinandega, in a zone in the west of the country. Narcisa is characterized as being a hard-working, responsible woman with a great desire for personal achievement. She is a micro-entrepreneur and administrator of her own business, which consists of a little grocery store where she offers products for household use such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, detergents, frozen products, candies, juices, and firewood, among other items. Her purchases are made for cash at the markets, distributors and truck distributors. Her sales are for cash. She has regular and occasional customers. In spite of the competition, she has managed to maintain her clientele, offering variety and low prices for her customers. Her daily work begins very early, opening the doors of her business and offering a good service. One of her dreams is to be able to grow in her business and make certain improvements in her house. Nowadays Narcisa has managed to increase her income a little thanks to the loans that have been granted to her. For this reason, she is applying for new financing in order to invest in working capital to purchase products for household use such as rice, oil, candies, detergents, and frozen products, among other additional items, and in this way to offer new products to her customers, as well as improving her income. Narcisa is very grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to purchase products for daily household use, such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, and detergents, among other items.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 32-year-old married woman living in Salt, Jordan. Two years ago, she started selling detergents and food products to help her husband pay  their household expenses. In the future, she plans to own an independent mini-market. 

Hanan is seeking to expand her business by purchasing more detergents and food products to sell. Since she does not have enough money to increase her inventory, she is requesting a loan. The loan will help her increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy new products and detergents to sell

loans.name: Kulmira

texts.ru: Кульмира 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Кульмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей обуви на местном рынке, начав свой бизнес с 2002 года, с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кульмиры, ее ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), товар в обороте на 150,000 сом (KGS). Также Кульмира занимается полеводством. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте, а именно расширения ассортимента обуви. Доходы от кредита Кульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, также она хочет открыть собственный оптовый магазин обуви.
texts.en: Kulmira is 45 years old, married,  with two children. Kulmira has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family she sells shoes at the local market having launched her business in 2002 with a starting capital of 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Kulmira's hard work, her monthly income is 10,000 KGS; the value of her stock is 150,000 KGS. Kulmira also grows farm produce. In order to develop her business further, Kulmira has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS for increasing her stock, more specifically expanding her selection of shoes. Kulmira plans to invest the income from her loan for a further expansion of her business. Her dream is to open her own wholesale shoe store.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale in order to increase the assortment in her shop and  be more competitive.

loans.name: Giver Jair

texts.es:
Giver tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropón, en una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población es amable, se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y está ubicada en la región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, hace la ruta: Morropon- Buenos Aires y viceversa desde hace 02 años aproximadamente, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para arreglar el motor de su moto, y de esta manera asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo para seguir prestando sus servicios, seguir generandose ingresos para él ya que es su sustento de vida.
texts.en:
Giver is 20 years old and lives in the district of Morropón in a town with a very hot climate. The people in the town are nice, and work in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the Piura region on the north coast of Perú.

He has provided a public transport service using his own motorcycle taxi on the route from Morropón to Buenos Aires (Peru) and back for approximately 2 years. He is requesting a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa to repair the motor of his vehicle. In this way he can assure the proper operation of his work instrument to keep providing his services, and continue generating an income for himself since this job is his livelihood.

loans.use: to repair the motor of his vehicle.

loans.name: Claudia Vanessa

texts.es:
Claudia de 22 años de edad,  es una persona que se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, como cocinar para sus hijos y su esposo, lavar, hacer limpieza en la casa, para mantener en orden la casa, y el cuido de sus dos hijos. Su esposo se dedica a los cultivos de maíz y frijol, y al trabajo de jornal, para ganar un poco de dinero para el sustento de la familia, ella por la falta de trabajo en el lugar no ha trabajado nunca, siempre ha dependido de sus padres y hoy de su esposo.

El crédito lo necesita para trámites de aceptación de herencia, de un terreno que le han dado sus padres, pues necesita pagar el abogado que le hará todo el proceso, ya que con lo que su esposo gana no le alcanza más que para los gastos de la familia.  Ella piensa que con la ayuda de los créditos y el esfuerzo de ella y su esposo construirán la casa propia, le darán estudio a sus hijos, y mejorar sus condiciones como familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is 22 years old and is in charge of the household chores, such as cooking for her husband and children, washing, and cleaning the home to maintain order and care for her two children.  Her husband raises corn and beans and also works as a laborer to earn some money to support the family.  She, due to a lack of work in the area, has never worked.  She has always relied on her parents and now her husband.

She needs the loan to pay the costs associated with inheriting a piece of land from her parents.  She needs to pay a lawyer to do the paperwork and her husband does not earn more than what is needed for the household expenses.  She feels that with her and her husband’s effort and help from the loans they will be able to build their own home, provide an education to their children, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay legal fees for an inheritance.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: At the age of 52, Mussarat is a married woman and the mother of three children.  She deals in a business selling different items such as jewelry, hair catchers and cosmetic products to the people of her community. In this way she earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses. In order to meet everyday expenditures she needs more income, so she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. She will use this loan to purchase more items in bulk such as fancy hair catchers, clips and hair bands along with packs of rings and bracelets. She expects a boost in her sales and profits alongside. She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more items in bulk such as fancy hair catchers, clips and hair bands along with packs of rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Neti

texts.en:
Neti lives in Depok, a satellite city located in southern Jakarta. She is single and she lives with four family members. Neti runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. She also provides electronic bill payment services. 

Neti joined Ruma because she wants to increase her income. She is very excited to expand her business. Currently, she can process 40-79 mobile airtime and electronic bill payment transactions per day. Neti is requesting a loan for working capital that will allow her to process more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Yayu

texts.en: Yayu and her husband live in Bogor, a city located about an hour from Jakarta, Indonesia. Her husband works in a private company. To support the family, Yayu manages a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She began working with Ruma four months ago because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. She is really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business expands, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Etrat

texts.en: Etrat is a 46-year-old married woman.  For about four years, she has been in the business of selling milk. She has two cows; her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good food, health and clothing. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. She has improved her business in order to meet day to day expenses of life. She is happily running her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR in order to purchase another cow. She is hopeful to increase her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad, at the age of 59, is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has four children. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She is in her 3rd loan cycle. Currently she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR in order to buy a new sewing machine along with the spools of thread, cloths and buttons in different colors. Therefore, she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine along with spools of thread, cloths and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Selina. Selina lives in Kisii together with her husband and five children. To afford her family a decent living, she sells milk and various varieties of food crops. She also has another personal business on the side for additional income. Selina has eight years of experience in mixed farming. Selling her farm produce gives her a sense of personal satisfaction. Her biggest challenge, however, is the high costs of inputs.

Selina is seeking a loan in order to purchase a dairy cow. The loan covers the cow’s insurance after purchase to cushion Selina from loan obligation should the cow die. A high grade dairy cow will produce enough milk daily to enable Selina to comfortably service the loan. 

Your contribution towards Selina’s loan will help her to afford her children’s education fees. This will go a long way in setting a solid foundation for their future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rustico, con su conyugue y sus dos menores hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad el cual el primero cursa primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Wilson vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz, y esta ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Wilson es la brindar servicios como maestro de obra en construccion civil, realiza trabajos de tarrajeo, acentado de ladrillos, cerámica entre otros, él cuenta con 13 años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en la compra de herramientas, para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con ello podrá captar un número mayor de clientes, generandole mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and their two minor children, ages 7 and 4, in the family home, which is made of rustic materials. The older child is in the primary level of the national school of Pucará. Wilson lives in the rural part of this district and has water and electrical service. This district is located in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru.

Wilson's business is offering services as a master builder in civil construction. He does plastering and brick and ceramic work, among other tasks. He has 13 years of experience in this area. The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the purchase of tools in order to be able to offer a better service to his customers. With this, he will be able to capture a greater number of customers, generating better income and greater earnings, and thus being able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of tools in order to be able to offer a better service to his customers.

loans.name: Jeptoo

texts.en:
Meet Jeptoo. She is a wife and a mother of two lovely children. Jeptoo relies on mixed-farming to sustain family. She lives with her family on a small piece of land in Sirikwa in Kenya. 

Jeptoo is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow’s milk will be both for consumption and sales. With the cow producing 10-15 litres of milk per day on average, she will comfortably be able to repay the loan and keep savings.

Once she is done servicing the loan, she will use the additional income to take care of family and business related costs. 

Jeptoo’s mission is improving her family’s standard of living through growing her business income and expanding her asset base.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Irwan

texts.en: Meet Irwan. Irwan is single and he lives with four of his family members in Sukabumi, a city located about two hours from Bandung, Indonesia. Irwan works in a gas station. He began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He is really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Meet Ann, a 22-year-old smallholder farmer from Eldoret, Kenya. She is a wife and the mother of a 3-year-old baby girl.  She earns income by selling milk and eggs from her farmstead.  Ann is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. 
She joined Juhudi Kilimo, through the Sirikwa Cheptany Self-Help Group, to access a loan to finance income-generating assets. She learned that Juhudi works in partnership with Kiva to raise funds and give loans to low-income earners. With the loan, she will expand her poultry farm and produce more eggs to sell.  Through the expansion, Ann will make more income that will enable her to help her husband to take good care of their young daughter.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to outfit and expand the pens where he keeps his goats at night.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in switches, wire, and a circuit breaker for the electrical installation in her home.

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en: Rahmat is married and he lives with his wife and their three children in Sukabumi, a city located about an hour from Bandung, Indonesia. Rahmat runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and an electronic bill payment service. To support his family, Rahmat realized that he needed to find another source of income. Rahmat met one of Ruma's staff from his friend and he decided to try selling mobile airtime. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta, a 34-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it, and then sells it to the people of her locality.  She also knows the art of embroidery. She always has great clothes to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 
To improve her business, Shagufta has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth as well as spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. She has a good credit history, and this will be Shagufta's 5th loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Maria Yaqueline

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material noble, al lado de su conyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos de 16, 11, 08, 04 años de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria y los otros dos primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. María vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz, en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza María es la venta de enseres domesticos como ollas, sartenes, lanas, hilos entre otros, ella cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en el rubro, las compras las realiza en Chiclayo y las ventas en Pucará. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos, para atender los diferentes pedidos de su público consumidor, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old. She lives in her own house, which is made of solid materials, with her spouse and their four dependent children, who are 16, 11, 8, and 4 years old. The oldest child is in high school, and the other two are in elementary school at the national school of the Pucara district. Maria lives in the rural part of this district, where she receives water and light services and which is located in the province of Jaen in the Cajamarca region in the northern coast of Peru.

Maria makes a living selling household goods such as pots, pans, wool, and yarn among others things. She has 14 years of experience in this line of work. She purchases in Chiclayo and sells in Pucara. She will use this loan to buy a supply of new products for her business to fulfill the different orders of her customer base, which will increase her earnings, better her income, and allow her to improver her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a supply of new products such as pots, pans, wool, yarn, etc. for her business to fulfill the different orders of her customer base.

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: Meet Farid. Farid lives by himself in Yogyakarta, a city and the capital of Yogyakarta Special Region in Java, Indonesia. He runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone airtime credits, and an electronic bill payment service. He began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He is really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits. Nowadays, his transaction limit of selling mobile airtime and processing bill payment can only take up to 75 transactions per day. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Joyce, a smallholder farmer based in Eldoret, Kenya. Joyce is a wife and the mother of 5 lovely children. She sells milk and produces crops at her farm. She also makes additional income from her employment. 
Joyce chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she could have access to loans that smallholder farmers in Kenya are typically deprived of due to the nature of their economic activity and meager incomes.  Through Juhudi Kilimo, Joyce is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase poultry. She has undergone training on loan management, and she is educated on how to utilize the loan funding. This has boosted her confidence about how she intends to spend the money and realize returns. 
Through this loan, Joyce will generate enough income to take care of the high farming costs and expand her agricultural enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to expand her agricultural enterprise.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Winny. 

Winny is a small farmer based in Eldoret, a fast-growing agricultural town in North Rift Valley, Kenya. She owns a small piece of land where she lives with her husband and four children. Winnie raises dairy cattle and sells their milk at a local market. In addition to her farming income, Winny earns a salary as an employee of a transportation service business.
 
Winny is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle, locally known as a bodaboda. Bodaboda is an Indian motorcycle that has gained popularity in rural Kenya due to its affordable price and durability. Winny will use the motorcycle to transport her produce to the market as well as ferry passengers for a fee.

The loan will help Winny acquire a means of transportation that is suited for the poor road networks in Koisagat Village. With a motorcycle, Winny will be able to offer shuttle services, which are the only way of getting around and transporting goods in the area. Coming from a village where many roads are impassable by vehicles, the bodaboda will provide a cheap, versatile, quick, and reliable form of transportation over short and medium distances.

loans.use: to purchase farm transportation

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida has successfully built up her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She always has a great collection of items to offer to her customers, such as bangles, jewellery items, hair accessories, cosmetic products, etc. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now Zahida is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase more jewellery and beauty products, such as makeup kits, lotions and creams. This will enable her to increase her sales to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase more jewellery and beauty products, such as makeup kits, lotions and creams.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en: Faisal is a 32-year-old single young man living in Southern Ghour, Jordan. He started depending on himself and running his own roasting and nuts shop over one year ago, and he found this business profitable. Later on, he started selling juice and different types of drinks. He is planning to start selling snacks in the future. Now he is seeking to expand his business by purchasing more nuts, spices and drinks to raise his profit. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more nuts, spices and drinks to sell

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA ont en moyenne 49 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA sont à leur 9èmeprêt solidaire. MARIAM, 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de Wax, 10 paires de chaussure en peau, 10 paires de boucle d’oreille, 20 paquets de mèche et 15 mètres de Bazin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 32 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group KOTOGNOGOTALA average 49 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, a district in SAN/SEGOU CITY (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling clothing and various goods. 

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group KOTOGNOGOTALA are now on their ninth solidarity loan. 

MARIAM, the first woman at the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 5 lengths of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), 10 pairs of leather shoes, 10 pairs of earrings, 20 packets of hair extensions, and 15 meters of damask fabric. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. She makes her sales to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often with credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 32,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods

loans.name: Heri

texts.en: Heri is married and lives with his wife and his two children in Cianjur, a small city situated at the foot of Mount Gede-Pangrango, West Java, Indonesia. Heri works in a private company while his wife runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and an electronic bill payment service. He joined Ruma because he’s interested in selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more baby Pampers to sell

loans.name: Delfino

texts.es:
De 35 años de edad con grandes aspiraciones hacia el futuro de su familia,  él tiene hijos por los cuales luchar todos los días bajo un sol agotador, los hijos de Delfino son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad y son la motivación de él para seguir trabajando por el futuro de ellos.
La actividad principal que el realiza es la de albañilería es la forma que ha encontrado para poder tener un ingreso económico, él se ha dedicado a dicha actividad durante doce años la cual tiene muy buena experiencia en ella. La segunda actividad que el realiza es agricultor en sus tiempos extras el cultiva café y banano el realiza dicha actividad con el fin de tener un ingreso económico extra del trabajo que realiza.
El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo es para la compra de terreno para poder cultivar banano y café ya que en la comunidad no hay mucha competencia de dicha actividad es por ello que él quiere realizarla para tener mejores ingresos.
Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de él es ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales par que lleguen a ser hombres de éxito en el futuro y poner una constructora en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Delfino is 35 years old, with great aspirations for the future of his family. He has children for whom he strives every day under an exhausting sun. Delfino's children are excellent students in the community school, and they are the motivation for him to continue working for their future. His principal work is that of bricklaying, which is the form of work that he has found that gives him an economic income. He has done this work for 12 years, which gives him very good experience in it. His second area of work is agriculture. In his extra time he raises coffee and bananas. He does this with the goal of having an extra economic income from the work that he does.

The use that he will give to the loan is to buy land in order to grow bananas and coffee, since in the community there is not much competition in this work. It is for this reason that he wants to do it to have better income.

One of his great aspirations is to see his children grow in the field of education and become professionals so that they can become successful men in the future. He also dreams of setting up a construction company in his community.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is running her household by doing a business in the cloth trade. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers. She is known in her town for providing good quality fabric. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Naseem is requesting a 40,000 Pakistani rupee loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior in the past. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and aspires to save money to provide quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales, des habits et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur 6èmeprêt solidaire. DJENEBA, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter10 Paquets de bonbon, 10 boîtes de lait concentré, 15Kg de sucre et 2 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 31 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group SABALY average 37 years of age and two children each, all living in traditional extended families in Hamdallaye, a district in SAN/SEGOU CITY (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling grains, clothing, and various goods. 

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group SABALY are now on their sixth solidarity loan. 

DJENEBA, the first woman standing at the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 10 packets of candies, 10 cans of concentrated milk, 15 kg of sugar, and 2 boxes of soap. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. She makes her sales to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often with credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 31,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as milk, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 46-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking lady who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past 12 years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Farah requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colours, and packs of zippers and buttons to meet with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colours, and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Meet Nelly, a single mother of three who lives in Eldoret - a rural town in Kenya, which is home to many world-class marathon runners. To provide her family with a decent living, Nelly is deeply engaged in mixed-faming. Her primary income sources are milk, tea and crops. She also holds a salary-paying job besides farm activities. 

Nelly is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The change from the purchase will go to purchasing dairy meal. The dairy cow obtained through your loan will produce an average of 10-15 litres of milk per day. This quantity is sustainable daily for both family consumption and sales. The proceeds from sales will take care of the loan repayment.

Once Nelly is done servicing the loan, the proceeds from the sales will take care of her family expenses which are soaring by the day due to inflation. Her mission is to continue to work hard to improve her income and keep providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como operaria de maquinas. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que en la actualidad se encuentra en muy mal estado, además desea construir un cuarto, por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines, pines, ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava para construir un cuarto y cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old and lives in a home of her own.  She is an enterprising woman who works as a sewing machine operator.  She wants to replace the roof on her home because it’s in bad shape.  She also wants to build a room, so she is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, to buy galvanized metal, beams, lumber, bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to build a room and replace the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to repair her roof and build a room.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Teresia. Teresia is a hardworking smallholder farmer in Litein, which is a small rural town in the tea-growing region of Kenya. For the last 15 years of her life, Teresia has been doing mixed farming. This has worked out well for her as she has been able to provide a decent living for her five children. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

Teresia is seeking a loan to construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favourite animal, named Tuwa. The thing she enjoys most about dairy farming is selling milk. However, in order for a dairy cow to be more productive, the farmer needs to be good at dairy management. Your loan will help Teresia construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The shelter will enable her to prepare feed rations and feed the cow. The shed will also ensure the cow is always in a clean and hygienic environment. 

Your loan will bring untold benefits to Teresia. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. The extra money will go to loan repayment and her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to live a better life with fulfilled basic needs.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 46-year-old married woman. A year ago, she initiated her business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, Irshad has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colours and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colours and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 58-year-old married woman. She is running a business manufacturing artificial jewelry with the support of her husband and son (also shown in the photo). The business has great potential for growth and they earn a good amount of income to bear their household expenditures. In order to meet their orders on time and boost their sales, Shahnaz requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to use that income to provide a better standard of living for her family members. It’s her eighth loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior in her previous loan cycles.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold and artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 19 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña prestando sus servicios domésticos de manera domiciliar. La vivienda de María actualmente es de bajareque y con el crédito anterior compro madera para el techo, y actualmente solicita un crédito a FUSAI para construir dos muros de su vivienda, para lo que comprará: cemento, arena, ladrillos, grava y pagará mano de obra necesaria para construir dos muros de su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria is 42 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner and two children, ages 15 and 19.  She is a hardworking woman who provides domestic services and is asking for a loan.  Maria’s home is made out of adobe and she used the previous loan to buy lumber for the roof.  She is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, to build two walls in her home.  She will buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and pay for labor to build the walls.

loans.use: to build walls.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima, age 26, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. At present she has 2 cows, 1 buffalo, and 2 calves.  She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income, but she needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es: Doña Juana con el crédito anterior logro realizar parte del muro perimetral de su humilde vivienda que poco a poco va acondicionando, siendo una anciana y viuda su lucha a diario es vivir en buenas condiciones y disfrutar de una vejez tranquila bajo un buen techo, doña Juana continua con su labor como costurera, hace nacatamales, sopa y vende cosméticos, también cuenta con el apoyo económico de sus hijos, a pesar de su avanzada edad es bien activa y con muchos ánimos de salir adelante, solicita el crédito en esta ocasión para comprar materiales para la 2da parte del muro de su casa.
texts.en: Juana used the previous loan to build part or a wall around her humble home, that she is building little by little.  Being an elderly widow, her daily struggle is to live under good conditions and enjoy her old age under a good roof.  Juana, along with her job as a seamstress, makes nacatamales, soup, and sells food.  She also has financial support from her children.  Despite her advanced age, she is very active and has a great motivation to get ahead.  She is asking for this loan to buy building materials for the second part of the wall.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She has no additional family members. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge is transportation. She is aspiring to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expense includes food and medication.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, the mother of two children, has been a farmer for many years now. She lives together with her family in Eldoret, Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry at her farm, and her primary source of income is milk and eggs. She makes extra money on the side holding a wage-paying job and venturing into small personal businesses. 
Susan is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She enjoys raising chickens. She has been to trainings that have empowered her to take calculated business risks. With your loan, Susan will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she  will also be able to save extra.
Susan is very concerned about her children’s education; profits that will be acquired from the poultry will go to her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a 50 years old single woman living in Southern Ghour-Jordan. She has been selling nuts, food products and snacks for kids for one year. Her business was profitable which pushed her to plan to expand it in the future by opening her independent shop. Now she is seeking to raise her profit by purchasing more of her products and adding juice sales to her business. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and juice for her mini-market

loans.name: Piliphine

texts.en:
Piliphine is a 36 year old smallholder farmer from the Litein area of Kenya. She is a wife and a mother of 7 children. To aid her husband take care of the family, she has been involved in mixed farming for a decade now. Milk, eggs and crops produced at her farm are her major sources of income.
Piliphine is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats. Since she became of age, there is nothing she enjoys more than feeding and milking goats. Her favourite goat is named ‘Tuka’. Goat farming in Kenya is on an upward spiral: Chiefly because whether your property is one acre or several hundred, sloping or flat, crowded with brush or completely forested, you can still raise dairy goats for milk. 
With you help, Philiphine is going to significantly expand his goat farm and as a result produce more milk for sale. This will not only enable her to repay her loan but also to make enough money for her children’s education. 
Her future objective is to provide a quality living standard for her family and a better life for her children through proper schooling

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy improved seed for the cattle.

loans.name: Yoni Maribel

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de salón de belleza, la socia realiza corte de cabellos, tintes y ondulaciones, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de salón de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tintes y tijeras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to be devoted to the business of her beauty salon.  The woman makes hair cuts, hair dyes and permanents.  She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.

She already has 8 years in this business and is doing very well.  The dream of the woman is to expand the business of beauty salon. The member is requesting a loan to buy dyes and scissors.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of their share.

loans.use: to buy dyes and scissors.

loans.name: Keila Ninosca

texts.es:
La creatividad es la principal herramienta de Keila, una joven de 33 años de edad, quien decidió emprender con un pequeño ahorro, en el mundo de los salones de belleza. Esta joven emprendedora fue a la universidad y es una estilista de naturaleza, combinación que la ha ayudado a ir por un buen camino en su primer negocio y su única fuente de ingresos. Para esta madre soltera de una bebe de dos años, el inicio fue lento con un pequeño salón donde poco a poco ha ido comprando los materiales y productos para poder completar su negocio.
Ahora Keila tiene tres años de haber iniciado con su negocio y ya está a punto de cumplir con ese objetivo. Sin embargo, necesita de tu ayuda para poder lograrlo, ya que necesita de un préstamo para comprar una plancha para el cabello, tijeras, una secadora y productos de belleza para vender en el mismo salón. Gracias a estos materiales, podrá no solo cumplir con su meta de completar el salón, sino también podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio, que la encaminará a cumplir con su plan de expandir su salón de belleza a nivel nacional. ¡Ayuda a Keila a cumplir con sus sueños!
texts.en: Creativity is Keila’s main tool.  She is a 33-year-old young woman who decided to venture into the world of beauty salons with her savings.  This young entrepreneur attended university and is a natural stylist, a combination that helped her on the path to her first business and only source of income.  For a single mother of a two-year-old baby, startup was slow, with a small salon and she has been buying supplies a little at a time to complement her business.  Now Keila has been in business for three years and she is about to complete that goal.  However, she needs your help to be able to make it.  She needs a loan to buy a hair iron, scissors, a dryer, and beauty products to sell.  Thanks to these materials, she will be able to meet her goal of completing the salon and also be able to offer better service and put her on the path to completing her plan to expand her salon to the national level.  Help Keila reach her dreams!

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia Faustina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jora, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Faustina, continues to be devoted to the business of selling food and also is sells chicha (a local corn liquor).  The woman prepares different dishes like baked chicken, soups and sautéed meat.  The woman works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.

The woman has 8 years in this business and is doing very well.  Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy food to prepare such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of their share.

loans.use: to buy food to prepare including rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives with her only son and her husband, who is a migrant worker. 

She has been involved in the jewelry retail business for 4 years. Susanna trades jewelry in the Vernisaj Market which is a tiny area right in the heart of Yerevan where one can find a collection of books, gifts, silver, and Armenian souvenirs. Susanna trades there with different kinds of jewelry and accessories. She is already well known among customers. 

Susanna currently needs more funds to be able to purchase new stocks of jewelry, and so she has applied for this loan. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: pay for new stocks of jewelry for retail.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Hace un poco más de un año, las paredes de la casa de Angélica eran todas de láminas de zinc, ahora, a sus 34 años, ha podido cambiar algunas de esas por paredes sólidas. Todo gracias a los ahorros de los ingresos que obtuvo cuando compró leña y maíz para poder elaborar las deliciosas tortillas que comercializa. Ella con una sonrisa, expresa su total agradecimiento a todas las personas que le extendieron la mano en su primer préstamo para poder cumplir con su meta. En estos momentos cumplió siete años con su propio negocio, el cual le es de ayuda para sustentar a sus dos hijos. 
Angélica ha ido creciendo poco a poco a medida que pasan los años, actualmente está emprendiendo en el mundo de la pulpería, la cual ha tenido gran aceptación donde vive. Sin embargo, sabe que le falta mucho camino por delante. Su meta es seguir mejorando la su casa y volverse totalmente autosuficiente con su negocio, por lo que necesita de un nuevo préstamo para comprar más maíz, bolsas y leña, materiales que le permitirán seguir elaborando las mejores tortillas de su barrio.
texts.en: A little more than a year ago, the walls in Angelita’s house were made of zinc metal.  Now, at 34, she has been able to change some of them out for solid walls, all thanks to her savings from when she bought firewood and dried corn to make delicious tortillas for sale.  With a smile she expresses her complete gratitude to all those who extended their hand with her first loan so she could reach her goal.  She has had her business for seven years and it’s helped her support her two children.  Angelita has been growing her business little by little as the years pass.  She is currently dabbling in the world of a small grocery store, which has been greatly accepted in her neighborhood.  However she knows that she has a long way to go.  Her goal is to continue improving her home and become completely self-sufficient in her business.  She needs a new loan to buy more dried corn, bags, and firewood, which will allow her to cotinue making the best tortillas in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 38 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl has run a general store for the past twenty years and sells a variety of items such as milk, canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise such as this to sell.

In the future Cheryl would like to see her children go to college with the money she is saving.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en: Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and four go to school. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She has no additional family members. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has requested for a loan of 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes transportation. She is aspiring of buying a van to ease transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major expense includes food and medication.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia Yovana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Yovana, is still devoted to the business of selling beauty products.  She sells lip pencils, creams and perfumes.  The woman works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, 

She has several years in this business,  Her dream is to have a place where she can sell beauty products. The member asks you for a loan to buy creams, lip pencils and perfumes.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her share.

loans.use: to buy creams, lip pencils and perfumes.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Hello World! Meet Sheila who is a mixed farmer based in Chebuyo a remote village in Siongiroi area of Kenya. This area experiences one of the best weather patterns in the world and is famous for maize growing. She is happily married and is blessed with one handsome baby boy. For 5 years she has practiced farming on her small piece of land. Her primary source of income is milk and some personal businesses she engages in to earn a decent income. Sheila passionately loves dairy farming and this can be attested to the fact that she has nicknamed one of his dairy cow “Tuka”. Right from childhood she has been involved in dairy farming and now its part and parcel of him. She finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable of all the activities she is involved in. The biggest challenge she faces is lack of a proper dairy unit. She is seeking for a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Having gone through training on the best dairy farming methods she believes that a dairy unit will assist in high production of milk. Through the loan she will be able to properly feed her cows and also the cows will have a good resting place and this will increase production of milk. She plans to increase her milk selling business and the dairy unit will assist his cows have a good resting place where there are not affected with harsh weather conditions. Through the loan Sheila is going to actualize her dreams and improve her living conditions

loans.use: To buid a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Salvaje Group

texts.es:
