Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres alegres y emprendedoras que se unieron hace 3 meses, con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida, acceder a financiamiento para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios.  

Cristina: Es una mujer  amable y luchadora, coordinadora del grupo solidario. Tiene 43 años de edad, madre soltera de 5 hijos, mayores de edad. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingresos desde  hace 10 años  se dedica a la venta de bastimentos, pescados y repostería. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar verduras: banano, yuca, plátano, coco, malanga, pescado, insumos para elaborar pan de forma artesanal: harina, azúcar, aceite, levadura entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three happy, enterprising women who got together three months ago to improve their quality of life, by getting a loan to buy merchandise for their small businesses.

Cristina is a friendly and hardworking woman and serves as the group’s coordinator.  She is 43 years old and the mother of five adult children.  In order to have her own source of income, she has been selling goods, fish, and pastries.  She is asking for her first loan to buy vegetables: bananas, yucca, plantains, coconut, taro, fish, bread-making supplies: flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast, and other products.  Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Rose is 40 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ana Rose has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ana Rose requested a PHP 35,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Ana Rose has been in this business for 20 years. In the future Ana Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Here is Beatrice, a dedicated, hardworking and passionate farmer who is 26 years of age. She is based in the remote village of Chebuyo in the Siongiroi area. She is happily married to a very handsome man, and together they have been blessed with six children.

Beatrice’s primary source of income comes from selling milk and eggs. For the past fifteen years she has been practicing mixed farming on her small piece of inherited land. There she keeps poultry and dairy cows. Since childhood she has loved taking care of cows and running a dairy, so she is well experienced in all farming skills. Of all the activities she is involved in she feels most proud of taking care of her cows and loves waking up to milk them every day.

The biggest challenge Beatrice faces on her farm is the lack of a proper dairy shed where the cows can rest and eat properly before being milked. In the past she has had to spend money on treatments for her cows when they were affected by harsh weather conditions. For these reasons Beatrice is kindly requesting a 20,000 KES loan to build a dairy shed.

With this investment in her cows, Beatrice will see them yield more milk. This will translate into a higher income, improved living conditions and a secure future for her school-going children. Her dream is to increase her herd, and through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders she believes that her dream will come to pass.

loans.use: to build a dairy shed.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à FINTEGUE, un des villages de la commune de KARABA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec FATOUMA, femme assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  KARABA
 , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 22 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women and they are, on average, 34 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in Fintegue, a village located in the commune of Karaba, Cercle of San (fourth administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Fatouma, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is the woman in middle of the front row.  She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Karaba. She is expecting to make an average profit of 22,500 CFA francs at the end of the farming season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing costs and buy agricultural inputs, small farming tools and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à FINTEGUE, un des villages de la commune de KARABA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec BATOMA, 2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  KARABA
 , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 21 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women and they are, on average, 43 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in Fintegue, a village located in the commune of Karaba, Cercle of San (fourth administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Batoma, a member of the group, grows groundnut.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the left. She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Karaba. She is expecting to make an average profit of 21,000 CFA francs at the end of the farming season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing costs and buy agricultural inputs, small farming tools and seeds.

loans.name: Jose Rudy

texts.es:
José, tuvo efectos favorables con la inversión del préstamo anterior, obtuvo mejor cosecha, mantiene la estabilidad económica, continua trabajando, su familia tiene una mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas para cultivar una manzana de maíz, de esta manera tendrá todos los materiales necesarios para acondicionar el terreno en el que siembra y proteger el cultivo de plagas.
texts.en: Jose had good results with his previous loan.  He had a good harvest, has financial stability, and continues to work.  His family has better food, health, and dress.  He is asking for another loan to buy farming supplies to raise an acre of corn.  This way he will have all of the necessary supplies to prepare the land on with he will plant and protect his crops from blights.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nedaa

texts.en: Nedaa is a 24-year-old Master's student majoring in accounting. She is in her second year. She also works as a teacher. Nedaa lives with her parents and seven siblings in Mafraq, Jordan. Her father is a government employee. She is planning to continue her study to get a PhD which will help her find a good job that will help her support her family and to improve herself. Because she is not able to cover her study fees, she is asking for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her study fees.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. She works for seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water and a beauty salon. She has requested for a loan of Uganda shilling 700,000 to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, crates of soda, and peas. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs which increase the operational costs. Her goal and inspiration is to buy a fridge so as to serve her customers better. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, crates of soda, and peas

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Andrea se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de  verduras, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende  cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las  verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Andrea continues her vegetable sales business in different places.  She sells onions, tomatoes, and pumpkins.  She has been doing this business for several years and things are going well for her.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her vegetables.  She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables like onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

She is grateful for the loans and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en: Gorretti is a single mother of five children and two of whom go to school. She has a business of selling fruits and vegetables have been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of oranges and mangos, paw paws and pineapples. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability of fruits.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She resides in house and the family has access to electricity and no to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of oranges and mangos, paw paws and pineapples

loans.name: Canesia

texts.en:
Canesia works hard to support her family. Canesia is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Canesia requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her business.

Canesia has been in this business for 11 years now.

Canesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Providence

texts.en: Providence is 28 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 14 and 2 years three of them go to school. She has been working in a bar for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as beer, soda, and water for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy more foodstuffs for family consumption.

loans.use: To buy more items such as beer, soda, water for sale.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is from Gyumri, where she teaches students in her home and at a local school. Of her three children, her son and oldest child is a sportsman, and her daughters are computer specialists.

Narine has been approved for a 600,000 AMD loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with easier terms to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The requested loan is very important to Narine, as she will use the money to buy books, a printer and a PC that are needed for teaching students in her home. She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her efforts to be more effective and productive.

loans.use: to buy books, a printer and a PC

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21 years old university student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his fourth year. He also works in the evenings at a clothes store. Ahmad is seeking to get his bachelors' so that he will find a good job in his study field that will bring him better income. But he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Begmurod

texts.ru:
Бегмурод жизнерадостный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 47 лет. Он родился и живёт в небольшом посёлке. Живёт он со своей женой и двумя детьми в небольшом доме, который недавно построил. Сам Бегмурод очень много работает, он работает в Министерстве внутренних дел. Он очень уважаемый человек. Для своей семьи делает всё возможное, чтобы они жили в достатке и ни в чём не нуждались. 

Бегмурод вот уже несколько лет сотрудничает с Арванд. Он впервые брал кредит на потребительские нужды. Вот и сейчас также обратился для получения кредита на потребительскую нужду. Сейчас Бегмурод обустраивает свой дом, в котором они живут, чтобы его детям и внукам было комфортно там жить. Он хочет закупить комфортную мебель в дом. Но у него сейчас не достаточно денежных средств, чтобы закупить сразу всю мебель по оптовой цене. Поэтому Бегмурод обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Begmurod is a cheerful and responsible man of 47. He was born in a small town and lives there with his wife and two children in a little house that he built not long ago. Begmurod himself works a lot at his job in the Ministry of Internal Affairs. He is a respectable man and does everything possible so that his family can have everything they need.

For quite a few years Begmurod has worked with Arvand. He first took out a loan to cover personal needs and is doing so again. He is fixing up the house he and his family live in so that his children and grandchildren will be comfortable there. He wants to buy comfortable furniture for his home, but doesn't have enough money right now. Therefore he has turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase furniture. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Maram

texts.en: Maram is a 20 years old university student majoring in Political Science, and she is in her third year. She is living with her family that consists of five members in Zarqa-Jordan. Maram is seeking to get her Bachelors' so that she will continue her study till she gets her Masters'. But she is currently facing financial crisis which is not helping her in paying her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à FINTEGUE, un des villages de la commune de KARABA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec AWA, femme debout au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  KARABA
 , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 39 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They all live in traditional families in Fintegue, a village located in the commune of Karaba, Cercle of San (fourth administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Awa, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is the woman in middle of the back row. She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Karaba. She is expecting to make an average profit of 39,500 CFA francs at the end of the farming season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing costs and buy agricultural inputs, small farming tools and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à FINTEGUE, un des villages de la commune de KARABA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec AWA, 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  KARABA
 , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 53 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women and they are, on average, 37 years old with five children each. They all live in traditional families in Fintegue, a village located in the commune of Karaba, Cercle of San (fourth administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Awa, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the back row, first from the right.  She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to both men and women, in her village and in Karaba. She is expecting to make an average profit of 53,500 CFA francs at the end of the farming season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing costs and buy agricultural inputs, small farming tools and seeds.

loans.name: Vicencia

texts.en: Vicencia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells books in a stationery shop that she rents on retail basis.  She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda shilling 400,000 to buy more religious books, magazines, and novels. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs which increase the operational costs. Her goal and inspirations is to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more religious books, magazines, and novels

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dorothy is 34 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Dorothy has a direct selling beauty products and food supplements business in the Philippines. Dorothy requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of beauty products and food supplements to sell.

Dorothy has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Dorothy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beauty products and food supplements to sell

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush lives in Armavir town with her husband, her 2-years-old child, grandparents-in-laws and mother-in-law. 
She has been in hairdressing service for many years. She provides hairdressing service from her house using one of their small but convenient rooms. 
The requested loan is very important for this young hairdresser to be able to purchase chairs, table and other supplies needed for making her work better. 
She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for chairs, table and other supplies needed for providing hairdressing service

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 44 years old and married with eight children.

Shirly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell.

Shirly has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from massage therapist.

Shirly aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married and works hard to support her family. For the past twenty years she has made a living sewing for others. She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc. for her business.

Conchita is always laboring and saving to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sewing materials for her business

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en: Because Tamam is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to appear in the photo instead. Tamam was born in 1965. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer, and she has been helping him by selling blankets to improve their living conditions. Her daughter Duaa' who is appearing in the photo is a 20 years old Diploma student majoring in Home Economy, and she is in her second year. Duaa' is planning to find a good job in her study field after she gets her Diploma. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughters' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rozana

texts.en: Rozana is a 21 years old university student majoring in Interior Design, and she is in her fourth year. She lives with her family that consists of five members. Rozana is planning to work in her study field after graduation so that she will start supporting her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Save The Forest Group

texts.en:
Monica is a group leader of Save the forest Group of Assin Nyankumasi in the Central Region of Ghana. She is 55 years old and married with 6 children. All the 6 children are currently attending school.

Monica is a petty trader and palm oil producer which she sells at the local market and to soap producing company currently based in Assin Fosu. Monica's main priority now is to secure a loan to purchase a clean cook stove (a.k.a. Elsa Stove) that utilises waste-products, such as Virgin Pellet (Palm Kennel shells) as fuel. Palm Kennel Shells are waste products from her oil processing which she is currently fighting with the disposal of the waste. Monica will use this byproduct from her oil processing and will not incur any fuel cost when she adopts the use of Elsa Stove hence she will save some money for her household. This stove is the product of a research project supported by the African, Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) Group of States Science and Technology Programme and the European Union (EU)to eliminate both indoor and outdoor air pollution and to reduce deforestation.  The adoption and the use of the stove means end to cutting down of trees for fire wood and charcoal for cooking and heating water in their community. 

Monica is now applying for a loan of GHS 170.00 to purchase the improved stove to protect her family from indoor air pollution. Monica is thankful to her micro lenders for their generous support in saving her family from  health hazards and helping to protect the forest in her community.

loans.use: To purchase clean cook stove

loans.name: Kokies Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está integrado por 3 sonrientes y luchadoras mujeres que se organizaron desde hace 10 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar su calidad de vida e incrementar el inventario de los productos que Ofrecen: Elvia se dedica a la venta de bastimentos, Esmeralda vende ropa usada y frijoles cocidos.

Jenny: Es la coordinadora del Grupo Solidario, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas.  Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida desde hace 11 años estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos y ropa nueva.  Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es establecer un microempresa de préstamos para apoyar a los que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three smiling, stiving ladies who got together 10 months ago in order to get a loan to to improve their quality of life and increase the inventory of the products they offer.  Elvia sells food goods, Esmeralda sells used clothing and cooked beans.

Jenny, the group’s coordinator, is from Puerto Cabezas.  In order to have a source of income and improve her quality of life she started selling basic grains and new clothing 11 years ago.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise.  Her dream is to set up a small loan business to support those who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Alba Janete

texts.es: Alba es casada, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar tales como (planchas, licuadoras, ropa de cama, baterías de cocina etc.) inicio su negocio junto a su esposo hace dos años en los cuales han podido adquirir una vivienda propia y tener su casa, ellos venden por las mañanas en la Antigua Guatemala  la mercadería que vende es en cuotas pequeñas con pagos quincenales y esto le permite obtener más ganancias, tiene un cobrador el cual paga mensual, ella solicita el crédito para invertir más en el negocio, anhela tener un negocio mas grande para poder vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Alba is married, has no children, and is engaged in the sale of household items such as irons, blenders, linens, cookware etc.  She started her business with her husband two years ago and due to this, they have been able to acquire a house and have their own home.

They sell in the mornings in the Antigua Guatemala.  The merchandise sold is in small installments with fortnightly payments.  This allows them to get more profits.  They have a program that pays monthly.

She is requesting a loan to invest more in the business.  Her goal is for a bigger business and to live better.

loans.use: to buy household merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Elisilda

texts.en:
Elisilda is 50 years old, and married with three children.

Elisilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has asked for a 13,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elisilda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from sewing.

Elisilda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a direct selling avon products business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from avon like lipsticks, body spray, perfume, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years now.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from avon like lipsticks, body spray, perfume, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is single, and has a banana- and corn-vending business in the Philippines.

Elsie has asked for a 12,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more bananas and corn to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and corn to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Wilma has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona is a divorced woman from Kapan town. She lives with her only child, a 9-year-old son. 

Elona sells clothes and shoes in her house. The assortment of goods she sells is not that big and needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to be productive and compatible. Elona currently needs a loan to buy new clothes to resell to her customers.
 
She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing.

loans.name: Vilma Gloria

texts.es:
Vilma, es casada, junto a su esposo cuidan de dar a su hijo un ambiente sano y seguro, todos viven juntos; ella tiene un negocio de bisutería, el oficio lo aprendió asistiendo a una escuela, luego recibió cursos de una organización gubernamental, en el buen funcionamiento de su negocio la respaldan 4 años de experiencia.
Invertirá en la materia prima, comprándose alambre, hilos, piedras, dijes, broches, entre otros materiales necesarios para elaborar collares, anillos, pulseras, etc., espera aumentar las ventas y ganancias, de esta manera se estabilizará económicamente. 
Sueña con tener un local para ofrecer  otro tipo de productos y aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio para cambiar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: Vilma is married and she and her husband work to provide their son with a safe and secure environment.  She had a costume jewelry business, which she learned to do at school.  She later took courses from a government organization and has been running the business for four years.  She will use the money to buy raw materials such as wire, thread, stones, pendants, clasps, and other necessary supplies to make necklaces, rings, bracelets, etc.  She hopes to increase her sales and earnings and become financially stable.  She dreams of having a shop where she can offer other types of products and increase her profits from her business, so she can change her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Lambart

texts.en: 26-year-old Lambart owns a farming supplies (agro-inputs) shop in Hoima, Uganda. He earns additional income from farming wages. He hopes to start building his own house, despite the hardships of customers who don't pay on time. He has asked for credit to buy more agro-inputs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more agricultural inputs for resale.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipolito tiene 64 años de edad, es csasado, vive con su conyuge, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayalti, él goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su comunidad está ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Hipolito se dedica a la actividad del servicio de transporte en mototaxi, cuenta con 1 mototaxi, desde hace más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio, brinda servicio de transporte en Cayalti y anexos. Él solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, y de forma asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo ya que es mediante esta que él logra obtener ingresos para solventar sus gastos y los de su esposa.
texts.en:
Hipolito is 64 years old, married, and lives with his wife in a home of their own in a small community located in the Cayalti rural area.  He has good personal and professional references from his neighbors.  The community is located in the Chiclayo province, within the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Hipolito drives a moto-taxi that he owns.  He has been providing transportation in Cayalti and the surrounding areas for ten years.  He is asking for a loan to maintain his moto-taxi and ensure that his work tool works correctly becasue this is how he obtains an income to pay his and his wife’s expenses.

loans.use: to maintain his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Katinga

texts.en:
Katinga is involved in the management and sale of decorative trees and plants. She started her business two years ago. Katinga purchases saplings, grows trees and plants, and then sells them in local markets. The loan she has asked for is very important for her new developing business, to buy new types of saplings of decorative trees and plants.
 
Katinga lives with her retired mother, her daughter and school-age grandchildren. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy new types of saplings of decorative trees and plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a milk cow and improve her two children's quality of life.

loans.name: Amka Classic School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fredie. He is the Head Teacher of Amka Classic School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Mutungo in Kampala with 544 students. Amka Classic School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Amka Classic School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Fredie ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Naguru Parents School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Diana. She is the Head Teacher of Naguru Parents School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Naguru in Kampala with 600 students. Naguru Parents School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Naguru Parents will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Diana ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia Justina se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia sigue trabajando en una entidad publica, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y rocoto relleno, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Justina continues dedicating herself to the restaurant business. She continues working in a public entity. The member makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and stuffed peppers. 

She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and has now been doing this business for five years and is doing very well. The member's dream is to have a restaurant. She is seeking the loan to buy products to cook such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of her quota.

loans.use: to buy products to cook, such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married, 38 years old and lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking mother, with five children aged between 5 and 15, four of whom attend school. She started selling clothes in 2010 to make additional income. 

Margret's dream is to see her business grow to new heights. Her main challenges are the scarcity of customers, and bad debtors. Margret has asked for a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es: Ercilia es una señora de 34 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 8 años y una niña de 5 meses, los 2 niños asisten a la escuela, Ercilia juntamente con su esposo trabajan en una vulcanizadora ayudándole a pegar llantas, esta señora trabajadora también se dedica a lavar vajilla en un salón de comida este trabajo lo hace a medio tiempo, adicionalmente cría pollos en la casa que le presta su hermana donde vive con su familia,el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar su negocio, la aspiración de Ercilia es llegar a tener una casita propia para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ercilia is a 34-year-old woman. She has two sons who are 6 and 8 years old, and a 5-month-old daughter. Her two sons go to school.

Ercilia, together with her husband, works in a tire shop helping to glue rims. She's a hardworking woman and also earns a living doing part-time work dishwashing in a dining hall. 

She also raises chickens at the home lent by her sister, where she lives with her family. She will invest the loan in the purchase of chickens to increase her business. 

Ercilia's aspiration is to have her own little house to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Clean Cooking Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 57 years old. She is married with ten children; six of whom are now grown, and the remaining four are currently attending school. Agnes is a peasant farmer and grows cassava, maize, yams and sweet potato, and produces palm oil. She lives with her family at Assin Nyankumasi in the Central Region of Ghana. She earns enough money from the palm oil processing to support her family. 

Agnes is the leader of the Clean Cooking Group from Assin Nyankumanse. The entire group has resolved to change from the use of fossil fuel to clean cooking after their community exposure education by the Field Partner. Agnes's main problem is that she can't afford to buy an Elsa Stove clean cooking stove to replace her open mud firewood stove.

Agnes is very anxious to buy a clean stove to reduce indoor air pollution, to save the lives of her family. Besides, she will save the money on buying firewood because she can get the fuel for the clean stove (virgin pellet) from her oil processing. Together with her group members, she is very happy because using the clean stove will protect the forest in her community. Agnes is grateful to her micro-lenders for their unfailing support. Your micro-loan means reducing child- and maternal-mortality, and illnesses.

loans.use: To buy a clean cooking stove

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan se sigue dedicando al negocio de verduras y tambien sigue trabajando como maestro de obras, el socio lleva a diferentes lugares, el socio vende  cebollas, tomates y zapallos, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar  verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan continues to sell vegetables and working as a master of labor.  He sells onions, tomatoes, and pumpkins in different areas.  He’s had this business for several years and things have gone well.  His dream is to have a shop from where he can sell his fruits and vegetables.  He is asking for a loan to buy vegetables like onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Andrew. 

Andrew is a passionate smallholder farmer based in Kiborbor village in the Saboti area of Kenya. For the last six years, he has been practising mixed farming to support his family of four children. Andrew makes money selling milk and a variety of food crops, such as maize, from his farm. 

Andrew is seeking a loan because he wants to get his hands on poultry. This is a diversification from dairy and crop farming. He enjoys dairy farming as much as he does crop farming. However, the region usually experiences long dry spells which inevitably affects crop harvests negatively. For this reason, Andrew is seeking a loan to buy poultry. Poultry will serve both subsistence and commercial purposes. There is a high demand for poultry products in the developing town of Kitale, which is the nearest town to Andrew's village. Proceeds from the sale of eggs will help Andrew cope with the rising farm expenses that is putting many farmers in the region out of business. 

His long-term plan is to free his family from the chains of poverty.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anatori

texts.en:
Anatori is 33 years old, and lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a married, hardworking man with three children, and he sells clothes alongside earning a salary to generate income. 

Anatori started his business to increase his income. He wants to expand his business, despite the challenges of inadequate capital. He will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 60 years old, and married with ten children, five of whom are attending school. 

James deals in crop production, mainly maize and cassava, and gets additional income from renting. He started his business to be self-reliant. His major challenge is inadequate capital and price fluctuation. He is a hardworking man, who plans to use the loan to pay workers for harvesting his crops.

The children in the photo were passing from school when the photo was being taken.

loans.use: to pay workers for harvesting his crops.

loans.name: Dúo Maranatha Group

texts.es: Dúo Maranatha, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Romelia quien se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en ropa de sunga mano, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que el anhelo de ella es tener un local mas grande para generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Dúo Maranatha, is a group formed by Romelia, who makes a living selling used clothing. She has engaged in this activity for several years. 

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in the form of used clothing. She hopes that you can support her as her aspiration is to have a larger store to generate earnings.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
La socia Jennifer se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de caramelos, la socia vende chicles, chupetes y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chicles, chupetes y galletas.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Jennifer continues to sell candy, gum, suckers, and cookies.  She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and has had this business for seven years.  Things are going very well.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.  She will use the money from this loan to buy gum, suckers, and cookies.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y pescado frito, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el restaurant.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Pamela continues to work in the restaurant business, where she makes different dishes such as roasted chicken, soups, and fried fish.  She works from 8 A.M until 9 P.M.  She has had this business for 5 years and it is going well.  Her dream is to expand the restaurant.  She is asking for this loan to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

Receiving this loan makes her happy, and she is committed to completing her repayment quotas.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Maria Edit

texts.es:
María, invirtió el préstamo anterior en mejorar su negocio y establecer mejor la mini panadería, ha aumentado sus ventas, sus ingresos son mejores, su estilo de vida familiar es más confortable.
Para continuar mejorando su negocio se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, manteca entre otros ingredientes importantes para elaborar el pan y seguir manteniendo a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
María invested her last loan in the improvement of her business and establishment of her mini-bakery.  She has increased her sales, profits are up, and her family lives more comfortably.

To continue improving her business, she has decided to take out a new loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, butter, and other important ingredients to make bread and continue to keep her clients satisfied.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, butter, and other important ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, a mother of three, has been practicing mixed farming for the past four years. She is based in Mosocho, a remote village in the Kisii area of Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry in her small piece of land. Her primary sources of income are eggs, crops and some personal business that she engages in to make extra cash. She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what she loves, she stated “rearing chickens.” She sells eggs and poultry meat to her neighbors and to the local market, and her client base has really grown, but she faces a challenge of fully satisfying the demand.

To meet the demand of the increased market, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. With the loan she is going to fully satisfy the demand that is there, and this will translate to more cash income. Other than increased profit margins, she will also benefit from poultry manure, which has high nitrogen and helps in improving soil fertility. She will save more money that she initially used for buying manure. Having gone through financial training, she will repay back the loan and improve her living conditions. Saved profits will be used in paying tuition fees for her school-going children and increasing her business.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Maciano Gilmor

texts.es:
Maciano es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene 60 años de edad, es viudo y vive en Imperial junto a su familia. Tiene dos maravillosos hijos que son los más importante para él, y por quienes desde muy joven ha luchado para convertirlos en personas de bien. Ahora que sus hijos son mayores apoyan a Maciano de manera incondicional. A pesar del dolor por la pérdida de su amada esposa ha sabido salir adelante, desde hace más de 4 años trabaja como Albañil de obras de Construcción y le va muy bien porque siempre realiza excelentes trabajos.
Maciano quiere brindar mayor seguridad a sus hijos, es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá construir una vereda alrededor de su casa y también un muero en la parte trasera, para que de esta manera pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y puedan tener mayor bienestar. Con esto él seguirá esforzándose por su familia y quiere seguir disfrutando de sus nietos por mucho más tiempo.
texts.en:
Maciano is a very enterprising 60-year-old.  He is a widower and he lives in Imperial with his family.  He has two marvelous children who are the most important thing in the world to him, and for whom he has fought since they were young to make them into good people.  Now that his children are older, they support Maciano unconditionally.  Despite the pain he has suffered from losing his beloved wife, he has learned how to move forwards.  For more than 4 years, he has worked as a bricklayer on construction sites, which is going well for him since he always does excellent work.  
 
Maciano wants to bring better security to his children, and therefore he would be very grateful for a Kiva loan since it would enable him to construct a path around his house and a wall in the rear of the house.  These will improve the quality of life and well-being of his family.  This will allow him to continue to work hard for his family, and he wants to continue to enjoy spending time with his grandchildren for many years to come.

loans.use: to construct a wall and a path for his house

loans.name: Kenan

texts.en:
Kenan lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a married hardworking man, aged 24. He sells motorcycle spare parts. He also grows crops to supplement his income. He started his business so as to be self-employed. He desires to expand his business into new markets. Inadequate capital is his major challenge.

He will use the loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 40 and married with five children aged between 3 and 17; four attend school. He owns a retail shop and gets additional income from transport and school businesses. He started his business to improve household income. He faces a challenge of limited capital. 

He is an honest man who needs the loan to construct four rental rooms.

loans.use: to construct four rental rooms.

loans.name: Tainage

texts.en: Tainage is a 60-year-old married maize farmer who lives with his wife in Hoima, Uganda. He used the previous loan to pay for labor and buy farm inputs. Despite the challenge of limited capital, Tainage hopes to expand his business. He is accessing credit to buy fertilizers and hire a tractor to plow 20 acres of maize.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hire a tractor to plow 20 acres of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio Miguel Angel se sigue dedicando al trabajo como construccion de obras,el socio es albañil y realiza diferentes trabajos como pinturas y construccion de casas,el sueño del socio es tener un negocio de venta de madera.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas como pinturas y clavos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Miguel Angel continues to work in construction.  He is a mason and does different things such as painting and building houses.  His dream is to have a lumber business.  He is asking for this loan to buy tools such as paint and nails.  He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cintya Mabel

texts.es: Cintya es una señorita de 19 años de edad, ella en madre soltera, su hija tiene un año,  Cintya  vive en la casa de su madre con su hija y sus hermanas, ahí mismo hay un lotecito donde puede tener sus chanchos, ella se dedica a l jornal y es un año que se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio, Cintya espera seguir con la crianza de chanchos para de ahí mantener a su hija y terminar por lo menos sus estudios secundarios ya que en la actualidad asiste al colegio los fines de semana o sea estudia  semipresencial.
texts.en: Cintya is a 19 year old young woman and the single mother of a one year old girl.  Cintya lives with her mother with her daughter and sisters.  There is also a small piece of land there where she can keep her pigs and she has been raising them for a year.  She will use the money from this loan to buy pigs to improve her business.  Cintya wants to continue raising pigs so she can support her daughter and allow her to complete at least her secondary education.  She attends school on the weekends.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a religious leader in Hoima, Uganda. He earns additional income from farming. He chose to be a religious leader so as to preach the gospel/good news. He hopes to educate his children such that they become self-reliant. He is accessing credit to pay school fees for his son.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Chrismary

texts.en:
Chrismary lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is aged 30 and married with children aged 1 and 2 years; none of them is attending school. She owns a bar and gets extra income from pool tables, a restaurant and lodge services. She started her business to generate extra income. Her major challenge is competition.

She is honest and will use the loan to buy two new pool tables and buy more beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy two new pool tables and buy more beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 46-year-old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. When he realized some good savings from cocoa farming and selling, he decided to start a small shop to improve his household income. He dreams of seeing all his children attain the basic education and having a very posh residential house for the family, although limited capital and competition affects his progress. 

He wants a loan to buy beer, soda, flour, sugar and other shop items to sell.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda, flour, sugar and other shop items to sell.

loans.name: Ada Beatriz

texts.es:
Ada, utilizo el préstamo anterior para fortalecer su tienda y dar mantenimiento al molino nixtamal, con lo que se le ha facilitado mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, sus ingresos estables, cumple con sus obligaciones y apoya de mejor manera a su hijo en la educación.
Con el objetivo de seguir mejorando su negocio se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertir en insumos para la tienda, comprara aceite, azúcar, golosinas, pan, granos básicos y otros productos con los que ofrecerá a sus clientes mejores opciones de compra, espera tener buenos resultados como en el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Ada used the previous loan to strengthen her store and do maintenance on her nixtamal grinder.  It allowed her to keep her customers satisfied and her profits stable, to fulfill her obligations and to better support her son's education.  

Towards the aim of continuing to improve her business, she has decided to apply for a new loan to invest in supplies for the store.  She will buy oil, sugar, candy, bread, basic grains, and other products so that she can offer more options to her customers.  She hopes to get good results from this loan like she did with the previous one.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, candy, bread, basic grains, and other products to offer more options to her customers

loans.name: Dúo Miel Group

texts.es: Dúo Miel este grupo esta conformado por la señora Sandra de 25 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, inicio su negocio desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en ropa de segunda mano para la venta, el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande para generar mejores ganancias, espera que le púedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: One member of the Dúo Miel group is Sandra, a 25-year-old used clothing salesman who started her business several years ago.  She is asking for a loan to buy more secondhand clothing merchandise to sell.  Her dream is to have a bigger shop to be able to make better profits.  She hopes that you can help her with the loan that she is asking for.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura has been trading in women’s clothing and underwear from her house. In the past, Marina used to travel to the neighboring countries to purchase inventory. Now, she puts her orders through other traders so she can spend more time managing her house and taking care of her family. Laura lives with her husband and 9-year-old daughter. 

Currently, she requires new stock for her retail business. With a good credit history behind her, to help her finance the inventory order, Laura has applied to SEF International for a loan.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing

loans.name: Sirena Group

texts.es: Alice: Es una mujer amable y luchadora, tiene 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos adolescentes. Es la coordinadora del grupo. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingresos y mejor la calidad de vida de su familia estableció su pequeña pulpería desde hace 13 años. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: chivería, granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, detergentes, cloro entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener una finca para dedicarse a engorde de cerdo.
texts.en: Alice is a friendly and hardworking woman.  She is 32 years old, married, and has three teen-aged children.  She serves as the group’s coordinator.  In order to have her own source of income and improve her family’s quality of life, she set up a small store 13 years ago.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as chivería, basic grains, instant soup, detergents, bleach, and other things.  Her dream is to have a pig farm.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Flor de Azucena tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia vende a sus amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y trabajadores de empresa privada.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
She is a member of the SAN VALENTIN communal bank, located in the Cusco province.  Flor de Azucena is 29 years old, single, and sells beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes, and other things.  She sells to her friends, family, and other customers and has been doing this for some time and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts in.  She wants to continue working to support her family this way and is asking for this loan to buy colognes.  She is grateful for this loan and promisses to make her payments on time.

The other members have a grocery store or work for private companies.  The member in the added pucture was late becasue of work commitments.

loans.use: to buy colognes.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Simon. For five years and counting, Simon has been practicing mixed farming. He is very content with the conservative nature of the farming lifestyle. He is mostly appreciative of the fact that farming has enabled him to sustain his family of four children over the years. On his farm, he keeps dairy animals and grows maize/corn. He also engages in other businesses outside but related to farming to earn extra shillings.

Simon is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Like many farmers, he is only planning to keep single poultry: chickens. From the hens, he will be able to sell meat and eggs to the local hospitality industries.

The demand for chicken products in Kitale has never been higher. With your loan, Simon will be in a position to acquire several chickens and establish his mark in this lucrative space.

He stated that the money from the new venture will be dedicated to the education of his children. He believes with proper schooling as the foundation for his children, they will certainly lead a better life in their future and the generations to come.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Наргиза позитивная и трудолюбивая девушка в возрасте 28 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Наргиза мечтала стать врачом, и с помощью своих родителей ей удалось получить профессию врача. Она очень любит людей,  и сейчас она работает медсестрой в местной больнице. Но, в свободное от работы время она занимается своим дополнительным бизнесом, который приносит ей дополнительный доход. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Наргиза вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Выращивают скот, затем продают полученное от скота мясо и молоко. Муж Наргизы также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Наргиза с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Наргиза заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Nargiza is an upbeat, hardworking 28-year-old who is married with two children.  She lives in a small rural village, and has dreamed of working in healthcare ever since she was young.  With the help of her parents, she was able to see her dreams to fruition and currently works as a nurse in a local hospital.  She and her husband do everything they can to provide for their children; in her free time away from the hospital, they raise cattle, selling their meat and milk to earn some extra money for the family.  Her husband also works in a local workshop to help make ends meet.  Their combined income allows them a modest standard of living, and they have trouble paying for many of the things they need.

Currently, Nargiza is seeking to buy more cattle for fattening, and she's turned to Arvand for a loan to do so.  She would like to thank Arvand in advance for their help; help which will allow her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is aged 37. She is married with four children aged between 12 and one years. Two of them go to school. She sells potatoes and has been in this business for the past 10 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve the standard for her children, and to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for selling.

loans.name: Gregoire

texts.en: Gregoire is 57 years old.  He is married with four children aged between 22 and 14 years. One of them goes to school. He sells food stuff and has been running a business for the past 17 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more bananas and cassavas for selling. The profits from the business will be used to buy soap, pay school fees and construct iron.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and cassavas for selling.

loans.name: Kahondo Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Robert is a hard-working, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices lumbering as his main source of income, though he also carries out farming. He started this business to increase his income and have a better standard of living. He faces the challenge of seasons and weather changes that affect his business. He has a vision of owning a big, modern timber store in the years to come.

He is requesting a loan to buy another machine for cutting timber and to pay workers.

loans.use: to buy another machine for cutting timber and to pay workers.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia Nilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende ropa para niños y adultos, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nilda continues to sell clothing for children and adults.  She sells pants, blouses, and polo shirt and has been doing so for several years.  Things are going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a store.  She is asking for a loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

She is happy for the loan and promises to be on time with her payments.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Quality Environment Group

texts.en:
Mary is a native of Bethlehem in Assin Nyankumasi in the Central Region of Ghana. She is 47 years old and married with four children aged 11, nine, six and four. Mary has been growing oranges and a palm plantation for the past 22 years. She produces palm oil from the palm fruits that she harvests from her own farm. Mary is also a food marketer and sells some of her own grown food stuffs at the local market on market days.

Mary's main challenge now is to secure a loan to purchase a clean cooking stove (AKA an Elsa Stove) that utilises waste products, such as palm kennel shells (Virgin Pellets) as fuel. Mary cannot wait to use this cost-saving and affordable clean cooking stove to improve her means of cooking. She is so eager because she can now find use for her by-product virgin pellet, which will save her from carrying heavy loads of firewood from the farm after a hard day's work. She is equally glad to save money from buying firewood and charcoal on the days she could not go to the farm. 

Mary and her group have decided to use clean cooking stoves after community education about saving the forest and ways to reduce indoor/outdoor air pollution. Mary is now applying for 170 GHS to purchase an Elsa Clean Cook stove to protect her family from indoor air pollution and to reduce cutting of the tress from the forest in her village for charcoal and firewood. Mary says thank you to all her micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a clean cooking stove that utilises waste-products as fuel.

loans.name: Discipline 3 Group

texts.en:
These six Discipline women live in the same community in Accra. They all work in the trading industry, selling slippers, materials, banku (cooked corn and cassava dough) and fish, foodstuffs, and kenkey (cooked corn dough). They chose the name for their group because they strongly believe in discipline and have a clear vision of where they want to see themselves in the future. They are now starting their fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They grew their businesses and learned a lot from the training with the MFI during their previous loan sections and are eager to have more financial literacy training and more advice in order to grow their businesses even more.

One of these entrepreneurial women is Rebecca (far second from left) who is 52 years old and married with two children who are still in school. She has only a third grade education but she is a smart businesswoman who is proud of selling slippers, which she has done for four years. Her husband works as a construction worker and helps her support the family.

Her group has learned many useful things in the various loan levels, such as how to keep their sales and expenses in a notebook, and how to separate personal money from business money. Using the advice from her Business Adviser, she grew her business dramatically. Her goal for this cycle is to buy more slippers to sell to customers. Another goal is to increase the net income of her business and create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Wahib

texts.en:
Wahib is a 33 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up in a refugee camp located in South Lebanon. Since 1994, he has been working in the furniture making industry inside the camp where he has been manufacturing all types of wooden furniture for living rooms and bedrooms. He is married to a young Palestinian refugee he grew up with inside the camp. Together, they have three kids who are in their first years of school. 
He is asking for a 2,458,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He plans to use the loan to renew and expand his equipment kit in order to improve his business performance and increase his income. Thus, he will be able to provide his wife and three children with better living conditions despite the harsh and unstable socio-economic situation that has been going on in the camps.

loans.use: to buy new furntiure making tools and increase his sources of income

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a young Syrian in her late twenties. She has been living in Lebanon with her husband and children for several years and works in sewing different types of crochet ranging from clothes, to accessories and hand picked decorative items.  
She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She plans to use the loan to buy a sewing machine and expand her sewing kit which will help her develop her small business. 
She needs to improve her business to provide her three young children with better living conditions and cover their needs under an unstable socio-economic situation.

loans.use: to expand her sewing kit

loans.name: Manar

texts.en: Manar is a 22 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. She is newly married to a young Palestinian refugee who works in constructions. She owns a small grocery store inside the camp. She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She plans to use the loan to increase her stocks in food supplies, beverages and candies. In such way, she will expand her business and increase her income which will help her provide her infant child with a health environment and start saving part of her income to cover her child's educational and personal needs under an unstable socio-economic situation.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her grocery store

loans.name: Sodalo

texts.fr: Veuve   âgée de 69 ans, Sodalo est mère et  a  trois(3) enfants  en charge dans le quartier de Bè. Elle fait le petit commerce comme activité avec  l’achat et vente de charbon de bois et du gari. Sodalo s’approvisionne 4  fois  par mois auprès d’une marchande du quartier qu’elle revend à la devanture de son domicile. Sodalo sollicite un prêt pour  agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Sodalo is a 69-year-old widow. She is a mother living in the Bé district and has three dependent children. She has a small business buying and selling charcoal and ginger. Sodalo stocks up four times every month from a local merchant and sells her products outside her home. Sodalo requests a loan to expand her business in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à FINTEGUE, un des villages de la commune de KARABA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec ATA, femme assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  KARABA
 , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 18 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women who on average are 32 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in Fintegue, one of the villages in the Karaba commune in the San circle, in the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming affairs during the winter.
This is their third loan from the institution, the previous loans were repaid on time.
Ata grows peanuts. She is sitting in the middle in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy earth products, seeds, and small agricultural tools and to pay for labour costs for the exploitation of 0.5 hectares.
She will sell the production in the village and in Karaba after the harvest to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make an average profit of 18 500FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: with labour costs, and to buy products for the earth, small farming equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 40 years old and married with six children between the ages of 2 and 15. All of them go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum, maize, flour and milk for resale. The profits from her business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum, maize, flour and milk for resale.

loans.name: Mana
