texts.fr: Veuve âgée de 37 ans, Mana est mère et a un enfant en charge dans le quartier de Bè. Elle fait le petit commerce comme activité avec  l’achat des maïs  et utilise pour la préparation de la bouillie qu’ elle revend au bord de la route. Mana  s’approvisionne une  fois  par mois au marché d’akodessewa. Mana sollicite un prêt pour  agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Mana is a 37-year-old widow with a dependent child living in the Bé district. She has a small business buying corn that she uses to prepare a gruel that she sells at the roadside. Mana buys her stock once a month at the market in Akodessewa. Mana requests a loan in order to expand her business and make a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy  67 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Quality Air Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a 51-year-old married woman with four children. She lives with her family in Bethlehem in Assin Nyankumasi in the Central Region of Ghana. All her children are currently attending school. Agnes is a peasant farmer who grows cassava, plantain and maize to help her husband feed their family. Agnes also processes palm oil, which she sells in the local market during market days. Agnes has been doing this for the past 15 years. She belongs to Quality Air Group.

Agnes' main problem is obtaining funds to purchase the ELSA clean-cook stove. She spends 5 GHS daily to buy firewood, which is now difficult to get on the days that are not market days. The ELSA clean-cook stove uses waste-products, such as palm-kennel shells, as fuel, which is found everywhere in the community. The by-product of her oil processing will save Agnes 5 GHS daily that she otherwise would spend on firewood. Agnes cannot wait to use the stove to reduce indoor air pollution and to save the lives of her children. Agnes is grateful to her microlenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To purchase a clean-cook stove

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à FINTEGUE, un des villages de la commune de KARABA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec BLANDINE,  1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  KARABA
 , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 32 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women who on average are 32 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in Fintegue, one of the villages in the Karaba commune in the San circle, in the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming affairs during the winter.
This is their third loan from the institution, the previous loans were repaid on time.
Blandine grows peanuts. She is the first woman sitting on the left in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy products for the earth, seeds, and small agricultural material and to pay for labour costs for the exploitation of 1 hectare.
She will sell the production in the village and in Karaba after the harvest to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make an average profit of 32 500FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, to buy products for the earth, small farming instruments and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à FINTEGUE, un des villages de la commune de KARABA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec MINATA DRAMANE,  1ère femme assise de la droite  vers  la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  KARABA
 , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 44 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women who on average are 33 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in Fintegue, one of the villages in the Karaba commune in the San circle, in the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming affairs during the winter.
This is their third loan from the institution, the previous loans were repaid on time.
Minata Dramane grows peanuts. She is the first woman sitting on the right in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy products for the earth, seeds, and small agricultural material and to pay for labour costs for the exploitation of 1 hectare.
She will sell the production in the village and in Karaba after the harvest to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make an average profit of 44 000FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, to buy fertiliser and weed killer, small farming materials and seeds.

loans.name: Oye Paa Group

texts.en:
Sabina is the group leader of Oye Paa Group. She is a 47-year-old married woman with four children ages 28, 25, 20, and 18. She lives in Bethlehem in Assin Nyankumasi in the Central Region of Ghana.

Sabina is small-scale farmer and grows cassava, maize and plantain. She also produces palm oil, which she sells at the local market. Sabina has been farming and running her small business for the past 18 years to help her husband to improve the lives of their family. Sabina is very positive about the prospect of her businesses. Sabina's most recent effort is to use the ELSA clean-cook stove, which was developed through the research of ACP Science and Technology Programme/European Union to reduce deforestation and indoor and outdoor air pollution. Sabina has virgin pellets as a by-product from her oil processing as fuel for the stove; hence she will no longer spend long hours in the forest looking for firewood to cook for her family. A loan of 170 GHS will help Sabina to achieve this vision. She is pleased with her micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a clean-cook stove

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Veuve âgée de 64 ans, Abla est mère et a un enfant en charge dans le quartier de Bè. Elle fait le petit commerce comme activité avec l’achat et vente de charbon de bois. Abla s’approvisionne 4 fois  par mois auprès des marchands grossistes et revend à domicile. Abla  sollicite un prêt pour  agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Abla is a 64-year-old widow with a dependent child living in the Bé district. She has a small business buying and selling charcoal. Abla stocks up four times a month from wholesalers and resells her goods from home. Abla requests a loan in order to expand her business and make a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Reseau Group

texts.fr: RESEAU est un  groupement de promotion féminin qui regroupe 12 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier et se réunissent tous les quinze jours pour des cotisations. Elles sont à leur 2ème prêt et ont comme présidente Madame Ndèye Coumba qui a levé la main sur la photo.Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 40 ans elle s’active dans l’achat et la vente de riz, blé, farine. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter et vendre du riz, de la farine et du blé. Elle voudrait augmenter ses revenir en diversifiant ses produits et cela grace à l’aide de l’institution.
texts.en: Reseau is a feminine promotion group of 12 people who all live in the same district and meet every two weeks to pay their subscriptions. This is their second loan and Mrs. Ndèye Coumba is their president. She has her hand raised in the photo. She is married with children. She is 40 years old and works in the commerce of rice, wheat and flour. She has over five years experience in this field and helps her husband to manage the daily expenses and school fees for their children. She starts her day at 0900 and finishes work at 1900. She requests this loan for the purchase and resale of rice, flour and wheat. She would like to increase her revenue by diversifying her products with the help of the institution.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice for resale in small quantities.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is forty-three years of age. She is married with three children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In 1992 she committed herself to growing cocoa which has assisted her to make some good income to sustain her family's basic needs. 

She wishes to expand her plantations to get more profits and develop her family although unfavorable weather conditions affect her growth. She is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer and that is where he earns a living though he also has a retail shop to earn an extra income. He started this business to earn a living. He faces challenges of weather and inadequate capital. However he has a dream of becoming a modernized farmer. 

He is requesting a loan to buy manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 34-years-old married woman with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She deals in selling fresh foods, a bar and the selling of produce. She started these businesses in order to earn a living. 

She faces the hardship of competition and poor roads, as she always has to transport fresh foods to different markets. However, she has hopes of educating her children to higher levels of learning. 

Rose needs a loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 14-Tiền Phong - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga is 29 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. 

Nga operates a stall selling ghost money (joss paper). Nga has been involved in this business for 2 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more material to make ghost money to sell. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Nga is the group leader of the Nhóm 14-Tiền Phong - Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Nga hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more material to make ghost money (joss paper) to sell.

loans.name: Salezio

texts.en:
Salezio is a 58-year-old businessman. He is married with 10 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows mainly cocoa. After saving a little money from cocoa selling, he started a small bar in his area to improve his household income. Being a family man, he works hard to send all his children to school and meet all the family obligations. He wishes to expand his business to a big bar. He is faced with the hardships of theft and inadequate capital to maintain his business. 

He has acquired a loan to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.use: To buy beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta started her business 10 years ago. She owns a little shop where she sells flowers and wreaths. She loves her work and works hard to gather a high income. Due to her kind attitude towards people, she has managed to gain many loyal customers. Now she wants to enlarge her business and increase sales at the shop. She has applied for this loan to renovate the storage area where she keeps flowers. This is very important for her to be able to meet the current demand and stay competitive in the market.

Mareta will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her storage area

loans.name: Laulence

texts.en:
Laulence is a 45-year-old married man with four children who are fifteen, ten, four and two years old. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer and that is where he earns a living although he also deals in selling coffee to earn extra income. He started this business to earn a living. He faces the challenge of pests and diseases. However, he has a dream of becoming a modernized farmer.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure to maintain his coffee.

loans.use: to buy manure to maintain his coffee plants

loans.name: Elizaveta

texts.en:
Elizaveta lives in the Ardenic village of the Shirak region. She lives there alone, as her son serves in the army, and her daughter is married and lives with her own family. Elizaveta's husband left his home last year and went abroad as a migrant worker. He works hard to support his wife financially. 

Elizaveta herself takes care of her family farm. She keeps livestock of cows, sheep, calves and beehives. For the development of her farm, Elizaveta needs more funds. The requested loan of USD 3000 will be a big support for Eliza to purchase a tractor and start the cultivation work. She hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a tractor for cultivation work.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is young lady from Masis. She lives there with her parents and brother. Anahit's whole family is engaged in farming and the resale of agricultural products. In particular, they cultivate wheat, potato and beetroot.

Anahit's father and brother sell the gathered harvest in local markets and gather income for the family's living. 

The family owns a plot of land, where they plan to enlarge wheat cultivation in order to restore soil fertility.  The requested loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support for this hardworking family to solve problems. They plan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds and hire workers for gathering the harvest. 

Please help Anahit to fund her loan and be helpful tro  their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds and hire workers to gather the harvest

loans.name: Shushik

texts.en:
Shushik lives in Tsaghkalanj village of Aravir region. She lives there with her son and daughter. Shushik's children greatly help her with her farming work. The farm that they run includes cultivation of cabbage, cucumber, potato. The family also keeps 3 mother pigs which they keep for reselling in the winter. 

The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Shushik as it will allow her to purchase cucumber seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and forage for feeding the livestock. This will let Shushik and her children gather a good harvest and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to pay for cucumber seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta and her husband always knew that they wanted to start a farming business and have a profitable farm. They currently keep a livestock of piglets, 3 pigs, rabbits and hens. The farm also includes arable land where some greens are grown. 

As agriculture is very important for the family's daily income, Marieta is asking for more funds to develop it. The requested loan of USD 2,500 will greatly support her to purchase sows and food to feed them. Please support Marieta with this loan and help her to enlarge her farm.

Marieta lives together with her husband and two daughters (aged 19 and 17).

loans.use: to pay for sows and food to feed them.

loans.name: Jocote Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras de la comunidad de Lamlaya, que se localiza a 30 minutos de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron para acceder a financiamiento, mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias y comprar mariscos para venderlos a precios accesibles en la ciudad de Bilwi. 

Ermelinda: Es la Coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Jocote, tiene 25 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos, el mayor de 8 años estudia su segundo grado de primaria y tiene dos menores de edad. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de  bastimento, helados y mariscos.  Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar: yuca, plátanos, pilipitas, cuadrados, malanga, mariscos e insumos para elaborar bolis que los vende en su casa. Sueña con llegar a tener una pulpería y ferretería.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three entrepreneurial women from Lamlaya, a community located 30 minutes from the city of Bilwi, in Puerto Cabezas. These women formed a group to be able to request loans, improve their families’ living conditions and buy seafood to sell it at affordable prices in Bilwi.

Ermelinda is the coordinator of this group, called Jocote. She is 25 and a single mother of three children. The eldest child goes to second grade and the remaining ones are still very young. A year ago, she started selling groceries, ice creams and seafood.

She is requesting a loan for the second time to buy cassava, plantain, “filipitas” and “cuadrados” [different types of banana], malanga [a starchy vegetable], seafood and ingredients to prepare the popsicles she sells at home. Her dream is to have her own grocery/hardware store.

loans.use: to buy cassava, different types of bananas, plantains, seafood and ingredients to make popsicles.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur 6ème prêt solidaire. DJENEBA, 1ère femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100Kgs de riz, 50Kgs de mil, 50Kgs de maïs, 20Kgs de fonio et 20Kgs d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 13 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabaly group have an average age of 31 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the districts of the town of San/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to known each other via family relationships, and they buy and sell condiments. Having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Sabaly group are on their 6th group loan.

Djeneba, the woman on the right of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 100kgs of rice, 50kgs of millet, 50kgs of maize, 20 kgs of fonio and 20kgs of groundnuts. She gets her supplies locally and from the surrounding villages. She makes her sales to clientèle made up of women and men, for cash and often credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 13 000 francs which she will spend on health care, food, clothing and her children's education. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and groundnuts.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à MORIBILA-KONOSSO, un des villages de la commune de MORIBILA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide et le mil avec CHATOU, femme assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  MORIBILA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Moribila-Konosso, one of the villages in the commune of Moribila, San Circle (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the institution, and they have correctly repaid their previous loans.

Chatou, the woman sitting in the middle in the photo, grows groundnuts and millet. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Moribila, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 40 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the labourers' wages and to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à MORIBILA-KONOSSO, un des villages de la commune de MORIBILA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali.

La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec  BINTOU FOUSSEINI, femme assise au milieu sur la photo.

La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  MORIBILA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the institution. They have properly repaid their previous loans.

Bintou Fousseini, the woman sitting in the middle in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to maintain 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Moribila, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 20 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the labourers' wages and to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi is a young farmer from Hovtun village. She lives with her parents and brother who are also engaged in farming. 

The family keeps livestock of cows, sheep, piglets, hens and calves, as well as cultivates wheat. Varduhi is requesting this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer and cover harvest gathering costs, and hire workers. Lenders will show great support to Varduhi and her family if they fund this loan and support their farming business to develop further. 

As this is Varduhi's first loan; it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fertilizer and to cover harvest gathering costs, and hire workers

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à MORIBILA-KONOSSO, un des villages de la commune de MORIBILA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec MAWA, 1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  MORIBILA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 22 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the institution. They have properly repaid their previous loans.

Mawa, the woman sitting on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to maintain 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Moribila, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 22 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the labourers' wages and to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à MORIBILA-KONOSSO, un des villages de la commune de MORIBILA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.

They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the institution. They have correctly repaid their previous loans.

Minata, sitting on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to maintain 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Moribila, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 21 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay wages and to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Armanush

texts.en:
Armanush trades in women's clothing and underwear. To be financially secure and ensure a stable income for herself and her family, Armanush  started up this business six years ago. Currently, Armanush rents out trading stores at a busy metro underground market. To be compatible in the market and meet her customers' demand Armanush applied for this loan. That will give her an opportunity to purchase new stock of clothing for her store and earn higher income. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for her store

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à MORIBILA-KONOSSO, un des villages de la commune de MORIBILA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec  KARIA, 1ère femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  MORIBILA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women with an average age of 43 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in Moribila-Konosso, one of the villages in the commune of Moribila, San Circle, in the fourth administrative region of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the institution. They have correctly repaid their previous loans.

Karia, standing on the right in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to maintain 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Moribila, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 20 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay wages and to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Gloria Marleny

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos gran variedad de productos de papelería, elementos para el hogar, accesorios de belleza, entre otros, con este negocio ha intentado sacar adelante a sus hijos con una buena educación. 

Ella desea mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para dedicarse en pleno a su negocio. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como juguetería, productos de belleza, una pequeña línea de ropa interior.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman who puts in a lot of effort to face the world and to have a full life.

She has a general store in which she sells a great variety of stationary products, household items, and beauty accessories, among other things. With this business she has tried to give her children a good education. 

She hopes to improve her sales by injecting capital into her business. For this reason she is applying for a loan to give herself the opportunity to be independent and to have sufficient reason to dedicate herself fully to her business. 

She will invest the money in the purchase of goods which she doesn't currently have, such as toys, beauty products and a small underwear line.

She has great hopes for her business and thinks that her future could improve considerably thanks to the support of these organisations that make it possible for people to have a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy goods such as toys, beauty products and underwear to stock-up her business and be able to dream of a better life.

loans.name: Francisco Simon

texts.es: A sus 54 años de edad Simón tiene 6 hijas,  de las cuales 4 se encuentran estudiando, por motivo de trabajo Simon vive lejos de sus hijas, ya que es cuidador  en una finca de ganado, él también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, Simon necesita el crédito para comprar chanchos y mejorar su negocio, mismo del que aspira obtener una buena rentabilidad y seguir ayudando a sus hijas para que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
54-year-old Simón has 6 daughters, 4 of whom are studying at the moment. Because of work, Simón lives far away from his daughters, as he works on a farm caring for livestock. He also rears pigs. 

Simón needs this loan to buy pigs and improve his business, from which he hopes to obtain good profits so that he can continue helping his daughters so that they can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en:
Lanuola is 57 years old and divorced with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years.

 Lanuola needs a loan to buy a sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller, gloves, a shovel and overalls for the workers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Lanuola will use the profits from her sales to cover her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller, gloves, a shovel and overalls for the workers

loans.name: Salafune

texts.en:
Salafune is a 35-year-old, unmarried woman with 5 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Salafune needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and plastic trays. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. 

Salafune has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and plastic trays

loans.name: Shanndy

texts.en:
Shanndy is a 17-year-old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells chicken pies in her community to earn a living. To earn some extra cash, she also does elei printing. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Shanndy needs a loan to buy boneless chicken, bags of flour, a large pot, cooking oil and a strainer. As for her elei, she'll also be buying material, fabric paint, brushes and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house. 

Shanndy became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy boneless chicken, bags of flour, a large pot, cooking oil and a strainer. Also fabric paint, brushes and rollers for elei printing.

loans.name: Ulaelemamae

texts.en: Ulaelemamae is a 20-year-old unmarried woman with one child. She makes and sells barbecue in her community in order to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Ulaelemamae needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ulaelemamae has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates.

loans.name: Paxixil Group

texts.en:
Antonia is a 58-year-old married woman who has difficulty reading and writing.  However, she is entrepreneurial.  Several years ago, with support from her family, she started a small pharmacy in her home because she had many years of experience and knowledge about drugs.  This combination was excellent for achieving growth in her business.

With rising drug prices, Antonia needs to have a new investment to grow her small pharmacy.  For that reason, she is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Paxixil”.  Antonia is asking for a loan to invest in her pharmacy to purchase popular medicine and sundries that the customers in her community want, such as serums, syrups, vitamins, syringes, thermometers, cotton, alcohol, etc.

Antonia sincerely believes that being a client of Friendship Bridge has been a wonderful experience that has allowed her to grow as a person and has enhanced her self-esteem.  She is a very grateful beneficiary of the Friendship Bridge Education Program that empowers poor or extremely poor women in Guatemala to become successful.

With empowerment, Antonia is open and has become a leader of the Paxixl Trust Bank.  She has motivated more than four women to get a first loan.  They too are extremely grateful to be able to acquire more knowledge that then helps them strengthen their businesses.  Eleven Paxixil Trust Bank members from Francisco El Alto in Southwestern Guatemala send their greetings to the Kiva investors who are providing the tools they need to eliminate poverty in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase popular medicine and sundries that the customers in her community want

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.en:
Sandra is a 24 year-old married woman with two children.  She lives in the Quiche Department in Northwest Guatemala and is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Virgen del Rosario”.

For the past three years, Sandra has been dedicated to the sale of mobile telephones and now counts on locals to buy her products.  It is for this reason that she is asking for a new loan in order to buy newer phone models and accessories, such as protectors and earbuds (headphones).  She also sells airtime.  She anticipates increased sales during her town’s festival season.

Sandra and the other members of the Virgen del Rosario Trust Bank have strengthened their businesses because they receive monthly education services from their Trust Bank Officer who provides beneficial information through the Friendship Bridge Education program.  This very beneficial information positively impacts their lives by helping them with accounting, budgeting, administration, and good customer service.  All these skills help them to continue to improve and succeed in their businesses. 

Thank you Kiva investors for helping to empower the women of Guatemala!

loans.use: to buy newer phone models and accessories, such as protectors and earbuds (headphones) to sell.

loans.name: Luz De Mi Sendero Group

texts.en:
Women’s dreams need to be accomplished through education and capital credit.   With credit, many women have been successful like Marta, a married woman 52 years-old, who has seven children, three of whom are minors and in middle school.  Marta is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Luz de mi Sendero” – Light My Path.

Some time ago, her family encouraged her to start a business selling clothing and silk screening.  Now her husband makes the clothes and she does the silk screening according to her customers’ orders.  Marta’s children are involved in the process which has made the family business more successful. 

Demand for her products has made it necessary for Marta to have more capital to invest in her business.  Now she is planning to use the credit she is requesting to buy high quality paints and bolts of fabric for her silk screening. Marta is confident that the investment will generate good sales and profits, especially with the upcoming festival of the town’s patron saint “Santa Cruz del Quiche” as well as the approaching Independence Day, September 16th.

Now that Marta and her Trust Bank have financial capital and useful training from the Friendship Bridge Education Program which includes topics such as empowerment, self-esteem, and budgeting, they are successfully moving forward.  All of “Luz de mi Sendero” are very grateful to Kiva investors for helping them to accomplish their dreams!

loans.use: to buy high quality paints and bolts of fabric for her silk screening .

loans.name: Tzununa Group

texts.en:
In the Western Highlands of Guatemala, on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlán, a group of seven women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tzununá”. It is also the name of the village where they live. The determined ladies in the Trust Bank are seeking solutions to aliviate poverty in their lives by working hard and educating themselves.  The women are on their very first loan cycle! They have a variety of small businesses including sales of fruit and supplies as well as handicrafts.

Lucia is the President of the Trust Bank. She is 28 years of age and married with two children.  She was unable to access formal schooling as a child but intends to give her children an education so that they can enjoy lots of opportunities. Lucia has an orchard with “Jocote” trees.  The Jocote is a popular fruit in Central America and the Caribbean. The fruit has a thin skin which is purple-red or yellow when ripe. The flesh is juicy and acidic and can be eaten fresh (ripe or unripe), squeezed for juice or preserved.  Lucia has two workers who help her in the orchard pruning the trees, picking the fruit and packing it in boxes to sell in a large market. She is requesting a loan that she will use to plant new trees, increase sales and generate more income.

The women in the Trust Bank “Tzununá” will benefit from the monthly educational seminars given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. They will learn how to effectively manage their loans with newly acquired knowledge about effective business practices (accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing, pricing). The ladies will also learn about hygiene, health and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. 

KIVA investors play an important role in the lives of Lucia and her friends in the Trust Bank by providing essential capital for the small loans. It is most appreciated! Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to plant new trees, increase sales and generate more income.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras De Chuguexa Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is probably one of the most famous towns in Guatemala because of the huge and colorful markets held twice a week right in the middle of the town. The streets are narrow and made of cobblestones. The red-tiled roofs give the town a very picturesque look. Each Sunday, right in the middle of town, special Brotherhoods or “Cofradías“ hold processions in and around the church of Santo Tomás. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Tejedoras de Chuguexa” meaning “The Weavers of Chuguexa” is located in a rural area outside of Chichicastenango. It is composed of twelve women whose average age is 32 years. They average two years of formal education. Each has an average of four children. At 22 years of age, Margarita is the Secretary of the Trust Bank. She is the only member who understands and speaks Spanish. The rest of the women speak the indigenous language of “K'iche”. The ladies have various small businesses that include animal husbandry, agricultural endeavors and textile production.

Margarita is from a very large and poor family. She was unable to finish school due to the death of her father. Poverty robbed her of her childhood but now she is poised to step into a more successful future leaving poverty behind. She is committed to her three children and understands that education is an essential key to a brighter and more successful future. Margarita has a textile business and creates beautiful typical blouses and backpacks. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase essential items such as needles, thread and other supplies. Margarita believes in the success of her business and can visualize increased sales which will transform economic conditions in her family.

Speaking with the women in their “K'iche” language, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer attends the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank. The ladies in the group have the opportunity to acquire practical and valuable information about a variety of subjects such as self-esteem, violence against women and women’s rights. They will also learn how to manage their loans successfully with new business tools including business planning, budgeting, accounting, customer service and marketing. Their families will benefit with useful information about health, hygiene and nutrition. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus” and it truly works!

The ladies of the Trust Bank have the goal of empowering themselves and eliminating poverty in their lives. The small loans and education are of great value to these women. KIVA investors are key partners in this effort! Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase essential items such as needles, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Lago San Jorge Group

texts.en:
Mujeres Lago San Jorge is the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank in Guatemala composed of seven women who have a clear vision of a future filled with new opportunities for themselves and their children. They see themselves as empowered women eliminating poverty.
Antonia is the Treasurer of the Trust Bank. She is 48 years of age, married and has three years of formal education. She has eight children, four of whom are in middle school. Antonia is keenly aware of the value of education and is motivated to seeing that each of her children completes school. Antonia has a handicraft and textile business. She is requesting a loan to buy beads, needles, thread and other supplies. Antonia feels that her sales will increase and the family will realize additional income.
All of the women in the Trust Bank have benefited from the monthly educational talks given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. They acquire essential knowledge about health, hygiene and nutrition, as well as self-esteem and women’s rights. The women are anxious to learn how to manage their loans effectively, and so they are pleased to learn about business planning, budgeting, accounting, customer service, marketing and pricing. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the education and small loans “Microcredit Plus” and it works well. 
In providing capital for the small loans, Kiva investors are valued partners with Friendship Bridge for these women. We look forward to providing a follow-up report on Antonia and her friends in the Mujeres Lago San Jorge Trust Bank. Thank you, Kiva investors, from the women in the Trust Bank for your kindness in funding these essential loans!

loans.use: To buy beads, needles, thread and other supplies

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en: Sefulu is 30 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Sefulu has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, rollers, rubber designs, stencils and wooden carved designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, rollers, rubber designs, stencils and wooden carved designs

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à MORIBILA-KONOSSO, un des villages de la commune de MORIBILA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide et le mil avec  MAMINE HAMIDOU , 1ère femme assise de la  droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  MORIBILA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Moribila-Konosso, one of the villages in the commune of Moribila, San Circle, in the fourth administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the institution and they have correctly repaid their previous loans.

Mamine Hamidou, sitting on the right in the photo, grows groundnuts and millet. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to maintain 2 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Moribila, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 55 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay wages and to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 8 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à MORIBILA-KONOSSO, un des villages de la commune de MORIBILA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide et le mil avec ABIBATOU, femme assise au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  MORIBILA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their 3rd loan from the institution and have correctly repaid their previous loans.

Abibatou, sitting in the middle in the photo, grows groundnuts and millet. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to cultivate 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Moribila, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 50 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay wages and to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Maritza Marisol

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 29 años, es soltera, conocida en el medio, por la labor de elaboracion de cajas para dulces; vive en casa familiar con su hija de 06 años quien estudia en colegio nacional de la zona, ella es separada de su conyuge desde hace más de 05 años. Maritza cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, su comunidad está en el distrito de Zaña el cual es muy conocido por sus dulces y sus ruinas, dicho distrito esta habitado por gente respetuosa, que se dedicadan al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia, y está ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Maritza se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cajas para dulces tipicos de Zaña, desde hace más de 03 años, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores tales como cerdos y cuyes, desde hace más de 0 año, ella necesita préstamo para invertir en arreglo de su cortadora herramienta con la que realiza sus cajas para sus dulces y de esta forma ella estará asegurando el correcto funcionamiento de la misma, para poder seguir trabajando y atendiendo todos los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Maritza is 29 years old and single. She is well-known locally because she makes boxes for packing sweets. She lives in a house with her six-year-old daughter, who goes to the local public school. She divorced her husband five years ago. Her neighbors can give good references of her. Maritza lives in a community located in the Zaña district, which is famous for its sweets and it ruins. Locals are respectful people that work in commerce, agriculture and animal farming. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Maritza has been making and selling boxes, used to pack traditional sweets in Zaña, for more than three years. She also raises and sells small farm animals, such as pigs and guinea pigs.

She is requesting a loan to fix the machine she uses to cut the material she uses to make the boxes. This will help her to continue working and fulfilling all the orders from her customers.

loans.use: to fix the cutting machine she uses to make boxes.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BALIMAYA ont en moyenne 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des céréales, des condiments et des légumes.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur  6ème  prêt solidaire. NOUSSOU, 1ère femme assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  2 pièces de Wax, 5 jupes, 10 robes et 15 foulards. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Balimaya group have an average age of 46 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and they buy and sell clothing, cereals, condiments and vegetables. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Balimaya group are on their 6th group loan.

Noussou, the women sitting on the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 2 pieces of wax cloth, 5 skirts, 10 dresses and 15 scarves. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers. She makes her sales to a clientèle made up of women and men for cash and often credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15 000 francs which she will spend on health care, food, clothing and her children's education. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en: Mere is 42 years old and married with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Mere needs a loan to buy sprayers, fertilizer, a spade, a machete, a shovel, a new wheelbarrow, a crowbar and new gumboots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Mere will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, fertilizer, a spade, a machete, a shovel, a new wheelbarrow, a crowbar and new gumboots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine and an overlock machine to improve her clothing production.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 24 years old, a student and a monk in a pagoda in the city. Being a monk, he can earn approximately $5.33 per day to support his study. 

Because of the lack of financial support, Thy would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to find a good job.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is 21 years old and is a student at a university. She lives with her parents in Tbong Khmum Province of Cambodia. 

Because of the lack of financial support, Channy would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fee. This loan will help her pursue a Bachelor's degree. In the future, she wants to be an accountant in a bank.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Maima needs a loan to buy a large frying pan, cooking oil, a strainer, a new oven and bags of flour. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Maima has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a large frying pan, cooking oil, a strainer, a new oven and bags of flour.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 63 years old, married, and has nine children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Epenesa needs a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, a pitch-fork and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Epenesa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, a pitch-fork and new boots.

loans.name: Kodiagongonna 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KODIAGNOGONNA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SOLOSSO, un des villages de la commune de N’GOA cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec KARIYA ABDOULAYE, femme assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à N’GOA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 21 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kodiagnogonna 1 group are married women with an average age of 31 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in traditional families in Solosso, one of the villages in the N'Goa commune, San Circle, fourth administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their 5th loan from the institution and have properly repaid their previous loans.

Kariya Abdoulaye, the woman sitting in the middle in the photo, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labourers needed to cultivate 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in N'Goa to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 21 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay wages and to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Olataga

texts.en:
Olataga is 32 years old and unmarried with 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Olataga needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and new overalls. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Olataga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and new overalls.

loans.name: Kodiagongonna 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe KODIAGNOGONNA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SOLOSSO, un des villages de la commune de N’GOA cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le mil avec  MAMINE , femme debout au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 18 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in N'Goa to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 18 000 francs per crop cycle. loans.name: Dúo Guadalupe De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
dúo Guadalupe de villa nueva
Bella Rosa de 27 años de edad tiene dos hijos . empezó su negocio con seis libras de maíz , hasta que la gente la busco más,fue que  decidió agrandar más su negocio  y poner un rotulo con el nombre de su tortilleria para tener mejor clientela y obtener mejores ganancias, agradece a dios y a su mama por la ayuda que ha dado, su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos graduados y poder darles lo mejor.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y leña para la elaboracion y venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe de Villa Nueva Duo
Bella Rosa is 27 years old. She has two children. She started her business with six pounds of corn. When people went to her looking for more, she decided to enlarge her business and put up a sign with the name of her tortilla business to have better customers and more earnings. She thanks God and her mother for the help they have given her. Her biggest wish is to see her children graduate and be able to give them the best. She is asking for this loan to buy corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Ake

texts.en:
Ake is 26 years old, unmarried, and has three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Ake needs a loan to buy sprayers, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a wheelbarrow, new boots and a new machete. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Ake will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a wheelbarrow, new boots and a new machete.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is a 44-year-old married mother with four children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Miriama needs a loan to buy new gum boots, gloves, a new wheelbarrow, a pitch-fork, a crowbar and a new machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Miriama will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new gum boots, gloves, a new wheelbarrow, a pitch-fork, a crowbar and a new machete.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory of Amway products to improve her business and give her 5 children a better education.

loans.name: Nestor Ándres

texts.es:
Nestor de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, se ha dedicado al trabajo en una presa de vigilante, desde hace 3 años. La esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos asisten a la escuela.

 Él se ha dedicado al trabajo de vigilante por la necesidad, pero además de eso, alquila 3 habitaciones en la casa donde vive, motivo por el cual solicita el crédito pues desea comprar cemento, arena, bloque, para construir más habitaciones,  para obtener mayores ingresos, pues considera que es una forma fácil de obtener dinero, y ya que tiene la oportunidad de que la gente le busca, posiblemente en el futuro se sustente solo de los alquileres, pues el trabajo que hace es muy riesgoso por la situación de delincuencia que está el país y en especial el lugar donde vive. 

Sus sueños son a futuro tener el terreno completo construido y vivir cómodamente con los ingresos del alquiler de las habitaciones, que sus hijos sean profesionales y que se dediquen a un trabajo más cómodo.
texts.en:
Néstor, 42, studied up to ninth grade.  He has earned a living in a security company for three years.  His wife is a homemaker and he has three children, two of whom attend school.

He has worked in security out of necessity, but he also rents three rooms in his house.  He's requesting the loan to buy cement, sand, and cinder blocks to build more rooms and earn more income, because he thinks it's an easy way to earn money.  And because he has the opportunity for people to seek him out, in the future he might support himself exclusively on the rents.  His job is very risky because of the crime situation in his country and particularly the area where he lives.

His dreams for the future are to have his land completely constructed, to live comfortably with the rent income from his rooms, and for his children to be professionals and work in more secure jobs.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and cinder blocks to build more rooms to rent

loans.name: Yit Group

texts.en:
Yit is 30 years old, a farmer and a married woman living with her husband and her two children in Tbong Khmum Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2000. Her husband is 30, also a farmer. One of her children is a student. 

Now Yit would like to request a loan as leader of a group of three members. She will use her portion to buy foundation parts of a latrine. This loan will provide her a hygienic living. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland, renovate her house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts of a latrine.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Phy is 33 years old, a farmer and a married woman living with her husband and her two children in Pursat Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1990. Her husband is 35, a motor taxi driver. Together, they can earn approximately $10 per day. 

Now Phy would like to request a loan to build a toilet. This loan will provide her and her family a hygienic living. 

In the future, she is going to expand her cultivation.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 58 year old widow with 4 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Eseta needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her familly's weekly expenses. Eseta has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, strainer and yeast.

loans.name: Fagalele

texts.en:
Fagalele is 48 years old, married, and has five children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Fagalele needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, crops, a machete, a crowbar, a spade, a shovel, a pitch-fork and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Fagalele will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, crops, a machete, a crowbar, a spade, a shovel, a pitch-fork and new overalls.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a widow with 4 children who lives in the village of Zamboanga Del Sur. She has been farming for over thirty years and it is the family's main source of income. To improve the farm, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer. It is her desire to have a better life with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy is a 52-year-old married woman with 3 children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling dresses and elei printed shirts. She has been doing this for 8 years. Navy needs a loan to buy thread, needles, a sewing machine, material, hangers, ready-made shelves and tags. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2006 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a sewing machine, material, hangers, ready-made shelves and tags.

loans.name: Fatufua

texts.en:
Fatufua is a 44-year-old woman who is unmarried and has two children. 

She runs a small tailoring business in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Fatufua has requested a loan to buy threads, material, a new pair of scissors, needles, cash power (pre-paid electric power) and a measuring tape. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy threads, material, a new pair of scissors, needles, cash power and a measuring tape.

loans.name: Sefeliga

texts.en: Sefeliga is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Sefeliga needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, cooking oil, yeast, a large pot and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Sefeliga became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, cooking oil, yeast, a large pot and a new oven

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ruth se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos a quienes les garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente junto con su esposo para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una buena calidad de vida. 

Desde hace más de 10 años comenzó a trabajar vendiendo productos para el cuidado y aseo del hogar de manera ambulante, y gracias a un gran esfuerzo que hizo logró ubicarse dentro de un local y allí tiene su negocio hasta ahora donde ofrece productos para el cuidado del hogar a sus clientes. 

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Ruth busca un préstamo para comprar productos para el hogar, productos de papelería, artículos de belleza, útiles escolares, entre otros, y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su miscelánea.

De esta manera su negocio saldrá adelante y podrá ofrecer en su hogar unos buenos ingresos para que sigan teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth is married with two children, to whom she guarantees a good quality of life, thanks to her business. With it, she generates income, along with her husband, so that they can improve their home’s economic conditions and have a good quality of life. 

She started working more than 10 years ago, selling products for household care and cleaning on foot; and thanks to the great effort that she made, she was able to move to a small store where she has her business presently. There, she offers household care products to her customers.

Because her customers are increasing and demanding more and more products, Ruth is seeking a loan in order to purchase household products, stationery, beauty products, and school supplies, among other miscellaneous products, so that she can offer her customers more variety.  In this way, her business will move forward and she will be able to provide good income for her home so that they may continue having a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase household products, stationery, beauty products, and school supplies, among other items, and thus offer variety to her customers.

loans.name: Benkadi B Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI B sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKO un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur  MAMADOU SOLO  assises à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme BENKADI B. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi B group are married men with an average age of 48 and, on average, 8 children. Most of them live in traditional families in N'Goloko, a village in the Dogoni commune, Sikasso Circle, the third administrative district of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, and they have properly repaid their previous loans.

Mamadou Solo, sitting on the left in the picture, grows maize. He plans to use his loan to buy 8 50-kilo bags of fertiliser and 10 cans of herbicide of varying quality, and to pay the labourers needed to cultivate 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold for cash or credit in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientèle made up of men and women. He expects to make an average profit of 160 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his part of the loan and its interest and to contribute to the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and to pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI A sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKO un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur SEYDOU A débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme BENKADI A. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi A group are married men with an average age of 49 and, on average, 8 children. Most of them live in traditional families in N'Goloko, a village in the Dogoni commune, Sikasso Circle, the third administrative district of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, and they have properly repaid their previous loans.

Seydou, standing on the right of the group of men in the picture, grows maize. He plans to use his loan to buy 8 bags of fertiliser and 10 cans of herbicide, and to pay the labourers needed to cultivate 1 hectare of land.
