After the harvest the produce is sold for cash or credit in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientèle made up of men and women. He expects to make an average profit of 160 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his part of the loan and its interest and to contribute to the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and to pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Chính

texts.en:
Chính works in agriculture; farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Chính is 40 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her 3 dependents

In 2014, Chính joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chính has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Chính faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Chính hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married and lives with her husband. She runs a retail store while her husband does fishing. For many long years in running the business, it is not improving well and it is her only means of generating income. To help improve the business, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She is now helping her husband selling fish to earn additional income. In the future, she wants to improve the general living of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Faalogoifo

texts.en: Faalogoifo is 53 years old and married with 5 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling all sorts of handicrafts in her community to earn a living. To do this, she needs a loan to buy coconut shells, wood, a chainsaw, new spark plugs, petrol for the chainsaw and varnish. In the future, Faalogoifo hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells, wood, a chainsaw, new spark plugs, petrol for the chainsaw and varnish

loans.name: Benkadi C Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI C sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKO un village dans la commune de DOGONI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur  SALIF débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme BENKADI C. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Benkadi C group are married men with an average age of 46 and, on average, 6 children. Most of them live in traditional families in N'Goloko, a village in the Dogoni commune, Sikasso Circle, the third administrative district of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, and they have properly repaid their previous loans.

Salif, standing on the right in the group picture, grows maize. He plans to use his loan to buy 8 50-kilo bags of fertiliser and 10 cans of herbicide of varying quality, and to pay the labourers needed to cultivate 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold for cash or credit in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientèle made up of men and women. He expects to make an average profit of 160 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his part of the loan and its interest and to contribute to the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and to pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old. Edwin is a widow and has three adult children. 

Her previous loan used for this business was successfully repaid from her generated income from selling food in her village,  in order to have more food to prepare, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional cooking ingredients. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor is single and living with her family in the village in Zamboanga del Sur. She studied in the university, for she wants to help her family in the near future. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to pay her tuition fees. She is thankful of the Cooperative in helping those deserving students to fulfill their dreams of having a better future.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Namja

texts.en: Namja is a 46-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges from his shop. Presently, he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Namja has requested a loan amount from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase more variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Namja is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for reselling.

loans.name: José Bernardino

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela, pero ha aprendido a leer y escribir un poco, pues anteriormente estuvo  prestando servicio en el ejército, donde les dieron clases y fue ahí que aprendió un poco, ahí solo estuvo 3 años.

 Él se dedica al trabajo en las fincas, es muy reconocido pues es muy ágil haciendo hoyos para sembrar palos de café, también por las tardes trabaja en lo propio, cultivando maíz y frijol, para los gastos de la familia, la esposa también se dedica al jornal en las fincas, junto a su esposo, pues no tienen otra fuente de ingresos y lo hacen para que a sus hijos no les haga falta nada.

José de pequeño se ha dedicado a este trabajo, pues en la zona es la única fuente de ingreso. El crédito lo necesita para cancelar un crédito que tiene en otra institución, donde considera son más altos los intereses que le cobran, también invertirá en los cultivos la parte de dinero que le sobre.

 Él tiene un sueño y asegura estar trabajando para cumplirlo, quiere que sus hijos se han profesionales y que se dediquen a otro tipo de trabajo, pues considera que lo que él hace es muy pesado, espera contar siempre con el apoyo de credicampo, para que en los momentos de necesidad siempre se le apoye.
texts.en:
José, 35 years old, did not go to school, but he learned to read and write a little while serving in the army, where they were given classes; he was in the army only 3 years. 
He makes his living working on farms—he is well known because he is very good at digging holes to plant coffee plants. Also, in the evenings he works for himself, growing corn and beans to pay for family household expenses. His wife also works as a day laborer on farms with her husband, because they have no other source of income and do it so that their children do not lack anything. 
José has been doing this work since he was a child, as this is the only source of income in the area. He needs this loan to cancel a loan that he has with another institution, because they charge a higher interest. Also he will invest the money that is left over in his crops. 
He has a dream and says he is working to make it come true: he wants his children to be professionals and do some other kind of work, since what he does is very monotonous. He hopes to always be able to count on the support of CrediCampo in times of need.

loans.use: to cancel a loan that he has with another institution, and he will also invest the money that is left over in his crops.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, realiza actividades de albañilería y de jornalero, es acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos, uno de los cuales está estudiando nivel básico, la casa en la que vive en este momento es alquilada; José laboro durante un tiempo como ayudante, de esa manera aprendió a realizar trabajos de albañilería y como jornalero, ya con la experiencia adquirida decidió iniciar con su propio negocio y realizar sus propios proyectos, el cual funciona desde hace 15 años.
El capital que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de electricidad (como cables, focos, fusibles, aislantes, etc.) y material de construcción para finalizar su vivienda propia, tendrá energía eléctrica propia y dejara de pagar alquiler, espera brindar a su familia un hogar seguro y cómodo.
Sus sueños son terminar de pagar la propiedad en la que ha construido su vivienda, cancelar la nueva deuda adquirida, abrir un negocio en su residencia, equipar su negocio actual para continuar trabajando y dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José works in construction, and as a day-laborer. He lives with his life companion and three children, one of whom is studying in elementary school. The house in which he lives presently is rented. José worked for some time as an apprentice, and in this way learned how to carry out construction jobs and day labor. Already having acquired experience, he decided to start his own business, which has been running for 15 years now. 

He will invest the loan that he is requesting in the purchase of electrical materials—cables, light bulbs, fuses, and insulators—and in construction materials, in order to complete his own home. He will have his own electricity and he can stop paying rent. He hopes to provide his family with a safe and comfortable home. 

His dreams are: to finish paying for the property on which he has built his home, pay off the new debt that he has acquired, open a business in his residence, equip his current business in order to continue working, and give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase electrical materials such as cables, light bulbs, fuses, insulators, etc., and construction material in order to complete his own home.

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene 26 años de edad y vive en Parcona junto a su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de su abuelita pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Contabilidad y actualmente ejerce su profesión en una empresa Agroexportadora en el cargo de Asistente Contable. Gracias a la excelente educación y los valores con los que creció hoy se ha convertido en una persona de bien y los resultados se ven reflejados en el buen desempeño que tiene en su centro laboral.
Cesar quiere tener mayores oportunidades laborales es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá seguir un Diplomado y de esta manera tener mayores oportunidades laborales. Gracias a esto él seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia y poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Cesar is a very entrepreneurial person. He is 26 years old and lives in Parcona with his family. 

Thanks to the support of his grandmother, he was able to study a technical degree in Accounting and he currently practices his profession in an agroexport business in the role of Assistant Accountant. Thanks to the excellent education and the values he was raised with, today he has become a good person and the results are reflected in the good performance that he gives in his work. 

Cesar wants to have greater work opportunities and so he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support that they have brought him he will be able to continue as a postgraduate and in this way have greater work opportunities. Thanks to this he will continue strengthening himself in order to bring his family out ahead, and to be able to bring them a better future.

loans.use: to study an associates degree.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en: Joanne is 21 years old and unmarried with 2 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. Joanne has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à MEDINE un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame AMINATA debout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes DANAYA, fait la vente   pagnes wax réal.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  8 pièces  pagnes wax réal au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 5 members of the Danaya group are married women with an average age of 46 and, on average, 5 children. Most of them live in traditional families in Medine, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of Mali. This is their 13th group loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, requested so that they can satisfy their customers' needs.

Aminata, sitting second from the right in the group of women in the picture, sells réal wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She plans to use her loan to buy 8 pieces of réal wax pagnes cloth from the Grand Market. She is very much in demand due to the quality of her products, which she resells for cash or credit at the market to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 36 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: to buy réal wax pagnes.

loans.name: Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: Sandra de 21 años de edad es soltera. El grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” está conformada por 05 socios emprendedores y solidarios. Sandra se dedica a la venta de comida como el lomo saltado. Así mismo como actividad secundaria Ella labora en un call center. El deseo de Sandra es de seguir implementando su negocio de comidas, ofreciendo diversos menús. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, papa, carne de pollo y pescado. El grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” agradece  a los Inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Sandra es la  segunda del lado izquierdo y viste casaca negra.
texts.en: Sandra is 21 years old and single. The “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” communal bank is comprised of 5 enterprising and united members. Sandra works selling meals likes lomo saltado ( a traditional Peruvian beef dish). As a secondary activity she works in a call center. Sandra's wish is to continue to work in her food business offering diverse menus. So she is requesting a loan to buy rice, potatoes, chicken and fish. The "Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” are grateful to the lenders at Kiva so make this loan possible. Sandra is the second to the left in the black jacket.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, chicken and fish.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 26-year-old single parent with one child. She makes and sells popcorn in her community to earn a living. She has a year of experience in this business. Maria needs a loan to buy popcorn seed, salt, a barrel of cooking oil, a large oven, plastic bags and a block of butter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. Maria became a member of SPBD this year, to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy popcorn seed, salt, a barrel of cooking oil, a large oven, plastic bags and a block of butter for her business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame CHITAN debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes DANAYA, fait la vente   pagnes wax réal.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 pièces  pagnes wax réal au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Danaya group are married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, 5 children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of Mali. This is their 8th group loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, requested so that they can satisfy their customers' needs.

Chitan, standing on the left of the group of women in the picture, sells réal wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She plans to use her loan to buy 5 pieces of réal wax pagnes cloth from the Grand Market. She is very much in demand due to the quality of her products, which she resells for cash or credit at the market to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: to buy réal wax pagnes.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben tiene 53 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayalti, Provincia de Chiclayo, en la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, su comunidad esta habitada por personas muy tranquilas que se dedican a realizar trabajos de agricultura, ganadería y comercio de animales.

Ruben ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles, dicha inversión es para la compra de herramientas de construcción, para poder poder agregar un valor agregado al servicio que el ofrece, lo que le permitirá captar un número mayor de clientes, y por consecuente sus ingresos aumentaran, y así él podrá reportar un mayor ingreso a su unidad familiar, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruben is 53 years of age, single, and lives in his own house in Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast. His community is made up of very contented people who work in agriculture, cattle raising and animal commerce.

Ruben has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 new sols. This investment is intended to purchase construction tools, in order to add to the services he offers, allowing him to capture a larger number of customers and, consequently, to increase his income. And thus, he will be able to report a larger income to his family unit, improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction tools to expand the types of work he can do.

loans.name: Letiana

texts.en: Letiana is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Letiana needs a loan to buy foam cups, sugar, cordials, a small chest freezer, a large cooler, Chinese candy and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. Letiana has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, sugar, cordials, a small chest freezer, a large cooler, Chinese candy and rubber gloves for her business.

loans.name: Laveitiga

texts.en: Laveitiga is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She owns and operates a small store, where she sells a variety of items. She has been doing this for two years. Laveitiga needs a loan to buy canned food, frozen goods, soft drinks, snacks, a new hanging scale, and a mini fridge. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and to help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy canned food, frozen goods, soft drinks, snacks, a new hanging scale and a mini fridge for her store.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохату 29 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 2 года назад она начала свой бизнес куплей продажей детской одежды. Ее эффективность помогает ей быть успешной в бизнесе. Она продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. У нее тонкий вкус и она умеет выбрать товар, который имеет большой спрос. Несмотря на все ее достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет ее быть внимательным и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Она должна купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Malohat is 29 and married with three children. She started her own business buying and selling children's clothing two years ago with the goal of providing her family with everything they need. Her efficiency helps her to be successful in her business. She sells her goods at the local market and has a large circle of clients. She has good taste and knows how to choose inventory that will be in demand. 

Despite all of Malohat's skills, competition in the business world means she needs to be attentive and renew her inventory every season. Right now she needs to buy goods for the new season but doesn't have enough money for this. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy new inventory for the season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Marino De Jesus

texts.es:
Marino, hace buen uso de los créditos ya que ha confirmado los efectos positivos que estos le dan,  por esa razón opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar quesos, crema, cuajada, quesillo y requesón, para mantener su negocio en el mercado y seguir teniendo ingresos para continuar progresando.
Su negocio con la inversión anterior ha ganado popularidad pues se ha mantenido surtido, además ha iniciado a vender de manera ambulante sus productos para ampliar su negocio, ha cancelado sus deudas y da a su familia una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Mario makes good use of the loans now that he has confirmed their positive effects, so he is asking for a new loan to buy cheeses, cream, curd, and cottage cheese to maintain his business and continue to have an income with which to get ahead.

The previous investment helped his business gain popularity because he was able to keep it stocked.  He also started selling his producst on foot to expand his business, paid off his debts, and provided a more comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Aboubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur ABOUBACAR est né en décembre 1962 à PIMPERNA, marié, père de 3 enfants et réside chez lui-même avec ses épouses et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à MEDINE un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès monsieur ABOUBACAR s’est initié aux activités d’achat et de vente des céréales (maïs, mil), il s’approvisionne à KAFANA, à FINKOLO, à GANADOUGOU, à FAMA et les villages environnants de SIKASSO.
Il est à son septième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 10 sacs de 100 kg de maïs, 5 sacs de 100 kg de mil pour la revendre en détail dans son magasin à  MEDINE à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aboubacar was born in December of 1962 in Pimperna. He is married and the father of 3 children, and lives in his home with his wives and their children in a traditional family setting in Medine, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Having tried his hand at several businesses without success, Aboubacar has started buying and selling cereals (maize, millet). He gets his supplies in Kafana, Finkolo, Ganadougou and Fama, and the villages around Sikasso. This is his 7th individual loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, requested in order to better satisfy his growing clientèle. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

This loan will enable him to buy 10 100-kilo bags of maize and 5 100-kilo bags of millet to resell for cash or credit in his shop in Medine, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. He expects to make an average monthly profit of 105 000 francs. This profit will allow him to repay the loan and its interest, and the rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Rosa Delfina

texts.es:
Rosa de 36 años de edad, estudio tercer grado en la escuela,  debido a que para sus padres el estudio no tenía importancia, aunque ella manifiesta que hoy en día lo necesita.

 Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar  a cocinar para sus hijos, su esposo y su  mamá, lavar y hacer limpieza. Su esposo se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café, cabe mencionar que él desde hace unos 10 años administra una finca, sus dos hijos le ayudan en sus tiempos libres en los trabajos o en los oficios del hogar.

Rosa siempre se a dedicado  a lo mismo, aunque en ocasiones le ha tocado trabajar en finca, por la necesidad del dinero, pues con lo que gana el esposo no le ajusta para cubrir todos los gastos de la familia, por lo mismo solicita el presente crédito, pues tiene la idea de construir una pila para almacenar agua y un lavamanos, ya que no tiene en que guardar agua, más que en unos guacales y lo difícil es que en ocasiones no cae el agua hasta dos días, lo que hace que por la suciedad genere incomodidad a toda la familia, piensa continuar sacando créditos para mejorar las condiciones de su familia, les apoyara a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y sean profesionales, también a futuro sueña con tener un negocio (tienda o algo así).
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and studied up to Grade 3 in school due to her parents not giving it any importance. Today she says that it is necessary. She does the housework, cooking for her children, her husband and her mother, washing and cleaning. Her husband grows corn, beans and coffee. He has also managed a farm for 10 years. Her two children help her in their spare time with the work and the household chores.

Rosa has always worked doing the housework, although on occasions has had to work on the farm, as they needed money. What her husband makes does not cover all the expenses of the family. So she is requesting the present loan as she has the idea of constructing a wash stand to store water and wash. They don''t have anywhere to store water other than a few barrels. When it doesn't rain for a few days it is difficult which makes being dirty an inconvenience for the whole family. She is thinking of getting loans to improve the conditions of the family and support her children so that they can continue to study and become professionals. Her dream for the future is to have a business, a store or something similar.

loans.use: to construct a wash stand to store water and wash.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 48. She is the mother of five children. Her husband owns an electrician’s shop, in which he repairs and sells electric tube rods, bulbs and energy-saver bulbs of various brands. He also provides services to his clients by repairing electrical goods. For the growth of his business and because of his desire to maximize profits for the benefit of his family, he wants to buy more bulbs, tube rods and energy savers for his shop. Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan, so that her husband can buy them. In addition, he wants to acquire some extra items such as switches, bulbs, bulb holders, and sockets to offer to his customers. She describes her wish to borrow a larger amount after this loan. She hopes that her husband will be able to grow his business soon. Naseem thanks Kiva and its field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bulbs, tube rods and energy saver bulbs for his electrical shop.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: Gulzar is 45. She is the mother of five children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells such items as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. He covers his household necessities from his own store. Relatives like to buy from his store. He speaks with a calm voice, which is impressive; in this way; he easily wins the trust of customers. Thanks to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His store is very famous in the town; this is the reason his business is doing well. Due to these good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Gulzar has applied for a loan for her husband to use to increase his stock of items such as wheat, rice, flour, pulses (legumes), soaps, shampoo, detergents and biscuits. Gulzar hopes that her husband will use the loan in positive way, so that these funds will help him to meet demand. With increased sales, the profits will automatically increase, and she will be able to save more for her family. Gulzar is very happy and thanks Kiva and its field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more items such as wheat, rice, flour, pulses (legumes), soaps, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits to stock her husband's store, in order to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn Group

texts.en: Sokhoeurn is 58 years old, a rice farmer and a married woman with three children. She also fattens pigs for sale. She has been doing this work since 1980. Her husband is 47 years old. He traps doves in the forest to sell to people who want to buy them to release. Two of her children are construction workers, and another is a garment worker. Together, they can earn approximately $29 per day. Now Sokhoeurn would like to apply for a loan, as part of a group of five members, to build a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family with a hygienic and better living. In the future, she is going to renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy bags of charcoal to sell in her business. Grace has been in this business for nine years. Grace earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has applied for an additional loan to further build her business. Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 34-year-old married woman. Her husband provides transportation services by using a moto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled rickshaw which includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and short distances. Because of the rough roads, his rickshaw has become fully depreciated. He sold his old moto-rickshaw and wants to buy new one. But the amount he received for the old one does not fully cover the cost of the new one. This is the reason she has applied for a loan, so her husband can buy the new moto-rickshaw and can drive it smoothly. Saima thanks Kiva and its field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to help fund the purchase of  moto-rickshaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia lives in Rawalpindi. She is 34 years old and has four children. She is a hardworking housewife and is self-employed. Given her family needs, she started a small tailoring business where she sews clothes, a skill she learned from her mother. This income has helped her family cover their expenses. But, given their increasing family needs, it has become difficult to meet them with such a small income. Therefore she wants to put more effort into her business and wants to increase her earnings by sewing more clothes. For this purpose, she applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to buy more material for her tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy more material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jacobo Noel

texts.es:
Jacobo, vive con su esposa y dos hijas de 4 y un año de edad, no tiene familia en el extranjero; trabaja de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde en la agricultura, cultiva granos básicos, desde que era un niño aprendió a desempeñar esta actividad junto a con su padre y en la actualidad la realiza para generar  ingresos económicos con los que cubre los gastos de su hogar.
Utilizará el capital para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla, para continuar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, espera tener todo lo necesario para sembrar en el tiempo justo, aumentar su productividad, mejorar sus ingresos y tener una economía más estable.
Su aspiración es mantenerse trabajando para dar a sus hijas el apoyo incondicional en su formación académica.
texts.en:
Jacobo lives with his wife and two daughters, who are 4 and 1 year old respectively. He doesn't have family abroad. He works from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. in agriculture. He grows basic grains. He learnt this occupation from his dad when he was a little boy. In the present, he does it to bring an income to cover his house expenses. He'll use the money to buy compost, fertilizer, weed-killer, and seeds to keep growing corn and beans.

He hopes to have everything he needs to sow in the right time, to increase his productivity, to improve his income, and to have a more steady financial situation. He hopes to keep working so he can support his daughters with their education.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, insecticide, weed-killer, and seeds to keep growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married and has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Elsa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей занимается теплицами и выращивает овощи на собственном участке в с. Водяное уже 15 лет. Всю жизнь он жил и работал в селе. Огородом занимался с родителями, они помогли купить свой дом, когда женился. Дальше Сергей все делал сам. Развил довольно хороший бизнес, имеет неплохой доход. На данный момент у него есть три земельных участка, два оформлены на него, третий на жену. На них находится 12 больших теплиц и две под рассаду. Все отапливается, накрыто тремя пленками. Выращивает Сергей в основном помидоры и огурцы. 
Сумму в 30 000 гривен Сергей планирует вложить в покупку удобрений, пленки и семян. Дополнительную прибыль, полученную с сезона, Сергей надеется вложить в строительство нового дома, которым его семья занимается параллельно с ведением бизнеса. На данный момент дом уже обложили кирпичом, вставили окна.
texts.en:
Sergei has had greenhouses and grown vegetables on his own piece of land in the village of Vodyanoye for 15 years. He has lived and worked in this village his whole life. He worked in the garden with his parents, and they helped him buy his house when he got married. Everything else he did on his own. He has developed quite a good business and has a decent income. At the moment he has three parcels of land, two owned by him and one by his wife. They have 12 large greenhouses on the land and two for seedlings. Everything is heated and covered with three layers of plastic film. For the most part Sergei grows tomatoes and cucumbers.

Sergei plans to invest the sum of 30,000 grivens into purchasing fertilizers, plastic film and seeds. He hopes to put any additional profits earned this season into building a new house, something his family is undertaking at the same time as taking care of the business. So far they have laid bricks and put in windows in this house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, plastic film for his greenhouses and seeds

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKAN sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame ASSAN debout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes BENKAN, fait la vente   pagnes wax réal.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 pièces  pagnes wax réal au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkan group are  married women averaging 36 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in Ouayerma, a working-class neighborhood in the  town of Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali.
They are on their eight solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of meeting customer demand.

Mrs. Assan, the first one standing from right to left in the group photo, sells traditional  real wax [double-sided] “pagnes” fabric. 
She plans to use her loan to buy five sets of real wax “pagnes” at the big market, where she is well-known for the quality of her products. She will resell the sets retail, to a mixed clientenel, for cash and on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 30,000 West African francs, a part of which will be used to pay off the loan with interest and the rest  used  for her savings.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy needles, thread and fabric as well as a serger.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 53-year-old lady.  She is living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession; he manufactures and renews spare vehicle parts. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles. His lathe machine is now out of order due to continuously working and is in need of maintenance. He has spent all his savings on raw material for manufacturing and spare parts. He does not have cash in hand to fix the lathe machine.

Jamila has requested a loan for her husband so he can fix the lathe machine. She is now relaxed because she hopes that her husband can operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix the lathe machine.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитала 4 детей. У Нуржамал высшее медицинское образование. На протяжении многих лет работает в районной больнице. Нуржамал известна как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек. Нуржамал с 2004 года в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, начала свой бизнес в увеличении поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в полеводстве. На сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Нуржамал имеется: 50 овец и земельный надел мерою 0,88 ГА, где она выращивает многолетние травы. Доходы от бизнеса Нуржамал вложила в увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на закупку лошади и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Нуржамал планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также намерена в будущем отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Nurzhamal is 56 and married with four children. She has a higher education in medicine and has been working in the regional hospital for many years. She is known as a principled, honest and kindhearted person. She started a business in animal husbandry and agriculture in 2004 as a means of creating an additional source of income for her family, and now brings in 30,000 KGS every month. She has 50 sheep and 0.88 hectares of land on which she grows perennial forage grasses. 

Nurzhamal has put profits from her business into increasing her head count of livestock. In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to buy a horse and feed. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock as well as to save toward renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase a horse and feed

loans.name: Jose Jilmer

texts.es:
José Jilmer tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el Caserío El Frayle del Distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; tiene un hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos de 15; 13; 12 y 03 años de edad, los cuales estudian en las escuelas de la zona, José vive y trabaja en comunión con su Distrito, vive en la parte rural del Caserío pero cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza José Jilmer es la elaboración de pan, bizcochos y dulces hace ya 10 años, pero también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales menores, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para implementar su negocio, comprar materia prima para elaborar sus deliciosos manjares que oferta a su vecinos y clientes, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Jilmer is 33 years old. He lives in El Frayle village in Santo Tomás district, in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. He has a stable household along with his wife and four children aged 3, 12, 13 and 15 years old who study in a local school. José lives and works in his district, which is in the rural part of the village but he has water and electricity.

José Jilme's business is making bread, biscotti and pastry, which he has done for 10 years. He also farms and raises small animals and has much experience in this field. The loan will be used to help his business buying raw materials to make his delicious foods to offer to his neighbors and clients. Doing this he can make more money and be able to improve the quality of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make his delicious food.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей имеет большие планы на второй урожай, надеясь удвоить доходы в два раза. Пока она все вкладывает в развитие своего дела. Сергей недавно взял участок земли у родителей, они уже не занимаются. Там две большие теплицы, в которые он вложил средства, чтобы запустить их в работу. 
В этом году всё очень подорожало и продолжает дорожать, поэтому все свободные средства Сергей вложил в покупку удобрений, пленки, а также помог сыну и сестре, которая выдавала замуж дочь. Так как сейчас и семена также очень дорожают, а сейчас есть возможность приобрести качественные, Сергей решил обратиться к КИВА, чтобы получить дополнительные средства и купить семена уже и на следующий год. Сумма необходимая ему для этого — 15 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Sergei has big plans for his second harvest and hopes to double his revenue. He has been investing everything back in his business. He recently inherited a piece of land from his parents, who weren't working it anymore. It has two big greenhouses which he has spent time and money fixing up so that he can use them.

This year prices have risen and continue to rise, and therefore Sergei put all his money toward buying fertilizers and plastic film as well as helping his son and his sister, whose daughter got married. Seeds have gotten more expensive too and he now has the ability to buy good ones, so Sergei decided to turn to Kiva, so he can borrow some money and buy seeds both for this year and next year. The sum he needs for this is 15,000 grivens.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for  the next season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a candy making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming coconut.  Marlyn is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc., for her candy making business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Melida

texts.en:
Melida is 38 years old and married. She has three children who are in school.

Melida is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She hasrequested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Melida has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 21 years old with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling Natasha and MSE products in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lilibeth has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business direct selling Natasha and MSE products for 2 years and also earns an income from a general store. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Luningning works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines.  Luningning is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Luningning has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Horaldo

texts.es: Edwin es un joven colombiano de 24 años de edad, tiene una hija de un año de edad, él se dedica a trabajar al jornal desde hace 5 años, y son  2 años que juntamente con su madre cría chanchos en unos cerrados  de madera que el mismo construyo y por el que paga arriendo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para ampliar su negocio y de ahí  aspira  mejorar sus ingresos, para apoyar a su madre que también es colombiana y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en: Edwin is a young 24 year old Colombian.  He has a one year old daughter, has been a laborer for five years, and has been raising pigs with his mother for the past two years, in some wooden pens that he built himself becasue he rents.  He will use the money from this loan to buy pigs to expand his business and increase his income, support his mother, who is also Colombian,  and improve his daughter’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El socio Vicente se sigue dedicando al negocio de construccion civil el socio hace trabajos como pinturas de casas y construccion de casas,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener una empresa de construccion.El socio solicita el credito para comprar pinturas y cemento.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vicente continues to work on civil construction projects, such as painting houses and building houses.  He has had this business for several years and things are going well for him.  His dream is to have a construction company.  He is asking for this loan to buy paint and cement.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint and cement.

loans.name: Azra Batool

texts.en:
Azra Batool is a 39-year-old lady living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years, but his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw body but he does not have a sufficient amount to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Azra Batool has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy the auto rickshaw body. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix the auto rickshaw's body

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 43 years old. She is mother of two daughters and four sons. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a cooking oil shop in the town. He has been running this business for many years. He buys cooking oil from the main market at the wholesale rate and sells at profitable rates from his shop. He manages his household necessities from his own shop as well. He speaks with an impressive tone and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationships with his customers. His cooking oil shop is very famous in the town, which is the reason his business running well. Because her husband wants to increase his business, Parveen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help his cooking oil business. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Grupo Chuisanto Group

texts.es:
La agricultura se ha convertido en un campo laboral para Diego de 65 años de edad que se ha dedicado al cultivo de bananos en los alrededores de su comunidad para tener un ingreso económico para el sostenimiento de cinco hijos que el tiene, los primeros 3 hijos que el tiene ya tienen familias apartes y los 2 últimos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Diego se encuentra 1ra de derecha a izquierda de la playera de color naranja)

El obtiene sus ingresos a la producción de banano dicha actividad lo viene realizando durante 50 años, Diego a tomado los obstáculos de la vida como un reto para poder superarse y a el le ha ido bien gracias a su padre que le enseño dicha actividad que le genere un ingreso económico y ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El se ha convertido en un líder ejemplar en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de personas se han juntado con Diego para emprender juntos la producción de bananos para que ellos también mejoren sus condiciones de vida en el futuro.

El uso respectivo que el  dará al préstamo que esta realizando es para el mantenimiento de banano ya que para el es muy importante que las plantaciones de bananos con que el cuenta de mejores frutos para poder abrir más campos para la venta del mismo. Una de las aspiraciones de el es la plantación de de más  plantas de bananos para agrandar más su producción y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Agriculture has become a field of work for Diego, 65 years old, who has worked cultivating bananas in the surrounding areas of his community in order to have an economic income that will support his 5 children. The first 3 children already have their own families, and the last two are students in the school in their community. (Diego can be found first from the right in the orange coloured t-shirt).

He obtains his earnings through the production of bananas, an activity which he has been doing for 50 years. Diego has taken life's obstacles as a challenge in order to overcome his situation and things have gone well for him thanks to his father who taught him this work, which generates for him the earnings and income to be able to improve his family's living conditions. 

He has become an exemplary leader in his community and it is because of this that a group of people have joined with Diego to together undertake banana production in order that they too can improve their living conditions in the future. 

The loan will be used for the maintenance of his banana crops because for him it is very important that the banana plantations which he counts upon yield better fruits, to then be able to open more fields and sell even more. One of his aspirations is that the plantation yields more banana plants in order to grow his production, and also to see that his children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to maintain his banana crops

loans.name: José

texts.es: José de 31 años de edad,  es padre de  2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 6 años. Él tiene 2 años de experiencia en la preparación de comidas rápidas, negocio que inició observando lo concurrido del sector, donde hoy esta ubicado, pues a su alrededor existen estaderos, discotecas, viviendas y con ello surgió la necesidad,  de dar respuesta a todos los que disfrutaban de actividades sociales en este sector. Inicialmente comenzó con un carro de perros calientes, hoy cuenta con un ayudante y vende productos variados, como hamburguesas, perros calientes, salchipapas, refrescos etc. En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a domingos, desde las 6 de la tarde, hasta las 10 de la noche comprando los insumos donde los proveedores que lo surten con cómodos precios y que le permiten hacer una oferta efectiva a su clientela. En la actualidad José tiene como meta,  ampliar su negocio, con vías de más adelante tener un local y finalmente adquirir su propia vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fritadora, una vitrina e insumos,  lo cual aumentará la variedad de sus productos y dará una mejor presentación a su negocio, haciendo que este mejore con el credikiva invertido en él.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old. He is a father to two children ages 3 and 6. He has 2 years of experience in the preparation of fast food, a business he began when he noticed the boom in the sector, where today he is located, as there are pubs, clubs, and homes; therefore arose the need to respond to everyone who enjoys social activities in this sector.  He started with a hot dog cart, and today he has an assistant and he sells various products such as hamburgers, hot dogs, salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dog), soft drinks etc... Nowadays, he works Monday to Sunday from 6 pm to 10 pm buying supplies where the suppliers provide him with good prices which allows him to offer his clients deals. 

José’s goals are to expand his business, having his own fixed location and finally to have his own house. His is applying for a loan with Kiva, his first loan, made at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will purchase a fryer, a display case and supplies which will increase the variety of his products and give a better presentation of his business.

loans.use: to purchase a fryer, a display case and supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Dúo las Victorias de Villa Nueva
Madelin  Betzali  de 25 años tiene 3 hijos, empezó su negocio de  productos de Limpieza   
Con Q.500.00 que le quedaron de su trabajo  su mayor anhelo es tener un mejor negocio y llegar a ver  a sus hijos  grandes, para apoyarlos en todo lo que necesiten. Agradece a dios y a sus padres  por la enseñanza que le dieron, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de más productos de limpieza para la venta , también para comprar cosméticos
texts.en: This is the “Las Victorias de Villa Nueva Madelin.”  Betzali is 25 years old, has three children, and started her cleaning products business with Q.500.00 that she had left over from her previous job.  Her greatest dream is to have a better business and see her children grow up and provide everything they need.  She is grateful to God and her parents for teaching her.  She is asking for this loan to buy more cleaning products to sell.  She will also buy cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Romy Sarely

texts.es:
Romy es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en Ucayali junto a su cónyuge y su hijo.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia y sobre todo su pequeño, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace para poder brindarle mayores oportunidades en la vida. Desde hace más de 1 año viene desempeñando el puesto de Asistente en un Estudio Contable y siempre le va bien porque tiene un buen desempeño laboral.
Romy está iniciando un pequeño negocio de venta de Ropa y quiere una ayuda para poder comprar mercadería. Es por ello que está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá comprar toda la mercadería de temporada que necesita para sacar adelante su negocio. De esta manera tendrá un ingreso adicional y así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando para sacarlos adelante.
texts.en: Romy is an entrepreneurial young woman who's 21 years old. She lives in Ucayali with her spouse and son. Her biggest motivation in her life is her family, and above all her child. That's why she tries hard in everything she does so she can provide him with better opportunities in life. For over a year she has held the position of Assistant at an accounting firm and things always go well for her because she has a good work ethic. Romy is starting a small clothing retail business and wants some help purchasing merchandise. That's why she's very grateful to Kiva lenders because the help they're giving will allow her to buy all the seasonal merchandise she needs to keep her business running. This way she'll have extra income and thus improve her family's quality of life and continue fighting to get them ahead in life.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her clothing retail business

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es:
María Tomada tiene 44 años, es conviviente, conocida en el medio, por la labor de crianza y venta de animales menores. Vive en casa familiar con hijo de 15 años quien estudia en colegio nacional de la zona, su conyuge trabaja en una empresa agrícola de la zona desde hace más de 02 años. MAría es una persona con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Vive en una comunidad ubicada a 08 kms de Cayalti, habitada por gente de campo que se dedica a la agricultura y crian de animales, provincia de Ciclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Tomasa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos y patos, desde hace más de 05 años, ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en arreglo de motor de su moto carguera, ya que es con esta con la transporta a sus animales para la venta, con esto María podrá asegurar el translado de sus animales para su posterior venta y asi sus ingresos no se vean afectados.
texts.en:
Maria Tomasa is 44 years old, lives with her partner, and is known for her work in raising and selling small animals. She lives in the family home with her 15 year old son who's attending a public high school in the area and her spouse who has worked at a local agricultural business for over 2 years. Maria is a person who's spoken highly of by her neighbors. She lives in a community that's located 8 kilometers away from Cayalti, and is inhabited by rural people that work in agriculture and animal raising. It's in the province of Ciclayo in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.
Maria Tomasa works in the raising and selling of small animals such as pigs and ducks, and has done so for over 5 years. She needs the loan to invest in repairs for her cargo motorcycle, since that's what she uses to transport the animals to market. With this, Maria would be able to guarantee the transportation of the animals to market to be sold and avoid loss of income.

loans.use: To invest in repairing her cargo motorcycle, since that's what she uses to transport the animals to market

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo and other items for her general store.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years. Zenaida earns additional income from farming and selling rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo and other items

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is an enthusiastic entrepreneur living in Rawalpindi. She is 42 years old and has six children. Not only does she look after her house, she also contributes to the family income. She sells clothes from her house.This business has empowered her to pay for the daily expenses of her family. She has been selling clothes for over six years now. Her main objective is to save money for her children's education. But currently their expenses exceed the family's income. Therefore, Shahida wants to increase her business by buying more clothes of different varieties to meet her customers' demand. She wants her business to grow to earn more money to meet family requirements. She has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help her buy more clothes to increase her business

loans.use: to buy more clothes to increase her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ruth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer.

Ruth has been farming rice for 30 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a long-time member of BRAC and receiving her first loan through Kiva. She is receiving the loan for her husband, who drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving the auto rickshaw for many years using petrol, which is very costly. 

Due to the increase in the cost of petrol, Zahida's husband sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new CNG rickshaw. With the contribution of savings and the selling price of the old rickshaw, they are still short of the amount needed to buy a new CNG rickshaw. Therefore, Zahida contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Through the loan amount her husband will buy a CNG rickshaw, so he can minimize fuel expenses and grow his income.

Zahida seems very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy CNG rickshaw for driving.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 33 years old and married with three children in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Ailyn has been pig fattening for three years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 48 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of beauty products to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of beauty products to sell

loans.name: Kan Kyi Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Myothit township, this community currently has 32 village customers, including three CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This year, rainfall is erratic, threatening this season's harvest. Sesame is the main crop for this village. Additionally, access to credit is quite limited, as the country's largest provider, the state-owned agricultural bank, is not active in this region.  The village is quite small, as there are only about 80 households. They earn money mainly by farming and raising livestock. Although the village is small, it regularly celebrates Buddhist cultural ceremonies, such as offering provisions to the village's 40 monks. 

This new loan will help this community purchase farming inputs, such as fertilizer and high-quality sesame seeds. Sesame grains are $60 and groundnut grains are $40 for one acre. The extra income will be used for household expenses and community development projects.  For example, villagers are raising funds to complete the construction of the village's primary school, which is in need of floors.   

Pictured above are the committee members from the Kan Kyi Village CBO: U Tin, Daw Mar, and Daw Than. Included in the photo (first from the right) is U Tin, the father of three children. His children are still students. His eldest son has to go to secondary school about two miles from village because there is only a primary school in the village. U Tin will purchase farming inputs such as fertilizer and high quality groundnut and sesame seeds with his next loan.

loans.use: purchase farming inputs such as fertilizer and high-quality sesame seeds to boost crop yields

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en: Maurine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as disciplined. She operates a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Dúo Estrellas De San Mateo Group

texts.es: Dúo Estrellas de San Mateo este Grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Candelaria de 55 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando para la compra de mas mercaderia para la venta de producto de consumo diario ya que sus clientes han aumentado y nececita de mas capital para generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The group Duo Estrellas de San Mateo consists of Ms. Maria Candelaria who is 55 years old. For the last few years she has made a living selling everyday products. In this opportunity, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise for her business selling everyday consumer goods now that her clientele has increased and she needs more capital to generate better earnings.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soap, bread, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to own  a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, eggs, noodles, and shampoo for her general store business.

Rosalia has been in this business for nine years. Rosalia earns additional income from buying and selling fertilized duck eggs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, eggs, noodles, and shampoo.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a fishing net and gasoline for her boat.

Nelly has been in this business for 30 years. Nelly earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure her future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. Angelina is married and has a buy-and-sell plastic ware business in the Philippines.

Angelina requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more plastic ware to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for eight years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic ware to sell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia is 49 and a responsible mother of three daughters and three sons. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing services by driving a tractor and trolley for many years. He uses his vehicle for loading and provides cargo services to the people of his community. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Razia’s husband needs to repair his tractor because its current condition is not good. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to afford vehicle maintenance costs. Therefore Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Razia‘s husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. In this way he can provide better loading and cargo services to earn a profitable income. Razia also plans to build a savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's tractor and trolley.

loans.name: Khuyen

texts.en: Mrs. Khuyen is a hardworking woman, 48 years old. She is married and has five children, four of them have jobs. She sells fish and has been in this business for 20 years. She has also daily income from garden such as chicken, duck and vegetables. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To re-stock 100 bunches of banana

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Mrs. Hue, 48 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and her son. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Animal Husbandry and fishing are  main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity and selling fish, which her husband caught.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: This is Serah. She is married and a mother of two children. She has been doing subsistence farming for the last ten years where she experienced low productivity,lack of growth and inadequate income to support her family. This was because of lack of capital. She also lacked understanding of better methods of farming and never considered her farming as a business. With the training acquired from the Microfinance institution on agribusiness, she now wants to grow and make her farming more profitable. With a loan from Kiva, Serah will increase productivity and earn adequate finances to support her young family

loans.use: to pay for expansion of her horticulture farm and buy quality seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 45-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is passing her life with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods. Rubina cooks some dishes for the restaurant. People like to eat from her husband's restaurant. He hired a worker for his restaurant, and he has to pay salary to that worker. He has been running his restaurant for many years – this is the reason most of the chairs, utensils and crockery have broken. He wants to buy new plastic furniture, utensils and crockery, but most of his income is spent on household expenses. Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils and crockery. 

Rubina thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support to her.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, utensils and crockery for a restaurant.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Hello Lenders! Meet Carolyne, a 29-year-old farmer from a remote village in Kwanza, Kitale area. She resides with her 40-year-old husband with whom she is blessed with three boys and a beautiful daughter. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 10 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crop at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality which will translate to more income. Apart from increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to his family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina de 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijas, desde hace ocho años se dedica a vender pupusas y panes, antes trabajaba como empleada doméstica y ahora también se dedica a la compra y engorde de cerdos.

Ella trabaja en la venta de pupusas, pero ahora se está dedicando a la compra de cerdos para incrementar los ingresos, ya que la situación económica está cada vez más dura y tiene que hacer diferentes actividades para sustentar los gastos.
