El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de tres credos y concentrado para ellos mismos, así crecerá en su negocio e incrementar los ingresos económicos en su hogar.

Ella anhela poder tener un hogar mejor para sus hijas y que no pasen tantas necesidades económicas como ella en su niñez.
 
En la fotografia se muesta a Reina, cuando realizaba sus compras en el mercado, para elaborar sus panes y pupusas.
texts.en:
Reina is 53 years old, is married and has two daughters. For the last eight years she has made a living selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and bread. Before that she worked as a housekeeper, and now she also buys and fattens pigs.

She works selling pupusas, but is now buying pigs in order to increase her income since the economic situation is getting more difficult, and she needs to do different activities to cover her expenses.

She will use the loan to buy three pigs and feed for those pigs. In this way, she will expand her business and increase her household's economic income.

She longs to be able to have a better home for her daughters and that they will not suffer from as many economic needs as she did during her childhood.
 
The photograph shows Reina when she was making her purchases in the market which she uses to make her bread and pupusas.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and feed for the pigs in order to expand her business and increase the economic income of her household.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en: Sadaf is 25 years old and a mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Sadaf has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sadaf is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the rickshaw repairing cost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, and potato and pea seeds to improve and boost his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more supplies for her grocery and to open another grocery store branch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business stock with 50 bunches of banana and to buy fertilizer for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, washing soap and other items. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the 25,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as disciplined. He operates a retail business, where he sells sugar, salt, soap, bread, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of funds.

He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock, including sugar, soap, salt, and other items. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He repaid his previous loan successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the store, including sugar, soap, and salt.

loans.name: Hernanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Hernanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Hernanie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Hernanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Nancy, 52 years of age and a visionary, hardworking and humble farmer who is based in Koroma, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She is married and is blessed with five children who she treasures and cherishes. She has been practicing mixed farming on her inherited small piece of land for the last 38 years. She is considered among the best farmers in her rural village because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, and she offers advice to young, upcoming farmers. 

Her primary source of income has been milk, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” 

Her hobby is milking Wanja and Njeri (the names of her dairy cows). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. 

Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back fully the loan, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Nancy is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also start a selling dairy product such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Melvin Armando

texts.es:
Melvin, es propietario de una granja de gallinas ponedoras, su negocio lo estableció hace 3 años, para tener una fuente de ingresos con los que puede costear sus gastos personales y aportar en otros gastos del hogar; Melvin es soltero, no tiene hijos, actualmente vive con uno de sus hermanos. 
Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital para hacer mejoras en la infraestructura de la granja, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones a las gallinas y a aumentar la producción de huevos, espera mantener su negocio funcionando y lograr estabilizarse económicamente. 
Sus proyectos son mejorar sus ingresos, cancelar sus deudas, de esta manera tener un patrimonio cuando llegue el momento de formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Melvin is the owner of a farm of laying hens. He established his business three years ago in order to have a source of income to cover his personal expenses and to help out with other household expenses. Melvin is single with no children. He is currently living with one of his brothers. 

He finds it necessary to request capital in order to make improvements to the infrastructure of the farm. This will allow him to keep the hens in better conditions and increase the production of eggs. He hopes to keep his business running and to manage to gain economic stability. His projects are to increase his income, cancel his debts, and in this way have assets when he is ready to start his own family.

loans.use: to make improvements to the infrastructure of the farm which will allow him to keep the hens in better conditions.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es: Alejandra es una señorita de buen carácter, ella vive con su madre y sus hermanos mismos que se encuentran estudiando, comenta que su padre ya es fallecido, Alejandra tiene la aspiración de ponerse un negocio de una cafetería alado de una lavadora de vehículos que queda frente a la casa en la que vive Alejandra, dice ve la necesidad de poner un puesto de comida para los  clientes que llegan a hacer mantenimiento a los vehículo,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una cafetera, vajilla, café, pastas  y demás mercadería para adecuar sus pequeño negocio, lo que Alejandra aspira es mejora su negocio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a young woman of good moral character.  She lives with her mother and her brothers and sisters, who are in school.  She states that her father has died.  Alejandra has the desire to create a fast-service coffee shop for a car wash that is located opposite the house where she lives.  Alexandra says she sees the need for a place to eat for customers who come in for vehicle maintenance.

  She will invest the loan to buy a coffee machine, crockery, pastries and other merchandise to outfit her small business.  Alexandra's dream is to improve her business and keep working.

loans.use: to buy a coffee pot , crockery, pastries, etc. to set up a small business

loans.name: Rosario Arely

texts.es:
Rosario de 21 años de edad, realizo sus estudios en el centro escolar, estudio hasta el 6° grado, ella vive aun con sus padres, siendo ellos una motivación para sacar el crédito pues ellos trabajan con cerdos.

Rosario tiene el negocio de cerdos desde hace ya 5 años, el cual  lo hace con su madre ya que ella a vivido de ese negocio desde hace 15 años, ellas compran y engordan  cerdos, para  aportar económicamente al hogar.

El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de tres cerdos para seguir con su negocio y para la compra de alimentos y vitaminas para una cerda que está embarazada.

Rosario sueña con mejorar y crecer en su negocio, para así poder tener mayores ingresos económicos y mejorar su nivel de vida y de sus padres.
texts.en: Rosario is 21 years old, attended school at the educational center, and completed up to the 6th grade. She still lives with her parents, and they are one of the reasons behind her requesting a loan, since they work with pigs. Rosario has had her pig business for five years now, and she operates it with her mother since she has made a living from this line of work for 15 years. They buy and fatten pigs to financially support the household. She'll use the loan to buy three pigs to keep her business running and to buy feed and vitamins for a pregnant sow. Rosario dreams of growing and improving her business, so she can have higher income and improve she and her parents' quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase three pigs to keep her business going and to buy feed and vitamins for a pregnant sow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional poultry

loans.name: Thuc

texts.en: Mrs. Thuc  is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Fishing is main income of her family. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from selling fish, which her husband caught. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Mrs. Tuyet is 47 years old. She is married and has three children, so she works very hard to provide for them .Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing . She is interested to improve the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a latrine.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and cabbage for her grocery store and to purchase an umbrella to shelter her business.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San is 33 years old, married and has two  children. She works hard to support her family. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family and she is able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Mrs. Binh  is 46 years old, married and lives with her husband and four children.  She has been working in fish business for more than 20 years. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family, especially her children and also contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Mrs. Anh is 26 years old, married and has a baby. She lives with her parents,  her husband and her kid in a small house and without a hygienic latrine . The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can improve the health of her family members, especially her kid. With support from her parents and her husband, she is able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке в г. Каменка 21 год. У него — 3 теплицы для помидор и одна для рассады, все отапливается. Кроме помидор выращивают еще в основном огурцы и перец. Тепличным делом Владимир занялся, когда потерял работу. Тогда и теплицы сам делал, и отопление проводил.  
Сумма в 25 000 гривен понадобилась Владимиру для того, чтобы закупить уголь на следующий сезон. Прибыль от теплиц планирует вкладывать в развитие хозяйства, ремонт котла для отопления, ремонт теплицы для рассады, которую нужно переделать, так как той, что есть, уже недостаточно,  а также в ремонт дома, который давно назрел.
texts.en:
Vladimir has been involved in growing vegetables on his own plot of land in the town of Kamenka for 21 years. He has 3 heated greenhouses for tomatoes and one for seedlings. Besides tomatoes, he also primarily grows cucumbers and peppers. Vladimir got involved in the agricultural business when he lost his job. That's when he built the greenhouses by himself and installed the heating system.

Vladimir needs an amount of 25 000 hryvnia to buy coal for the next season. He plans to invest the profit from the greenhouses into developing his business, repairing a heating boiler, repairing the seedlings greenhouse that needs to be redone because the existing one no longer has the space, and also repairing his house - work that has been waiting for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase coal for the next season

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as obedient. She operates a food stall, where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of funds.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale

loans.name: Jhon Walter

texts.es:
Jhon Walter tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa familiar con su conyuge y su menor hijo de 03 años de edad. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos, Jhon viv en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jhon se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en la zona de Cayalti, desde hace más de 05 años; su conyuge también aporta ingresos a la canasta familiar ya que ella se dedica ala venta de soya. El destino del préstamo es para invertir en la compra de animales (chanchos,gallina,patos) y también para la compra de la alimentos de engorde para los mismos, para poder después venderlos a un mejor precio, lo que hará que sus ingresos aumenten, crecan sus ganancias y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jhon Walter is 30 years old, in a relationship, and lives in his family's house with his partner and his little 3 year old son.  He has a good reputation with his neighbors.  Jhon lives in a community where people work in business, agriculture and raising cattle, located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

For more than five years, John has earned his living growing and selling small animals and birds in the area of Cayaltí.  His partner also provides support for family needs since she works at selling soya.  The loan will go to buy pigs, chickens and ducks and also to buy the food to fatten them, in order to later sell them at a better price.  This will make their income rise, increase their profits and thus improve the quality of life for Jhon Walter and his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens and ducks and also food to fatten them

loans.name: Makuti A Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her mid 40s, is married with one daughter who is still at school.  She has been running different types of projects. She runs a beauty salon, sells charcoal, and soft drinks.  She has been in her projects since 2003.  She works from 08 am to 09 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Mariam's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling charcoal, started a salon business, and increase the charcoal stock.  She is happy with the loan, and appreciated Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  
 
She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.  She dreams of building her own house and living a better life.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group, "Makuti A", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Marissa has been in this business for six years. Marissa earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.  Pacita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi appreciates the previous loan, which helped her expand her business. Umazi has been operating a business, selling paraffin to her neighbors for use in cooking, at retail. In addition, she operates a phone-charging business, which earns her another stream of income. She faces a challenge of delayed payments, and hence low profits, in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase cement and sand for construction; she plans to establish a rental house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand, for construction of a house to rent out.
